loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando, es propietario de una radio, el aprendió esta actividad mediante cursos, ofrece el servicio de publicidad de los negocios de la zona, también posee una mini librería cristiana, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde; Armando es casado, solamente vive con su esposa, él procura proveer su hogar con lo necesario para subsistir.
El crédito lo invertirá en dar mantenimiento al equipo de trabajo para continuar mejorando su negocio, espera brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y tener ingresos mayores con los que piensa cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
Su visión es tener recursos económicos para reemplazar su equipo de trabajo por uno más moderno y así seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Armando is the owner of a radio. He learned about this business activity through courses. He offers an advertising service to local businesses. He also has a small Christian bookstore. His working hours are from 8:00am until 5:00pm. He is married and lives with his wife. He tries to provide his household with everything that is necessary to survive.

He will invest this loan in maintenance for his working equipment so he can continue improving his business. He hopes to offer his clients a good-quality service and to have a higher income in order to comply with his financial obligations.

His vision is to have financial resources to replace his working equipment with more modern equipment in order to continue making progress.

loans.use: to maintain his working equipment so he can continue improving his business.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, continua con su negocio de tienda, venta de ropa usada y artículos de revista, ella sabe que al invertir créditos en su negocio puede abastecerlo muy rápido con lo necesario para seguir teniendo ingresos, opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar fardos de ropa usada y diferentes productos de revista con los que mantendrá a sus clientes satisfechos.
La ayuda del préstamo anterior ha sido muy oportuna para mantener su negocio funcionando, sus ingresos y nuevos clientes han aumentado. La familia vive en mejores circunstancias y continúa teniendo el mismo número de miembros.
texts.en:
Ana is still running her business selling used clothing and catalog items. She knows that investing loans in her business allows her to stock up very quickly on all the items she needs in order to maintain her income. She is requesting a new loan to buy bales of used clothing and different catalog products in order to keep her customers satisfied.

The previous loan she received was of great help for her to keep her business going. Her income and her customer base have increased. Her family lives under better circumstances and has not changed in number of members.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing and different catalog products.

loans.name: Santos Alejandra

texts.es:
Santos tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 4 emigraron a USA y los demás están 
estudiando, ella estudió hasta 4º grado.


Santos fue hace muchos años aun taller de sastrería, en el cual aprendió a hacer pantalones y camisas para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades, esto le ha ayudado pues actualmente elabora los uniformes a los estudiantes de las escuelas y a personas particulares que la buscan en su pequeño taller donde trabaja con su hija, además se dedica a la siembra de pepino, tomate, chile, brócoli y otros, este oficio lo ha aprendido gracias a varias capacitaciones y asistencia técnica.



Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca y también necesita comprar tela e hilo para hacer camisas y pantalones al igual que otros materiales para la sastrería, además necesita comprar una medicina para su madre que actualmente está enferma y tiene que llevarla al medico para hacerle unos exámenes.


Santos sueña con instalar un negocio bien organizado en la comunidad, a la vez sus aspiraciones son sacar adelante a sus hijos en el estudio, lo cual para ello trabaja todos los días.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old, married, and has a fourth grade education. She has four children who emigrated to the United States while the remaining ones are studying.

Santos worked at a tailoring shop for many years. That is where she learned to make trousers and shirts for men and women of all ages. Her experience helps her in her current work of making uniforms for school students and private individuals. Her customers seek out the small shop where she works with her daughter. In addition, Santos grows cucumbers, tomatoes, chili peppers, broccoli, and other crops as a result of the training she received through various classes and technical advice given to her.

This loan will be used to buy a cow. Santos also needs to buy fabric and thread for producing shirts and trousers, as well as other tailoring materials. In addition, she needs to buy medicine for her mother who is currently ill. Santos will have to take her to the doctor in order to run a few tests.

Santos dreams of having a well-organized business in her community. At the same time, she hopes that her children will succeed in their studies, which is why she works every day.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for her tailoring business, to acquire a cow, and to pay for her mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Dúo Lirios De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
DUO LIRIOS DE LOS VALLE
La señorita Floridalma de 39 años, casada,  desde hace dos 3 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la Alameda, Los Aposentos, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia, con el ingreso de su negocio
El sueño de la señorita Floridalma es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz  y gas propano para seguir creciendo con su tortillería, ya que de esta forma ella seguira luchando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Floridalma is 39 years old, married, and for the past three years has owned a tortilla-making shop located in La Alameda, in Los Aposentos. Her efforts allowed her to set it up and in turn improve her home. Her business has enabled her to support and provide for her family through her income.

Floridalma's goal is to improve her and her family's quality of life through the micro-loan she is requesting from FAPE. She wants to use this loan to buy corn and propane gas in order for her tortilla shop to keep growing. This will allow her to keep working hard to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane for making tortillas.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura was born in 1978. She lives in the north part of Tajikistan. Manzura is married and has three young children. Her husband doesn’t work anywhere. She began her own business four months ago selling dried fruits in a local market. Manzura’s husband helps her to manage the business. She is going to develop her new business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy dried fruits for her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for resale

loans.name: Marilie

texts.en:
Marilie joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2012 and appreciates the programs, services and continuous education provided by the Cooperative. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase ingredients for vending.

Marilie dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase different ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Arcel

texts.en:
Arcel joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2013 and appreciates the programs, services and continuous education provided by the Cooperative. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.
Arcel dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in meeting her family's personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in increased profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn wants to expand soon. She hopes for more strength and good health to continuously operate her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está acompañada y su compañero de vida se dedica a hacer viajes en un carro y a cuidar ganado, tiene 2 hijas que ya son mayores de edad, en casa de Carmen solo viven ella, su pareja, una hija y un nieto.


Ella tiene un negocio de venta y crianza de pollos, cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad, decidió dedicarse a esto en una ocasión que su pareja se enfermó y ella vio a bien criar pollos para venderlos y vio que obtenía ganancia, la distancia a donde sale a vender los pollos está a 15 minutos en bus, la familia se involucra en estas actividades productivas.
  

El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar una vaca que está parida, también comprará 300 pollos y la alimentación para los mismos.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old and has an 8th grade education.  She and her life partner have a business providing transportation services with a car, and they also raise livestock.  Carmen has 2 children who are already adults.  Carmen lives in her house with her partner, a daughter, and a grandchild.

Carmen has a business raising and selling chickens.  She has 20 years of experience in this line of work.  She decided on this activity after a time when her partner got sick and she saw fit to raise chickens to sell and saw that she was able to obtain earnings.  She travels 15 minutes by bus to the place where she sells her chickens.  Her family is also involved in these productive activities.

The loan that Carmen is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow.  She will also buy 300 chickens and chicken feed.  

Carmen's dreams are: to have good health so that she can keep on working, and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, 300 chickens, and chicken feed

loans.name: Ma. Merced

texts.en:
Ma. Merced is 68 years old, married and has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Merced has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Merced requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Merced has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ma. Merced would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Dorcas, a 30-year-old farmer from Eldoret, an area in Kenya that is known for its expansive farmlands and an area that has produced world record-holders in athletics. 

She is a mother of three lovely school-going children and has been doing farming for the past six years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce milk and eggs and earn an income through selling them. Dorcas loves farming very much and is so passionate with dairy farming, she has even nicknamed her cows “Cheptilit", "Tulmet" and "Chesamoi”.

The Eldoret area has good conditions that favor horticulture farming, with a good road network, good climate and a ready market to sell horticulture products. Because of the above valid reasons, Dorcas wants to start horticulture farming and is seeking a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings.

Dorcas has been having a dream of starting horticulture farming, but had one challenge; that is the lack of funds. But, knowing that institutions such as Kiva are out there to help enterprising women, she feels relieved and knows her dream will be achieved.

Through increased income, Dorcas will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

Dorcas plans to sell in international markets, and she wants to take advantage of Eldoret International Airport, which will be of much help.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Dinora Patricia

texts.es:
Dinora tiene 38 años de edad, no pudo culminar los estudios de bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja reside en los Estados Unidos, ella vive solamente con un hijo el cual todavía está yendo a la escuela.



Dinora se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y además, para mantenerse ocupada se dedica al engorde de cerdos,  de los cuales obtiene la carne para venderla en la comunidad.

Ella necesita el préstamo para reparar el techo de su vivienda, pues ya se aproxima el invierno y necesita protección.

Dinora sueña con el día en que su esposo regrese de USA y así formar un hogar más consolidado, trabajando la tierra y engordando animales.
texts.en:
Dinora is 38 years old. She was not able to finish high school. She is in a relationship but her partner lives in the United States, so only a son, who is still in school, lives with her. She works as a homemaker but also fattens pigs in order to keep busy. She obtains meat from the pigs and sells it within her community.

Dinora needs this loan to repair the roof of her house, because winter is coming and she needs protection.

Dinora hopes that one day her husband will return from the US so that they can live as a family and work farming and fattening animals.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: Noemí de 37 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” está conformada por 10 socios responsables y trabajadores. Noemí se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir hace más de 02 años donde todo le va bien. Se siente feliz gracias a su constante dedicación puede educar a sus hijos y cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de colchas, casacas, chompas y buzos por la temporada de frio.  El grupo “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Noemí  es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca negro.
texts.en: Noemí, 37, is separated and has 2 dependent children. The 'Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo' communal bank is made up of 10 responsible and hardworking members. Noemí has been making a living selling clothing for more than 2 years and it is going well for her. She is happy. Thanks to her constant dedication, she can educate her children and cover the household expenses. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of quilts, jackets, sweaters, and sweatshirts for the winter season. The 'Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo' group is grateful to Kiva lenders for providing this loan. Noemí is the first one on the left and she is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy quilts, jackets, sweaters, and sweatshirts for the winter season.

loans.name: Ghaliya

texts.en:
Ghaliya is a 43-year-old married mother of four. Six months ago she decided to join her husband in his grocery store business to support him and develop their shop properly. He can now focus on earning additional income for their family.
Ghaliya proved to be a hard-working woman during this short period. She is putting much effort to increase her shop's capital through the requested loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase her business merchandise with special offer products and summer beverages.
She is very anxious about this loan because it will support her existing business and help increase her income.
As for the future, she is willing to expand her working place and might move to a larger store so she can increase her business capital and diversify her products.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special offer products and summer beverages

loans.name: Dúo Los Claveles De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Los Claveles de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora María Sandra quien se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como playeras, pantalones, camisas, en diferentes tallas y colores desde hace varios años, contando con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y la ayuda de sus hijos han estado firmes y luchando por seguir creciendo cada día. Su sueño más grande es llegar a ser una gran confeccionistas de prendas y luchan mucho por alcanzarlo. Tienen varios pedidos de prenda pero la tela que tienen no les alcanza y se ven en la necesidad de comprar más rollos de tela para no quedarles mal a sus clientes, la tela está valorada en Q. 2000.00 por rollo y utilizan cinco colores para producir la mercadería. Por tal motivo necesitan nuevamente el crédito para seguir trabajando y no estancarse.
texts.en:
Los Claveles de Vista Hermosa Duo

María Sandra is in charge of this group. She has made clothing items such as beach shoes, pants, and shirts in different sizes and colors for many years. She has the constant unconditional support of her husband, and her children help her. Her dream is to become a great clothing manufacturer, and she works hard to achieve this goal. 

They have various clothing orders, but they do not have sufficient fabric to fulfill them. They now need to buy more rolls of fabric so as to not look bad to their clients. The fabric will cost 2,000 Guatemalan quetzals per roll. They use five different colors to produce their merchandise. Therefore, they need a new loan so they can continue working and not stand still.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric to make clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is 21 years old and is pursuing a career in electronics. He has two siblings and his mother is a Barangay captain. His mother’s salary is sometimes not enough for them. For him to go to college, he needs financial assistance from Kiva lenders. He wants to borrow PHP 10,000 from the generous lenders. He wishes that his request will be granted to pave the way for him to earn a college degree.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 52 years old, married with six children, and lives in Lower Bagong Silang, Pagadian City.
Emma raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years.
She has requested a loan for to buy pigs and feed for them..
Emma has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for seven years. In the future, Emma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and livestock feed.

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly is 42 years old, from Paniqui, Tarlac. She is married, with two children. 

Her son, John Paul, is taking up Electronics. John Paul wants to finish schooling to find a good job and to be able to financially help his family. 

For that reason, Pearly wants to avail herself of a PHP 10,000 loan from the Kiva lenders for the tuition fee of her son.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2014, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to purchase different goods for a buy and sell business.

Roselle dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for RTW (ready to wear)

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2014 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000. This loan is intended to purchase fish for selling.

Arlene dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Franklin Alexander

texts.es:
Franklin tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la administración de una tienda que tienen en la casa, han procreado 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela.



Franklin es taxista, él hace viajes dentro y fuera de la ciudad, también por las tardes le ayuda a su esposa en la tienda familiar que poseen.



Él necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para la tienda, pues en este momento es muy poco lo que tienen y les gustaría tener un poco más de variedad.

Su sueño es tener una empresa de transporte que realice viajes fuera y dentro de la ciudad, también le gustaría tener una tienda mas surtida.
texts.en:
Franklin is 39 years old and has a high school education. He is happily though informally married. His partner works managing a store which they have set up at home. They have two children together who are both in school. He is a cab driver and travels in and out of the city. In the evenings he also helps his wife with the family store they own.

Franklin needs this loan to buy more merchandise for the store, since they currently have very little and they would like to have a bit more variety.

His dream is to run his own transportation company traveling in and out of the city. He would also like to have his store better stocked.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and widow with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 36 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with five children. She manages a food-vending business and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. She also manages a hog-raising business to generate additional income. Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to borrow PHP 12,000 to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 47-year-old single woman, and is blessed with four children. She has been operating a retail shop for a period of four years, earning an income of KES. 8,000 at the end of every month.

Jane was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this amount to buy cooking fat, maize flour, and wheat flour to add to her stock, which seems to be running out.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to build a permanent house in the near future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour and milk

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own fish and vegetable stall for nine years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business, while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To further improve sales, Brenda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fish and veggies to sell. With PHP 40,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of fish and other supplies which are needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Brenda hopes to grow her business and dreams for her children to finish their studies. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fish

loans.name: Heidy Arely

texts.es:
Heidy, administro muy bien el capital que se le otorgo anteriormente y ha logrado mantener su tienda bien surtida con lo que sus clientes están satisfechos, su situación económica es más favorable, con las nuevas ganancias brinda mejor salud, alimentación y vestuario a su familia, así como también ha adquirido algunos muebles para el hogar.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos para la tienda, tales como aceite, arroz, frijol, bebidas, pan, galletas, huevos, etc., de esta manera cubrirá la demanda actual de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Heidy managed the capital she previously received very well. She was able to maintain her store well stocked, which keeps her customers satisfied. Her financial situation has improved and the new earnings allow her to provide better health, food, and dress for her family. She has also purchased some furniture for the home.

She has decided to request a new loan to buy products for her store, such as oil, rice, beans, drinks, bread, cookies, eggs, etc. This will allow her to meet her customers' current demand.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old single Ugandan with three children ages 4, 6, and 10. They all reside in the Burora trading center.
James is a farmer who grows mainly coffee but he also has been a produce dealer since 2004.
James has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy produce such as maize and beans. He faces challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. He is optimistic these challenges will finally be put behind him if he gets the financial boost from UGAFODE.
His plans for the future is to educate all his children and acquire more land for agriculture

loans.use: To buy dry corn and beans

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta secundaria, está casada y su esposo vive en Estados Unidos, vive junto con 2 hijos uno de los cuales ya es mayor de edad y es empleado en una empresa como vendedor y el otro asiste a la escuela.

Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también se le gusta la actividad de engordar cerdos, su esposo le ayuda económicamente cuando puede. 

El préstamo lo necesita para pagar unas deudas que tienes pendientes y para comprar cerdos.

Ana sueña con el día en que su esposo regrese de los estados unidos y así puedan gozar de una vida plena en familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and completed high school.  She is married, and her husband lives in the United States.  She lives with her two children, one of whom is already grown and working as a salesperson for a private company.  Her other child is still in school.

Ana takes care of the household duties, but she also likes to raise pigs.  Her husband helps her financially when he can.

She is seeking a loan in order to to pay off outstanding debts and to purchase pigs.

She dreams of the day when her husband returns from the United States so that they will be able to live together happily as a family.

loans.use: to pay off some outstanding debts and to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y dos nietos, sus hijos trabajan y generan ingresos para costear sus gastos personales y ayudar un poco con los gastos familiares, por su parte Sara vende pupusas, tostadas de plátano y elotes locos (elotes salcochados con sal, embadurnados de aderezos y queso rallado), su negocio funciona desde hace cinco años, lo aprendió de manera personal y nace por la necesidad de tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar, trabaja de 3:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, harina, repollo, tomates, plátanos, elotes aderezos, etc., para tener materia prima con la que elaborara la venta y continuara teniendo su fuente de ingresos, espera aumentar la productividad y ganar nuevos clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar creciendo junto a su negocio y llegar a tener un local para ofrecer otro tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Sara lives together with her husband and two children. Her children work and generate income to cover their personal expenses, and help a bit with family expenses. In turn, Sara sells pupusas (a thick corn tortilla with fillings), banana tostadas and 'crazy corn' (corn boiled with salt and smeared with toppings and grated cheese).

Her business has been running for five years. She learned it personally, and started it because of the necessity of having a better style of family life. She works from 3-7 p.m.

She will invest in the purchase of fresh cheese, pork, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, bananas, corn, salad dressings, etc. to have the best raw material with which to make her products and continue having her source of income. She hopes to improve productivity and earn new customers.

Her aspirations are to continue growing together with her business, and to be able to have a location to offer other types of products.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, pork, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, bananas, corn, salad dressings, etc. to have ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old woman married to Wilfred who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They have six children. Jane has been practicing farming for a period of ten years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Jane was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and goats for rearing.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing and fertilizers for her farm produce.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Hugo (pictured right) is a textbook case of a serial entrepreneur. After running a lunch truck and an ice cream truck, he seized a unique opportunity when a tire shop his cousin (pictured left) had worked at for 12 years closed down. Combining his cousin’s expertise in the tire business with the discounted equipment he was able to obtain from his cousin’s former employer, Hugo opened his newest venture: The Best Value Tire Shop.

Besides being able to personally interact with his customers and ensure that they receive the highest quality of service, what Hugo likes best about running his own tire shop is the fact that as long as people drive cars, they’re going to need to buy tires. This stability in demand gives Hugo the confidence to run his business knowing he will have a steady income stream to provide for his future wife and their four children.

Despite having an experienced associate in the form of his cousin, Hugo’s journey was not without its hurdles. He faced difficulties in securing the property for his business as well as in learning which sizes of tires to keep in stock at any given time. Nonetheless, Hugo is excited for what the future holds for his business:

“I’d like to expand to do alignments, brakes, and mobile service, and eventually open up another location. For now, though, I’d like to thank Accion and our Kiva lenders for giving me a chance to keep going.”

Hugo will use his Kiva loan to expand inventory as well as cover operating costs. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Hugo hopes to create a sustainable business that will support him and his family for many years to come.

loans.use: to expand inventory as well as cover operating costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for flyers, signage and banners for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jars, wicks, soy-based wax, thread, and crafting tools.

loans.name: Elizabeth Kaye

texts.en: Elizabeth is an author, journalist and media consultant specializing in the horse industry, travel and entertainment.  She is the author of The Tao of Horses: Exploring How Horses Guide Us on Our Spiritual Path (2004; Adams Media) and the new children’s work of fiction RAJALIKA SPEAK (2014) available on Amazon Kindle, BN Nook, and Apple iBooks, which is the focus of immediate sales efforts. Inspired by the real-life story of a royally-bred Arabian stallion gone bad, who found redemption when he learned to talk, RAJALIKA SPEAK debuted at Horse Expo Pomona in February 2014.  Elizabeth and her Arabian stallion RajaliKa who “speaks on request” are Official Hosts for the American Horse Council’s new national initiative, Time to Ride 100 Day Horse Challenge which begins May 31, 2014.

loans.use: To pay for the technical work to make her eBook available in print format, promote the book, and develop a website.

loans.name: José Petronilo

texts.es:
José es jornalero y agricultor de 73 años de edad, casado, tiene 8 hijos; todos estan casados y él vive con una hija, José no sabe leer ni escribir.

José tambien trabaja en  la ladrillera, no tiene casa propia. El comprará con el préstamo solicitado, abono, Sulfato para la milpa y el prestamo le ayudará a sacar su cosecha para el próximo año.

Él tiene aspiraciones de seguir trabajabando para poder sobrevivir, ya que su esposa no lo acompaña en este proceso y gracias a CREDICAMPO lo va ha lograr.
texts.en:
José works as a laborer and a farmer. He also works at the local brick-making shop. He is 73 years old, married, and has eight children who are all married. He doesn't have his own home but lives with one of his daughters. José cannot read or write.

José will use the loan he is requesting to buy fertilizer and sulfate for his cornfield. This loan will help him with next season's harvest.

His desire is to keep working in order to make a living, and although his wife doesn't support his project, thanks to CrediCampo he will be able to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sulfate for his cornfield.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 24-year-old hardworking single Palestinian refugee who owns a small van which he uses to sell coffee in his region.

Saleh started his business in 2004. He has an espresso machine, which gives his coffee a special taste compared to others.
 
These ten years of experience provided him with loyal customers and a special reputation in his region.

Saleh is acquiring his fourth loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his wedding expenses. Through his previous loans, he was capable of developing his business in a well-managed way, in addition to making necessary maintenance and decoration to his future house.

He hopes to stay capable of expanding his business and to support his beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business capital through adding special summer products (creams, perfumes, beauty products and special beach needs).

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 32-year-old married woman who is blessed with two children. Her husband adds an additional income to support their family.  Jennifer has been a retailer for five years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Jennifer was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar and detergents to sell to her customers.

Jennifer plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to open a general shop providing both retail and wholesale service within her hometown.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cooking fat, detergents, and wheat flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 30-year-old married woman who is blessed with two children. Her husband adds additional income to support their family. Joan has been operating a local money transfer business as an M-PESA Agent for ten years, earning an income of KES 32,800 at the end of every month.

Joan is now servicing her second loan of KES 75,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this entire amount to buy phone accessories and mobile phones and add some capital to her business float.

Joan plans to use the anticipated income to open another local money transfer business in the nearby town and hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and mobile phones to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: To make a living, Wilfreda operates a business venture, providing repair services in their village. She earns well from the business to provide for the family and she has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used that loan to buy tires and spare parts. Finding ways to improve her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. She took a new loan recently to purchase vehicle accessories like rain coat and other spare parts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle accessories like rain coat and other spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for 10 years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jesusa hopes to increase her profit to add capital improvement. She dreams of financial freedom and success in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by offering tailor-made services and by managing her own computer shop.

For this businesses, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory and to improve her service. She is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Ana hopes that her businesses will continue to flourish and will last longer. She dreams of having a stable source of income and that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than fifteen years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Susan would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Susan hopes that her children will be interested in putting up their own businesses too. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Yamileth

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 32 años de edad, no terminó sus estudios de bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y al engorde de cerdos, vive junto con su marido y sus dos hijos, los cuales van a la escuela.


Cristina se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también junto con su esposo se dedican al engorde de cerdos, para luego destazarlos y de esta manera obtener carne para vender.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro cerdos y la comida para alimentarlos.

Su sueño es tener una granja de cerdos y crecer económicamente para darle a su familia una excelente calidad de vida
texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old. She didn't finish high school. She lives with her partner, who works farming and raising pigs. They have two children that live with them and go to school.

Cristina works as a homemaker but also helps her husband fatten the pigs. They later butcher them for their meat, which they sell. She needs this loan to buy four pigs and food to feed them.

Her dream is to have a pig farm and grow financially in order to give her family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and food to feed them.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “La Florida” conformado por 07 socios responsables. Irene de 65 años de edad  separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de pollo beneficiado en un mercado. Hace más de 01 año que viene trabajando positivamente en su negocio dando una buena atención a sus clientes. Su deseo de Irene es complementar su negocio con la venta de abarrotes. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollo y especerías. El grupo “La Florida” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Irene es la segunda del lado derecho, viste casaca marrón.
texts.en:
This is the group “La Florida”  which is made up of seven responsible members.  Irene is a 65-year-old separated woman who has two adult children.  She has a business selling chicken in a market.  She has been doing this successfully for over a year, and she provides good service to her customers.  She wishes to complement her business by selling groceries as well.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase chicken and spices.  The group "La Florida" thanks the Kiva investors for making this loan possible. In the photograph, Irene is the second from the right, wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and spices (ground pepper).

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 37 years old. He is married and supports six members of his family. He is blessed with five children aged between 16 and 7 years.

Mike makes and sells bricks, a business he has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000. He has requested his fourth loan of KES 27,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase firewood for burning dry the bricks. He will also use the loan to pay his workers. Mike successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children, as well as support his family. Mike's hopes and dreams are to prosper his business further in the future.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for his business and to pay workers.

loans.name: Duo Dany De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dany de Santo Tomas 
Este dúo está formado por doña Julia Imelda, ella tiene 26 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario, como azúcar, frijol, aguas gaseosas golosinas, jabón, shampoo, frutas, cereal, leche, quesos, café, en su tienda Danny, desde hace varios años, en su domicilio ubicado en Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de productos comestibles para surtir mas su tienda, su deseo es atender mejor a las necesidades de sus clientes y a seguir obteniendo un poco mas de ingresos.julia aparese en la foto es la que esta de blusa color negro con franjas grises la mas joven de las dos que aparesen
texts.en:
Duo Dany of Santo Tomas 

This duo includes Julia Imelda. She is 26 years old, and sells everyday consumer staples, such as sugar, beans, soda, candy, soap, shampoo, fruit, cereal, milk, cheese, and coffee in her store called Danny. She has been doing this for several years. 

Her home is located in Santo Tomas Milpas Altas. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase edible products to stock her grocery store.

Her desire is to better serve the needs of her customers and to continue getting a little extra income. Julia appears in the photo in the black blouse with gray stripes, the younger of the two in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase edible products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Prosperidad Group

texts.es: María Elena tiene 45 años de edad, mujer Nicaragüense madre de tres hijos los cuales son estudiantes. Ella tiene un centro de fotocopiado e internet, se puede valorar como el único en la zona, muy visitado durante todo el día, para atender  el local esta su hijo de 23 años de edad que le colabora para brindar un servicio eficiente y de calidad, ella requiere de este dinero para invertir en el mantenimientos de las máquinas y compra de materiales para vender en el centro de fotocopiado. Con este negocio ha logrado pagar el estudio de sus hijos, consolidar su negocio que últimamente logro crecimiento y apoyar a su madre que es una mujer adulta mayor la cual habita en Nicaragua aún, esto es uno de los motivos que le motivan a impulsar su negocio.  Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad en los trámites y acompañamiento  antes, durante y después del crédito.
texts.en: María Elena is 45 years old, a Nicaraguan woman, mother of three children who are students. She has a photocopy and internet store which is the only one in her area. It is very well visited the whole day. Her 23 year old son assists at the store and helps her by offering a very efficient quality service. She is requesting this loan to invest in maintaining the machines and buying materials to sell at the photocopy store. With this business she has been able to pay for her children's studies, consolidate her business, which has lately grown, and support her mother who is an older woman and still lives in Nicaragua. This is one of the reasons that motivates her to continue growing her business. She chose Fundacion Mujer because of the easiness with the paperwork and the help they offer before, during and after the loan.

loans.use: to buy catalog products and items for the photocopier.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 40-year-old married woman, who is blessed with five children. Her husband adds additional income to support their family.  Joyce has been operating a grocery shop, as well as being a sweet potato wholesaler for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Joyce was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor, and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy additional sweet potatoes, potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes to sell to her customers. Joyce plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children, and hopes to improve the living standard of her family and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sweet potatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbages and tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dúo El Rosario Group

texts.es: Dúo El Rosario Group A cargo de este grupo está la señora Ofelia quien se dedica a la venta de blusas de tela para dama en diferentes tallas, colores y estilos desde hace varios años y es vendedora ambulante.  Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo  y también es vendedora en mercados de diferentes lugares los fines de semana.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo cada día y llegar a tener un local propio para tener su mercadería en un solo lugar. A pesar de la gran pérdida que tuvieron de mercadería porque fueron asaltados, tienen varios pedidos de blusas para poder entregar,  y para poder lograrlo necesita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar las docenas de blusas que les hacen falta y no quedarles mal a sus compradores.
texts.en: The duo El Rosario Group is run by Ofelia, a woman who is dedicated to the sale of fabric blouses in different colors, sizes, and styles for many years as a street vendor. She has unconditional support from her husband who is also a vendor in the market in various places on the weekends. Her dream is to continue to grow every day and have her own place to sell all of her merchandise in one location. Recently a lot of her merchandise was stolen from her, but she still has many orders that she needs to fulfill. She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase dozens of blouses to replace those that she has lost in order to keep her customers happy.

loans.use: to purchase blouses to sell

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, requiere de un nuevo crédito con el que podrá comprar aceite, azúcar, huevos, arroz, bebidas, etc., para mejorar el inventario de su tienda, así continuará generando ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior su negocio ha mejorado, su situación económica es más estable y le da la oportunidad de cancelar sus deudas. Su familia vive en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
Gloria wants a new loan so that she can buy cooking oil, eggs, rice, drinks, etc., to increase the inventory of her store.  This way, she can continue to generate income to provide for her family.

With the help of her previous loan her business improved, her financial situation is more stable, she's had an opportunity to pay off her debts, and her family is living in better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, eggs, rice, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Mientras Rufino construye algunas casas en su trabajo como ayudante de albañil siempre piensa levantarse temprano el otro día para trabajar la tierra y sembrar lo que a él le gusta:   la papa.

Oficio que aprendió de su papá desde pequeño, no ha dejado que su trabajo de albañil le haga perder su amor por la tierra, que le ayuda con su producto a sostener a su familia compuesta de tres hijos de cinco, tres y año y seis meses de edad quienes viven con su padre.

Desde pequeño, Rufino quien vive desde pequeño en Sololá aprendió a amar la tierra, y sabía que si quería disfrutar de sus beneficios tendría que trabajarla y cuidarla.

Para eso ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de semillas y fungicidas que le ayudan a la siembra de papa.  Ha tenido el sueño de cultivar  más cuerdas de terreno para tener buenas ganancias como resultado de sus siembras.
texts.en:
While Rufino builds some houses in his work as an assistant mason, he always thinks about waking up early the next day so that he can work on the land and grow what he loves: potato.  A job that he learned from his father since he was little, he has not allowed his work as a mason take away from his love of the land, which helps him with his product to sustain his family made up of three children - a five, three, and one and a half year old.
At a young age, Rufino, who has lived in Solola since childhood, learned to love the land and he knew that if he wanted to enjoy its benefits he would have to work on it and take care of it.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for the purchase of seeds and fungicides that will help the growth of potato. He has had a dream of cultivating more acres of land so that he can have good earnings from the results of his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for his potato crop.

loans.name: Elida Argentina

texts.es:
Durante 16 años  doña Elida se ha desempeñado como recepcionista de una institución pública en Sololá.  

De 60 años y con una familia de tres hijos ya mayores de edad,  ha salido siempre adelante con la responsabilidad que conlleva a una madre soltera como ella.

No ha sido fácil llevar sólo ella por muchos años toda una responsabilidad haciendo de padre y madre, y gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado que sus hijos se realicen por sí solos.

Sin embargo, generalmente los sueldos no son paralelos a la eficacia y perseverancia de quienes luchan llevando la misma carga paterna y materna de sus hijos como sucede con Elida.

Elida ha hecho una solicitud de un préstamo para comprar una 
nueva estufa, un simbolismo del calor hogareño que ella ha mantenido durante todos esos años desde que se convirtió en una madre soltera.
texts.en:
Elida has worked for 16 years as a receptionist in a public institution in Sololá.  She's 60 years old and has a family of three adult children.

She has always gotten ahead with the responsibility required of a single mother like herself.  It wasn't easy for her to be responsible for being both father and mother for many years.  Thanks to her effort she has managed for her children to make it on their own.

Nevertheless, salaries are not usually parallel to the efficiency and perseverance of those who strive to be both father and mother to their children, as happened to Elida.

Elida has requested a loan to buy a new stove, a symbol of the warm home she provided during all those years after becoming a single mother.

loans.use: to buy a stove for her home

loans.name: Sandra De Basilia

texts.es: Sandra de 35 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y visionaria para los negocios ya que desde hace 18 años ha logrado mantener su negocio de venta de tamales de gallina y de elote  los cuales distribuye en los cantones cercanos de su localidad de manera ambulante. Su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo en una empresa. Sandra desea construir una pila con lavadero y baño por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y pagar mano de obra para dicha construcción.
texts.en: Sandra, 35, lives with her partner and 10 year old daughter. She is an entrepreneur and visionary and has maintained her business as a street vendor selling chicken and corn tamales in nearby cantons for the past 18 years. Her partner helps financially with the family thanks to his job in a company. Sandra wants to build an area with a washing place and bathroom and so is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and to pay for the manual labour.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and to pay for manual labour for the construction of an area with a washing place and bathroom.

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es:
En tiempos de cambio de gobierno, cuando empresas privadas eran desintegradas o repartidas por los mismos funcionarios del momento, muchos de los trabajadores quedaban a la deriva por no ser parte de un grupo político, ese fue el caso de Ada, una madre soltera de 59 años, quien hace más de 14 años, perdió su trabajo por estas razones. Si no fuese poco, su esposo la dejó con sus dos pequeñas hijas. No obstante, eso no la dejó estancada en ningún momento, al contrario, la hizo más fuerte, pues debía sustentar a sus hijas, que ahora tienen 26 y 14 años, e inmediatamente impuso su propia venta de tortillas y alquiler de molino, convirtiéndose en una comerciante desde lo sucedido, sin poner de excusa que su educación solo fue la primaria.
Una casa de paredes de zinc, un balde de agua improvisado, al igual que la mesa donde muele el maíz con el molino, muestra no solo su esfuerzo, sino que su creatividad al trabajar, pues con su imaginación ella lo ha creado. Las remesas que manda su hija mayor desde España, le han sido de mucha ayuda para salir adelante con su negocio, pero su sueño de seguir creciendo no termina allí, pues necesita de un préstamo para mejorar su molino y comprar maíz, para poder hacer tortillas y sus nacatamales para vender. Entre sus planes esta comprar otro molino para carne y tener otros ingresos, lo que le permitirá mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
In times of changes of government, when private businesses were disintegrated or scattered by the officials of the moment, many workers were adrift because they were not part of any political group. This was the case for Ada, a single mother of 59 years old, who 14 years ago lost her job for these reasons. If this wasn't hard enough, her husband left her with two young daughters.

However, that did not leave her stuck at any time, on the contrary, she became stronger since she had to support her daughters who are now 26 and 14, and immediately she started doing her own tortilla sales and rental mill, becoming a businesswoman after what happened, without making any excuse that she only had an elementary education.

A zinc-walled house, an improvised bucket of water - just like the table where the corn mill grinds, show not only her efforts, but her creativity in working because she has created it with her imagination. 

Remittances sent by her eldest daughter from Spain have been a big help in succeeding with her business, but her dream of continuing to grow does not end there, because she needs a loan to enhance her mill and buy corn to make tortillas and tamales to sell.

Amongst her plans is to buy another grinder for meat to have additional income, which will allow her to improve the structure of her house.

loans.use: to improve her mill and buy corn.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Al entrar al negocio de María, cuantiosas llantas cubren su oficina, tal como si fueran obras de arte que adornan un lugar. El olor a hule da la bienvenida, al igual que doña María . A sus 50 años, esta comerciante de llantas está casada y tiene tres hijos independientes. Cuenta que al inicio de estos 12 productivos años, emprendió su propio negocio vendiendo llantas usadas al por menor, pues encontró la oportunidad y tomo el riesgo, a pesar de no haber llegado a la universidad. Ahora es vendedora mayorista en el mercado oriental.
María cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana, de su yerno y de algunas remesas que le mandan. Sueña con llevar su producto a distintas ferias del país, para que la gente lo conozca y se lleven un material de calidad. Para ello necesita invertir más en lo suyo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar más llantas de diferentes marcas, para variar su producto. Sus planes siempre van a ser seguir adelante con su familia y hacer crecer su negocio, por lo que seguirá invirtiendo en ello.
texts.en:
Upon entering María’s business, numerous tires cover her office as if they were works of art that adorn her place.  The smell of rubber fills the room, and María instantly has a friendly smile.

She is 50 years old, and she sells tires.  She is married and has three independent children. At the start of these 12 productive years she undertook her own business selling used tires at retail.  She found an opportunity and took the risk in spite of not having gone to the university.

She is now a wholesale vendor at the eastern market.  María has help from her sister, her son-in-law, and some remittances sent to her.  She dreams of taking her products to different fairs in the country so that people know her and that she brings quality material.

In order to do so, she needs to invest more in her business.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy more tires of different brands in order to vary her products.  Her plans are always to get ahead with her family and to make her business grow.  Therefore, she will keep investing in it.

loans.use: to buy more tires of different brands to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, and yeast for baking for her business.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es:
Lorena tiene 38 años de edad, no pudo estudiar ningún grado académico, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a la compra y venta de ganado, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y han formado su propia familia.

Lorena se dedica al comercio de compra y venta de pescado fresco y al destazo de cerdos, esta actividad la ha realizado desde muy pequeña ya que sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo, por las mañanas recibe el producto y se dirige a vender de casa en casa a las comunidades aledañas, el destazo de cerdos lo hace una vez por semana, y solo su pareja se involucra en el trabajo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar pescado al por mayor y para comprar una vaca lechera, ya que su esposo se dedica a la comercializacion con ganado.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando por su cuenta en compañía de su pareja.
texts.en:
Lorena is 38 years old; she couldn't study for any academic qualifications. Her life partner makes a living working in agriculture and buying and selling cattle. Their children are already of legal age and have formed their own families.

Lorena makes a living buying and selling fish and slaughtering pigs; she has worked in this business since she was very little, as her parents made a living in the same field. She receives the product in the morning and goes from house to house in the surrounding communities. She slaughters pigs once a week, and only her partner is involved in this.

She needs a loan to bulk buy fish and to buy a dairy cow, since her husband is engaged in selling cattle. 

Her dream is to continue working on her own alongside her partner.

loans.use: to bulk buy fish and to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as onions, washing soap, tomatoes, cube sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Leivi Patricia

texts.es:
Leivi tiene 28 años de edad,  estudió hasta octavo grado está soltera, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, ella vive en casa de sus padres junto con tres hermanos mas.

Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios en un chalet, actividad que tiene 3 años de estar desempeñando en la cual se involucra su hermana, además Leivi elabora tortillas que vende por encargos,  ella trabaja de 5:30 am a 5:00 pm y viaja en un microbús para llegar al lugar de trabajo.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 4 quintales de maíz y 2 cargas de leña necesarios para la elaboración de tortillas.


Su sueño es sacar adelante su familia y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos para que puedan formarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Leivi is 28 years old. She was in school until 8th grade, is single, and has two children who are in school. She lives in her parents' house together with three other siblings. 

She makes a living providing services in a villa, work that she has been doing for three years and which her sister also engages in. In addition, Leivi makes tortillas that she sells for order. She works from 530am until 5pm, and travels on a microbus to arrive at her place of work. 

She needs this loan to purchase 4 quintals of maize and 2 loads of firewood needed for making tortillas. 

Her dream is to help her family get ahead and to be able to put her children through school so that they can develop academically.

loans.use: to purchase 4 quintals of maize and 2 loads of firewood needed for making tortillas.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is from Dhupguri. She is married and a mother of two sons, one of whom is a student. Her family consists of her sons and her husband, Mantu, who is a 61-year-old farmer. They live in their own kachha house (straw, mud and bamboo-made) in East Magurmari, Jalpaiguri district.  Sabita studied until grade six and her husband has a secondary education. One of her sons is in college and the other is engaged in agricultural activities with his father.

Sabita's husband is an agronomist. He loves to work with soil. He has a small plot of farmland, where he works tirelessly from dawn to dusk and grows different kinds of vegetables and paddy rice. The demand for paddy rice is very good in the region, as it is the staple food of the local people.

He has many customers who want to buy vegetables and rice from him, as he supplies good-quality products at reasonable rates. But, it is a competitive market, so his income is not sufficient to provide financial sustenance to the family. He wants to grow more paddy rice, but his main obstacle is funds.

Sabita has decided to help her husband by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She wants to use the loan to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things to grow better quality products to satisfy the customers.

She hopes the loan will provide her with additional income to reach her goals, which are to support her son with higher education and buy a car for their own use or to rent it out for another means of income for the family.

She is thankful to BJS as well as Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and other agricultural inputs for farming paddy.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sector Terminal Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is quite famous for its huge and colorful native market that has been held two days each week for years. It not only draws the K'iche' Maya of the surrounding region but also vendors representing many of Guatemala’s linguistic groups such as the Ixil, Kaqchikel, Mam and others, each dressed in their traditional costume and speaking their own unique language. The market is a rich tapestry of costumes, color, dialects, smells and the smoke from the tradition of burning incense on the steps of the cathedral right in the middle of the market. The area is well-known as a rich agricultural area with prolific orchards of fruit trees. Peaches, plums, pears, and apricots are harvested and distributed throughout the country. In addition, many in the area work in textile production, creating the colorful and beautiful traditional costumes of the area.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Women Del Sector Terminal is located here and are about to begin their second loan cycle with Kiva. The eight women in the Trust Bank share that with their previous loan, they were able to realize tremendous benefits in their various businesses. The ladies have an average age of 31 years, average one year of formal education, and average five children in their families.

Eva is one of the youngest members of the Trust Bank. She is 24 years old with three years of formal education. Eva is the Secretary of the Trust Bank. She not only has a small fruit orchard but also a traditional textile business. Eva is requesting a loan to invest in her orchard and wants to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She wants to also purchase supplies for her textile business. She is looking at her orchard in the long term as it does take time for trees to grow and bear fruit. In the meantime, her textile business will generate enough income for her to take care of her short term needs.

The women of the “Mujeres del Sector Terminal” Trust Bank and Eva understand the value of education. They work hard so that their children can gain access to a good education and a more prosperous future. At the same time, they benefit from the educational components of their monthly meetings when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer facilitates participatory educational trainings on a variety of subjects like how to be a successful entrepreneur (accounting, budgeting, marketing, pricing, customer service), keeping a healthy household (nutrition, healthful practices, personal hygiene) and self-esteem. “Microcredit Plus” is the name of the effective combination of the small loans and education.

Eva and her friends in the Trust Bank thank Kiva investors for their kindness in funding their loans. They are determined to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her orchard and supplies for her textile business.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Dana de 27 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella forma parte del grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” y está formado por 06 integrantes solidarios y responsables. Dana se dedica a la venta de producto de belleza. Hace más de 01 año que distribuye sus productos a pedidos, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su única hija. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de talcos, colonias, perfumes desodorantes. El deseo de Dana contar con una tienda bazar. El grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios. Dana es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
Dana is 27 years old and is separated, with one child who is dependent on her. She forms part of the group "Prosperidad y Amistad" (Prosperity and Friendship), and it is made up of 6 responsible solidarity members. 

Dana works selling beauty products. For more than a year she has been distributing her products upon request, and thanks to her constant dedication she is able to give a better quality of life to her only daughter. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy powders, colognes, and deodorizing fragrances. Dana's desire is to have a bazaar shop. 

The group "Prosperidad y Amistad" thank the Kiva investors for giving them the opportunity to grow in their businesses. Dana is the first from the left side and is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy powders, colognes, and deodorizing fragrances.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man who supports two members of his family in their living.

He has a shop that was established in March 2013, specializing in providing hookah services, which he has worked hard to develop properly. Hookah rental and selling is a very popular business these days; that's why he has to make sure that his current shop can face and compete the existing similar businesses in his region. Thus, for this reason he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance and decoration to his shop, to keep it up to date and attractive enough to new customers.

He hopes that in the future, he can develop his business and expand it through establishing another branch.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance and decoration to his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs in order to maintain the crop.

loans.name: La Prueba Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y con ánimo de prosperar, es coordinado por la señora Zonia, de 69 años de edad y casada, es comerciante de verduras y granos básicos, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace veinte años, la socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras como tomate, lechuga, chayote, papa, yuca, zanahorias y chiltoma, etc. lo que le permitirá cubrir parte de la demanda actual. Las otras socias son la señora Reyna de 22 años de edad, quien comercializa hamacas en  unos de los mercados de la capital, la señora Simona, quien se dedica a la venta de raspados y leña, en las zonas aledañas a la comunidad donde reside hace quince años, y la señora Ruth de 42 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en unos de los mercados capitalinos desde hace quince años.
texts.en: The solidarity group formed by four hardworking women with motivation prosper is coordinated by Zonia, who is 69 years old and married. She sells vegetables and basic grains. She has worked in this business for twenty years. The member is requesting the loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, lettuces, chayote, potatoes, cassava, carrots and peppers, etc. which will allow her to cover part of her current demand. The other members are Reyna, 22  years old, who sells hammocks at one of the capital markets; Simona, who sells "raspados" (shaved ice covered in sweet syrup) and fire log in the surrounding areas of the community where she lives for fifteen years; and Ruth, 42 years old, who sells fruits and vegetables at one of the capital markets for fifteen years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, lettuce, squash, potato, and carrot to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
En una de las fincas de Sololá desde temprano en la mañana el sol, con curiosidad, se asoma a las manos de Juan  que todos los días empieza una jornada más para el cultivo de las tierras de la finca donde labora como jornalero.

Juan de 33 años padre de un hijo, le silba a la tierra como una forma de cariño como una forma de convencerla para que dé el fruto esperado.

Pero  a Juan le encanta este trabajo, por eso también es poseedor propio de terreno donde cultiva café y banano.  Su deseo en la solicitud de un préstamo es para poder comprar dos cuerdas de terreno para cubrir sus propias necesidades y ampliar su extensión de cultivo.

Entonces el sol todas las tardes descansa satisfecho.
texts.en:
On one of the farms of Sololá, early in the morning, the sun, with curiosity, comes up upon the hands of Juan who every day begins one more day's work on the farm where he works as a laborer. 

Juan is 33 years old and is the father of one son.  He whistles to the land as a form of loving care: as a way to convince it to give the awaited fruit.

But Juan loves this work, and because of this he also owns his owns land where he grows coffee and bananas.  His wish in requesting a loan is to be able to purchase two plots of land to cover his own needs and extend his current cultivation. 

With this, he will rest satisfied when the sun sets each day.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 43 years old, married and blessed with four children. She runs a boutique stall where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been doing this business for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

Teresiah has requested her first loan of KES 100,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy stock of clothes and shoes for her boutique sales. With the anticipated profits, Teresiah will be able to acquire both household and business assets. Her hopes and dreams for the future include expanding further by opening a bigger boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Sahida is only 26 years old.  She hails from Dhupguri.  She is married to Asraful and together they are raising two children (one son and one daughter).  Sahida completed her primary education whereas her husband is illiterate and can sign only his name.  They live in the small village of  Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district. Their children are in different grades in primary schools.

Sahida's husband works in the field to cover home and family expenses,.  He owns land and he bought it with great effort after tirelessly working for several years.  He grows paddy, which is the staple food of the regional people. Sahida takes care of her husband and children and after finishing her job, she helps her husband in his work, such as cutting and harvesting grain. They are successfully producing crops for several years. With the growing increase in the price of essential commodities, they need to improve their business.

So, Sahida is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to be used to invest in maintaining their paddy crops, which includes buying seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  Her plans for the future are to further expand their agribusiness and save money to construct a decent and better house with all necessary facilities.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Todos los días el mercado de Sololá es abastecido de toda variedad de frutas.  Es por eso que es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

Cristóbal de 29 años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de bananos de diferentes especies, negocio que lo heredó de su papá.  Es uno de los vendedores que abastece diariamente a sus compradores.

El crédito que él ha solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción para remodelar su vivienda.  Y sus metas es poder comprar un vehículo para continuar con su negocio y generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Every day the Sololá market is stocked with a variety of fruits.  This is why it is visited frequently by national and also international tourists.  

Cristobal, 29, has a business buying and selling different varieties of bananas.  He inherited this business from his father.  He is one of the vendors who distributes daily to his buyers.

The loan that he has requested will be used to buy construction materials to renovate his house.  One of his goals is to buy a vehicle so that he can continue with his business and generate more earnings.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
No hay edad para convertirse en un ser humano emprendedor.  Las necesidades de la vida nos abren nuevos espacios para poder desarrollarnos como ser humanos y tener una vida digna.

En Suchitepequez vive Agustina que a sus 51 años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de banano por quintal, por docena y por racimo. Lleva ya diecisiete años en este negocio.
