Sin embargo ha necesitado un nuevo local para que su negocio sea más formal y aumenta así su clientela. Además de buscar nuevos mercados en diferentes municipios.

Es la razón de solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
There is no age limit on becoming an enterprising human being.  The necessities of life open new spaces for us to develop as human beings so that we can have a decent life.

Agustina lives in Suchitepequez.  She is 51 years old, and has a business buying and selling bananas by quintal (100 pound lots), by the dozen, and by the bunch.  She's had this business now for 17 years.

However, she needs a new shop so that her business can become more formal and so that she can attract more customers.  In addition, she is seeking new markets in various municipalities.

This is why she is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in her fruit business

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima, 40 years old, went to an elementary school.  She was not able to complete it because of her parents' lack of finances. She is now married to Gobinda and is a homemaker. They are blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter).  All attend school and are in the fifth, eighth and tenth standards.  They live in Bhowalpara in Jalpaiguri district.

Sima's husband, age 51, is engaged in field activities and grows different kinds of vegetables such as potatoes, beans, ribbed gourds etc. Their source of income depends on this agribusiness.  The products are sold to the different stores in the local markets at a price that is consistent with the demand. Sima does different household chores, and when she finishes, she works in the field.

Sima's goals are to improve her quality of life, to get ahead with her family, to continue supporting her children as much as possible with everything they need, primarily with their education.  So, to fulfill her goals, she and her husband have decided to cultivate bitter gourd. It is in great demand in their region, which has a tropical climate.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers. With these, she will be able to better care for her crop and hopes to earn a good profit to acquire even more agricultural land.

She thanks her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other farm supplies for growing bitter gourd.

loans.name: Villa San Blas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA SAN BLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Macaria ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Villa San Blas." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Macaria. She is single. She is 42 years old and has 6 children. She works in her business, which is a restaurant. She prepares various dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and saltados with meat. She works from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has had this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is applying for the loan to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members have businesses of selling vegetables, selling animals, grocery store, and restaurant.

The group members that are pictured in the attached photos were unable to attend the first reunion due to their work schedule. 

This bank member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo formado en Ciudad del Este, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de ellas es la Sra. Fidencia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir esforzándose un poco más.
Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropa que hace está luchando por mejorar, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir luchando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
texts.en:
This new group formed in Ciudad del Este is participating in the poverty elimination program.  One of them, Fidencia, showed a poverty level of one on her survey, which means she has to keep on working a little harder.

She's striving to improve through effort and constant work as well as by selling clothing that she makes.  She's a very self-sacrificing woman who strives for her family.

Fidencia's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying a variety of garments to sell.  That way she'll be able to keep on striving and working hard to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.es: Juliet de 26 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, desde hace 2 años cuando un amigo le propuso prestar su taller para elaborar prendas variadas, ella atendió esta propuesta de armar piezas en el taller de su amigo y desde entonces no se detiene, elaborando vestidos para damas por encargo, a Juliet le entregan las piezas cortadas y ella las ensambla  y las vende a crédito, trabajando de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 8 de la noche, su mayor clientela son sus vecinos y almacenes pequeños que le compran el producto acabado. Su mayor meta es tener su propio taller y suministrarles una buena educación a sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento al que aplica en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina de coser e insumos para elaborar vestidos. Con esta inversión poco a poco irá alcanzando su sueño de prosperar cada vez más.
texts.en:
Juliet, 29, has earned a living making clothing for two years, when a friend suggested she use his workshop to make a variety of garments.  She took advantage of her friend's proposal and since then has not stopped making women's outfits on order.

Juliet gets and assembles the cut pieces, then sells them on credit.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 8 in the evening.  Her main customers are her neighbors and small stores that buy the finished product.

Her biggest goal is to have her own shop and to give her children a good education.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy a sewing machine and materials to make outfits.  With this investment, little by little she'll work toward realizing her dream of thriving more all the time.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies to make outfits

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es:
Alirio es un joven campesino de 27 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos Hortensias en zona rural del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral, atiende sus cultivos todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado y algunos distribuidores de flores del municipio. Con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 

Alirio, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Alirio, 27, is a hardworking and modest young farmworker who learned all the farm tasks at a young age thanks to his parents' instruction.  This has allowed him to make progress.

Currently he grows hydrangeas in a rural part of the town of El Carmen de Viboral.  He tends to his plants every day and sells his harvests in the market plaza and to some flower distributors in town.  This supplements the income with which he takes care of the well-being of his parents, who worked so hard to get him ahead.

With the support of the loan he's going to buy agricultural inputs wholesale (soil amendments, pesticide, fertilizer, and other supplies).  He'll continue to take care of his plants and he'll have a better, more productive harvest, which will improve his income when it comes time to sell his crop.

With his enterprising spirit, strength, and tenacity, Alirio wants to keep on striving to achieve his dream of having his own farm where he can grow a wider variety of crops.  That way he'll improve the profitability of his business and ensure economic stability and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and other agricultural inputs to improve his harvest.

loans.name: Kutale

texts.en:
Kutale is a 55-year-old woman married to Sarijoren, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with seven children.  Kutale has been practicing agricultural business by selling cattle to her customers for 10 years, earning her an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Kutale is now servicing her third loan of KES. 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use the entire amount to buy additional cattle and animal feed to sell to her customers.

Kutale plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy additional cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Elizabeth, 28 years of age.  She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of one, and has been doing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet.

Elizabeth loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow “Njeri” (from a person’s name) and she really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Kerugoya area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming, that is good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Elizabeth wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. 

She is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming, and through improved income she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her child.

The financial benefits that Elizabeth will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Jesus Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Jesús es un agricultor que ha ejercido su profesión a lo largo de su vida brindando productos como plátanos y yuca, alimentos saludables y sanos para el consumo de las personas. 

A sus 46 años edad se ha trazado una meta con su esposa poder crear una familia y tener hijos para alegrar su hogar, sabe que para traer hijos al mundo hay que tener buena estabilidad económica para sostenerlos.

Por esa razón quiere mejorar su negocio, aumentar su productividad y asegurar un futuro en base a trabajo en el campo, solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permita aumentar y tener mayor productividad, el crédito lo invertirá en abonos, riegos, fungicidas y semillas con los que quiere comenzar una nueva era en sus cultivos una más productiva y beneficiosa para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesús is a farmer who has been in this profession for most of his life.  He grows products such as bananas and cassava, which are healthy and safe foods for human consumption.  

At 46 years of age, Jesús and his wife have set a goal of starting a family and having children to brighten up their home.  He knows that in order to bring children into the world, he must have good financial stability to support them.  For this reason, Jesús wants to improve his business by increasing his productivity, which will secure a future with his work in the fields. He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies so that he can grow and have more productivity.  The loan will be invested in fertilizers, irrigation, and fungicides.  Jesús wants to start a new season of crops that will be more productive and beneficial for his family.

loans.use: to by agricultural inputs like fertilizers, irrigation, and fungicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a blow dryer, salon chair and hair products in order to start her beauty salon

loans.name: Amita

texts.en:
Amita is a 36-year-old woman and a mother of three daughters.  She is from the small village of Baroghoria, Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal.  She lives there with her husband along with her daughters. She sends her daughters to school and now they are in grades 3, 10 and grade 12. In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity to get more education due to the poor financial resources of her parents.  So she is earnestly trying to provide an education to her daughters.

Her husband is a farmer.  He cultivates different vegetables on his farmland in different seasons and sells them at the market.  Amita also assists her husband in fieldwork after managing her household work. With several years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way, including the rising costs of inputs and the instability of the prices for buying and selling vegetables. 
 
Now that her children have grown up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, they feel need to further improve their agricultural activities.  They have decided to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop. Being the staple food of West Bengal, it is in much demand throughout the year.  So, they think it will be a profitable business that will generate income.

Currently, Amita is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as paddy seeds, fertilizers etc. to start paddy cultivation. She has a lot of faith and she hopes to get ahead because her household expenses depend on this work.

Her dream as a mother is to give a good education to her children so they can prosper in life.  With her profits, she plans to purchase more land in the future. 

She conveys her thanks to her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is a 37-year-old businessman who has been running a Micro Distribution Centre (MDC) since 2004. He sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers and customers. His business earns him enough money to take care of his wife and their three children ages seven, three and one.

Faustin continues to have ambition to grow his MDC business, to own more containers, and sell more product. But he says, “Finance is needed to grow my business. It is hard to grow without good funding”. Faustin is requesting for his first Kiva loan, so that he can be able to grow his business by ordering more stock. This will increase the number of soft drink sales and will help Faustin earn more profits from his business.

Faustin has big dreams for his business. He dreams of opening three distribution centers and selling huge quantities of soft drinks. He also has dreams of building a house for his family. Faustin is happy to be connected to Kiva lenders. He would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for helping him grow his business and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to grow his business by ordering more drinks for his distribution center.

loans.name: Jormoh Group

texts.en:
Patience is a married mother of two daughters, both of whom attend school. She is in her late 30's, and lives with her kids and husband.

For eight years now, she has been supporting her family by selling bags. Patience depends on this business to generate income for her family, so she puts all of her energy into satisfying her customers, such as by playing nice music at the shop. She explains that she usually works from 8 am until 6 pm on a daily basis, which allows her to realize good profits each month.

For the sake of improving her business, Patience, together with other seven members, approached ID-Ghana to obtain financial support, a total of GHS 3,300. The group members will hold each other accountable to repay their portions of the loan. This is her first loan request, which she would like to use to buy bags of different sizes to sell to customers. 

She dreams of growing her enterprise. As a result of this agenda, Patience will be able to generate an increase in her income, which she used to pay school fees, household expenses, and expansion of the business.

loans.use: To buy bags of different sizes

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 52 years old and is happily married, with three kids ages 28, 26 and 24. He lives in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. Billy sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers. He operates the business with his wife and their children. He has been operating the business for 23 years now.

Billy enjoys running his business because it gives him the chance to interact with other small business owners in his community. He says the business also keeps his family close because they all work together at the business.

Billy has applied for a loan to purchase more stock, such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his container (a container is where Billy distributes his stock to wholesalers from). The loan will help him to expand his business activity and increase his overall stock. 

With additional stock Billy and his family will be able to generate more revenue from increased turnover. Billy and his family are excited about this opportunity to expand their current business operations and grow their business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and a new sewing machine

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza  está en su ciclo número  ocho del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ellas están luchando por fomentar el crecimiento de cada una de ellas por medio del trabajo en conjunto y la unión de todas, quieren poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias.
Aida es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando por poder crecer y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia. Aida tiene una peluquería donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas hora del día, tiene muy buena clientela, donde trabaja para poder darles el mejor servicio, para que de esa manera vaya creciendo por medio de su esfuerzo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su buen servicio. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza group is in its eighth cycle in the women’s committee program.  They are all working and helping each other get ahead.  They are struggling to promote the growth of each one of them by working together and being united.  They want to be able to grow and to help their families.

Aida is one of the members of this group.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.  She is struggling to be able to grow and improve her living conditions and those of her family.  Aida has a beauty parlor where she works every day, starting very early in the day.  She has very good clientele, and she works to be able to give them the best service.  She does this so that her business will grow through her effort.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to by supplies for her beauty parlor.  She will buy things like dyes, shampoos, rinses, creams, and others.  This way she will be able to continue with her good service.  

They are grateful for this opportunity that they are receiving in order to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos, rinses, creams, and others.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a single man of 26 years, supporting no dependents currently. Stephen is in the transportation business via motorcycles. He currently owns two motorcycles, and has requested his third loan to purchase his third motorcycle. 

For this reason, he has requested for a loan of Kshs. 90,000 from VisionFund Kenya. Stephen successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Stephen will be able to expand his business further. as well as save more money.

Stephen's desire is to own more motorcycles, and as a result, create employment opportunities for other youth.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Dorys Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una señora luchadora por sus hijos, ella siembra productos y también cría animales ya que sus padres le enseñaron e estas actividades, Mercedes vive con su esposo y sus  3 hijos que ya son independientes gracias a la educación que Mercedes y su esposo le dieron, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de fungicidas, Mercedes aspira seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio para tener estabilidad económica y de ser posible ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mercedes is woman who struggles for her children.  She plants products and also raises animals since her parents taught her how to do these activities.  Mercedes lives with her husband and three children who are already independent thanks to the education Mercedes and her husband gave them.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of fungicides.  Mercedes hopes to continue working and improve her business in order to have economic stability and to be able to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras 2 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta se dedica a la Venta de Comidas. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación económica. El Trabajo que ella hace requiere de mucha paciencia y dedicación, y diariamente tiene que fijarse metas en cantidades que a ella le permita tener mayor ingreso.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de empanadas, sándwich entre otros.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedoras 2 group is in their second cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them are working and helping each other in order to be able to get ahead.

Mirta is one of the members.  She sells food.  Through her effort, continual work, and the practice of essential behavior for a successful woman, she is improving her financial situation.  The work that she does requires a lot of patience and dedication.  She needs to focus on goals every day that will allow her to have greater profits.

She is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients to make empanadas, sandwiches, and other items.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make empanadas, sandwiches, and other items.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Valentín  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto y trabajo unido.
Alba integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, tiene un negocio donde ofrece un buen servicio a las demás personas. Es muy trabajadora y lucha por poder salir adelante. Quiere poder crecer y dar fuentes de trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieren salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su negocio, como shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas, tijeras y demás,  y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The San Valentín group is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them are working and helping each other to get ahead through their joint effort and united work.

Alba is a member of this group.  She is a hairdresser, and she has a business where she offers good service.  She is very hard-working, and she struggles to be able to get ahead.  She wants to be able to grow and be a source of work for other people who, like her, want to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her business.  She will buy things like shampoos, rinses, dyes, creams, scissors, and the rest.  This way she will be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, rinses, dyes, creams, scissors, and the rest.

loans.name: Fuerza Compartida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA COMPARTIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Chela del Carmen ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia tiene una fotocopiadora, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Fuerza Compartida communal bank.  This bank is in the Cusco district in the Cusco province in the Cusco department.

Chela del Carmen, age 57, is single and has three children.  She works in her business, a grocery store.  She also has a photocopier.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She works in this business from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.   She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.

She is requesting the loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

The members that are in the inset photo took the photo after the meeting.  They asked permission due to work.

The other members devote themselves to the business of selling cell phones, selling cakes, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Marlenny Rosa

texts.es:
Marlenny, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. Ser madre de dos hijos fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida, ayudarle a su esposo y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, comenzó a comercializar mercancía a través de catalogo como ropa, productos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, productos de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena reputación. 

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía al por mayor y así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada, pues cuenta con la ventaja de vivir en un barrio donde hay mucha afluencia de público; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Marlenny manifiesta que nada le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de mercancía, tener un almacén y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlenny is a charismatic woman, active and obliging.  Being mother of two children is her main motivation to fight tirelessly day by day, looking for alternative ways to earn a living, help her spouse and support her children.
About 3 years ago she began to sell merchandise from catalogs, such as clothing, beauty products, and items for the home.  They are products of good quality and very well priced, which has allowed her to become known in the area and have a good reputation.

This leads her to ask for help through a loan to strengthen her inventories, since she will buy merchandise in bulk.  In this way, she can satisfy the demand growing in this season, since she has the advantage of living in a neighborhood where there is much public affluence.  Having this merchandise will help her to increase the income she receives for her work.

Marlenny says nothing will stop her from going ahead with what she cares about passionately.  She always sets herself new goals and among them is becoming a major distributor for merchandise, having a store and creating opportunities for employment.  In this way she will improve the quality of life and well being of her family.

loans.use: to restock her inventory with beauty products, clothes, household goods.

loans.name: Nelvis Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelvis tiene 25 años de edad, estudió pocos años en la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, sus hijos están pequeños y solo 2 van a la escuela.



Ella se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a los oficios del hogar, mientras su esposo busca la forma de traer dinero a su hogar.


El préstamo lo necesita para cancelar una deuda, pues no tienen de donde el dinero para pagarlo, y por eso han recurrido a la solicitud del préstamo.

Ella sueña con una vida digna con su familia, donde puedan vivir en una linda casa, criar animales y que sus hijos puedan gozar de las necesidades básicas de la vida.
texts.en:
Nelvis is 25 years old, attended school only for a few years, and is married.  Her husband works as a mason. Her children are young and only two of them attend school.  She devotes herself to taking care of her children and the housework while her husband searches for ways to provide for their family.

They need the loan to pay off a debt because they do not have the money to pay it back, which is why they have requested this loan.  She dreams of having a dignified life with her family, where they can live in a nice home, raise animals and their children can enjoy the basic needs in life.

loans.use: pay off a debt that she does not have the money to pay off.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice and red oil to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos para el cuidado de los bebes como ropa, talcos, cremas, lociones, juguetes, entre otros. Inicio el negocio hace algunos meses y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar aun mas sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta y mejor sus ventas.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en él y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is well prepared to take on the world and have a full life thanks to his effort.  He has a store where he sells products for babies such as clothing, baby powder, creams, lotions, toys and others.  He started this business a few months ago and even though he has only been in operation for a short time, he has been well received in the region.

He wishes to expand his product offering and improve his sales by infusing more capital into his business.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan so that he can have the opportunity to be independent and have the necessary resources to dedicate himself fully to his business.  The money will be used to purchase merchandise that he currently does not have, and will improve his sales. 

He has high hopes for his business, and he believes that his future can be greatly improved thanks to the support of this group that does what is needed so that people can dream of having a better, more stable life.

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of goods.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, es casada, con su esposo hasta la fecha han compartido la dicha de educar y criar a sus hijos en un ambiente sano, todos viven en una misma casa; se dedica cada día a atender un comedor y una venta de tortillas en el mercado de la región, trabaja todo el día, este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes, condimentos, bebidas, etc., para elaborar la venta de comida y tortillas, al tener la materia prima a su alcance podrá aumentar la producción, las ventas e ingresos, espera mejorar su situación financiera.
Sus aspiraciones son que sus hijos continúen estudiando y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Juana is married, and up to now she and her husband have shared the joy of educating and raising their children in a healthy environment.  They all live in the same house.  Each day, she serves at a restaurant and sells tortillas at the regional market.  She works all day, and this business is the source of income that pays for her basic household needs.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains, vegetables, meat, condiments, beverages, and other products to develop food and tortilla sales.  Once she has the ingredients within her reach, she will be able to increase production, sales, and income.  In this way, she hopes to improve her financial situation.  Her wishes are that her children continue their studies and have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, vegetables, meat, condiments, beverages, and other products to develop food and tortilla sales.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday is 57 years old. He is married and has five children, ages 33, 31, 27, 23, and 8. He sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers in one of the busiest markets in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia.

Friday is the sixth born in a family of eight. He has three dependents and helps his parents financially. He has been in the distribution business for nine years now. He enjoys his  business because it is his main source of income, and it gives him the chance to make his own decisions and employ other people in his community.

Friday is requesting a Kiva loan to help him order more stock. Having additional inventory on hand will increase Friday’s sales and, therefore, bring him more income. He is very happy to be connected to Kiva lenders. He sees this as a huge opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase more soda inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old, married to Stephen, and blessed with one child who is five years old. She has been in the transport business for the last five years, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 (Kenyan Shillings).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 130,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy spare parts and repair the motorbike for better service.                                                                                           

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to grow her business and buy more motorbikes and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to repair the motorbike for better service.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha de 46 años habita con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 15 a 28 años  en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de Barranquilla, donde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de ropa, calzado, perfumería, cosméticos y variedades; negocio que inició, para generar los recursos suficientes y poder ofrecer cada vez mas bienestar a su hogar y también por lograr independencia económica. Semanalmente, y quincenalmente se dedica a vender en poblaciones vecinas, de contado y a crédito. En Soledad, Pojó y Barranquilla, es muy conocida y tiene clientes que le  hacen pedidos y sobre los cuales enmarca sus inversiones, para generar cada vez más ingresos. Bertha quiere fortalecer su capital de trabajo, para aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades pero tiene el desafío de lograr conseguir dinero, para invertir y aumentar su clientela y con ello sus utilidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  ropa, perfumes, cosméticos variedades y calzado, mercancía que han encargado sus clientes y con la cual tiene como meta aumentar sus ventas  y sus utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva y exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Bertha is 46 years old and lives with her spouse and their four children, who are between the ages of 15 and 28, in the city of Soledad, a metropolitan area in Barranquilla.  There, for the past 20 years, she has worked selling clothing, footwear, perfumes, cosmetics and other goods.  She started this business to generate an income, to provide more stability to her home, and to attain financial independence.  Weekly and biweekly, she sells in neighboring places in cash and on credit.  She is very well known in Soledad, Pojó and Barranquilla, where she has many customers who place orders with her.  She bases her investments on them in order to generate more income each time.  

Bertha wants to strengthen her working capital so that she can increase her sales and earnings, but getting the money to do so has been a challenge.  For this reason, she is seeking a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase clothing, perfumes, cosmetics and footwear.  This is merchandise that her customers have ordered and that she hopes will increase her sales and earnings, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: purchase clothing, perfumes, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y sus cuatro menores hijos de 22,23,8,9 años de edad de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria y los otros dos últimos primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pomahuaca, es una ciudad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, maíz, arroz; comercio de frutas a los transportistas que vienen de la región selva, está ubicada en la Provincia Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz variedad mono, ubicado en el Caserío Patacon - Pomahuaca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes que le proporcionara una mejor producción de su cultivo de café y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Valentin, 53, lives in his own house of rustic materials.  He lives with his spouse and his four younger children, 22, 23, 8, and 9, of which the first is in secondary school and the last two are in the primary school of the national college of the District of Pomahuaca.  It is a city with a warm climate.  The population makes a living in agriculture, especially the cultivation of coffee, corn, and rice, and in commerce in fruits from the transporters who come from the jungle region.  It is located in the Province of Jaen, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.
He makes a living in agriculture, specifically cultivating rice of the yellow variety located in Patacon village, Pomamarca.  With 15 years experience in the field, he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 new soles in order to buy organic fertilizers and manure that will provide him with better production for his coffee crop and he will be able to offer it at a better price to his customers.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 25-year-old married lady, and they are currently not blessed with any children. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the last two and a half years, with a steady income that is able to cater to her family needs.

Lilian has applied for her first loan after joining a new group, and she hopes to use the amount to add more stock of secondhand clothes bales for her increasing client demands. In the future, she would like to expand her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to restock her business with more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
María, comenta que con el préstamo anterior se ha visto muy beneficiada, ya que logro surtir su negocio con los productos que sus clientes demandan, con los nuevos ingresos la puntualidad con el pago de sus deudas ha mejorado mucho así como también su estilo de vida.
Nuevamente se decidió por solicitar más capital para comprar pollo, embutidos y otros productos para surtir su negocio, María espera tener buenos resultados como en el crédito anterior.
texts.en: María states that with her previous loan, she has seen a lot of benefits since she was able to stock her business with the products that her customers request.  With the new earnings, her ability to pay back the loan on time has improved, as well as her quality of life.  Recently, she decided to seek more capital to purchase chicken, sausages and other products to stock her building.  María hopes to have good results like she did with the previous loan.

loans.use: purchase chicken, sausages and other products to stock her building.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nora de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, esyá soltera y solo vive junto con su mamá, hijos no tiene por lo tanto solo su madre depende de ella.


Nora se dedica al comercio de queso, ella viaja hasta la ciudad a comprar mercadería y la vende en su comunidad, también tiene que estar pendiente de su madre y del cuidado del hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más queso y así tener su negocio funcionando para satisfacer a sus clientes que tanto lo demandan.
Nora sueña con llegar a tener una tienda especializada en productos lácteos y ser reconocida en su comunidad como mujer luchadora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Nora is 48 years old and has her high school diploma.  She is single and lives with her mother.  She does not have children, so only her mother depends on her.  Nora works selling cheese.  She travels to the city to purchase her merchandise, and she sells it in her community.  She also has to take care of her mother and oversee the care of the house.

She is in need of this loan to purchase more cheese so that she can have a functional business to satisfy her customers who demand it highly.  Nora dreams of having her own store that specializes in dairy products, and being recognized in the community as a woman who is a fighter and a hard worker.

loans.use: purchase more cheese.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para su supervivencia.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura; sabe que es un trabajo duro y mal remunerado, por esta razón desea comenzar con un negocio de cría y venta de ganado bovino y tiene como objetivo obtener su capital comprando lotes de ganado y alimento para los mismos que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos.

Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado
texts.en:
Mauricio from an early age was involved in activities of the fields such as agriculture and cattle raising, tasks that his father taught him for his survival.
These days his principal job is agriculture.  He knows it is hard work and poorly paid.  For this reason, he wants to start a business in the raising and sales of cattle and he has the objective of obtaining capital by buying lots of cattle and feed for the same which will permit him to provide for himself and generate more income.
He is a responsible and loving father.  He lives on a farm with them and his wife.
He dreams of offering his children a quality education so that down the road they will be able to take care of themselves and be independent.
Every day he shows up at his work and tries to do things very well.
The loan will be invested in the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: Titritob - Makayili Group

texts.en:
Akua is 38 years old and a member of a Shea butter processing group. They process Shea butter for both the local and the export markets. She has been doing the business over the last eight years. Their group is called ‘Titritob - Makayili’ Women Association. She makes good profits from the business because she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana and Actionaid on how to process high quality premium Shea nuts and Shea butter for sale.

Akua and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 10,350. Her share of the loan will help her to pay for the cost of 15 bags of Shea nuts for processing.  By so doing, she would increase productivity and income and hence, repay the loan, and support her children’s educational and health needs.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of Shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Chinyama

texts.en:
Chinyama is 45 years old and lives in the city Ndola, Zambia with his two children aged 25 and 18. Both his children are currently attending University.

Chinyama runs his own business. He sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers. He has been operating the business for fifteen years now. Chinyama says he enjoys his business because it is a reliable way for him to provide for his family’s needs like food, shelter, and education.

Chinyama states that his business provides easy access to small business owners in his community to obtain soft drinks without having to travel all the way to the warehouse.

Chinyama is grateful for the opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders. He is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his customers. By purchasing this additional stock, it will help him increase his turnover, grow the business, and earn more profit. 

He says the anticipated increase in his profits will help him provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his customers

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a 27-year-old, married man who has been blessed with two children. His wife adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. Kyalo has been a farmer for a period of two years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Kyalo is now servicing his third loan of KES 50,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm produce. Kyalo plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children, buy farmland, and hopes to start a dairy business in his home town.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his plantation.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a lady who is in the business of offering salon services to clients in the area where she operates her business, but she has also opened a boutique on the side as a secondary business. 

Margaret is married and blessed with four children aged 21, 19, 13 and 4 years. 

She just joined VisionFund and has applied for a first loan which she will use to add more stock of hail oils, hair pieces for the salon, and new dresses for selling to her clients from the boutique.

In the future she would like to expand her businesses to other areas and employ more people.

loans.use: To restock her salon and boutique

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married lady who is blessed with five children aged 18, 16, 12, 7 and 2 and half years. She sells new clothes in her shop, and has had her business for the last five years where she is able to make an income that is able to sustain her family.

Rosemary has applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to add more stocks of new clothes and beauty products in her shop to cater to the changing fashion styles of her clients. In the future, she would like to see her business expand to other areas.

loans.use: to add more stock of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kpanmanga-Nyong-Gumah Group

texts.en:
Zabaga is married and is 38 years old with seven children. She is a member of a shea nut processing group from Nyong-Gumah, in the northern region of Ghana. Zabaga is the person placing both hands on the shea nuts as you look at the group picture. Her group is called ‘Kpan-manga’ Women Association. 

Zabaga has been doing this business with her colleagues in the group for the past six years. With a new loan of GHS 7,800, she can buy and process four bags of shea nuts into shea butter. There are available off-taker organizations and individuals who buy and export the shea butter Zabaga processes.

The injection of this capital would further expand this business and would further increase her income. With the increase income, she would be able to repay the loan and also support her children to eat well and go to school.

loans.use: To buy and process four bags of shea nuts into shea butter.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Cosmas, a very energetic, hardworking and ambitious 28-year-old man who is really determined to succeed. He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area that has produced all the famous athletes in marathons for the world; it is also referred to as the ”home of champions”. Cosmas is from a humble background, and his upbringing was very challenging. He had to work extra hard if he was to succeed in life, and that is why he started farming three years ago so that he can make his dream a reality.

Through income from dairy farming, crop farming, and some personal business, he has been able to support his family and also support his ageing parents. Cosmas is the only bread winner in his family, and he has to work extra hard so as to provide for his family and also support his siblings.
Although Cosmas has been doing farming, he is faced with the challenge of transporting his products to the market because of poor transport system and poor feeder roads from his village; he has been incurring losses through the lack of timely delivery. Because of the above valid reasons he is kindly requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to be able to transport his products to the market.

Through the loan, Cosmas will be able to satisfy the ready market for milk, eggs and vegetables that is there in his village. This loan will greatly improve the life of Cosmas, and he will be able to have a permanent change of lifestyle both for his siblings and also his family.

Cosmas' future plan is to open a large shop in the market where he will be selling and packaging his products both for wholesalers and retailers.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, bananas, oil, baking powder, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, washing soap, tomatoes, cubes, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough soap to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Jenifer, a hardworking, very honest and warmhearted farmer who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Jenifer is the proud mother of two lovely children that she really loves and adores and always protects. Jenifer’s upbringing was very challenging and because of this she promised herself that she would work hard and get out of the poverty situation. That is why she started farming 10 years ago and through farming she has been able to earn a decent income. Jenifer is the breadwinner in her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her two children will have a bright future and also her parents will have a comfortable life.

Jenifer is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land and she dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming.

Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Jenifer is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change.

Through the income from horticulture farming, Jenifer will assure her children of a bright future and she will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan the promise of supporting small scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bedspreads, duvets and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough slippers to sell.

loans.name: Sutiava Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Sutiava está conformada por ocho integrantes madres solteras con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Divido a su condición económica no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar a temprana edad para ayudar con  los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Ana y tiene por actividad económica a la venta de ropa nueva de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. La rutina de trabajo de esta joven mujer es levantarse a las 5 de la mañana  para viajar a las comunidades aledañas ofreciendo su mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, shores, camisas, ropa interior, toallas, ropa de niño. Ella viaja todos los días con un peso de unos  20 kg ofreciendo la mercadería, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que es su medio de trabajo. La asociación comunal Sitiaba agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sutiava” consists of eight members. They are single mothers who are responsible for eight children among them. These members are originally from El Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Due to their financial situations, they were not able to study and were obligated to work at an early age so that they could help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, Ana was chosen to be the coordinator. Her business involves selling new clothes as a street vendor and from her home. The work routine of this young woman is to wake up at 5:00 A.M. so that she can travel to the surrounding communities to offer her merchandise. Ana sells trousers, skirts, shorts, shirts, undergarments, towels, and children’s clothing. She travels around with a load that weighs about 20 kilograms so that she can offer her merchandise. Ana goes about her business with great pleasure since this her means of earning an income.

The Communal Bank “Sutiava” appreciates the help from Kiva lenders since they are providing people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, a way to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, shorts, shirts, undergarments, towels, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of fertilizer for the corn crops.

loans.name: Lakshmi

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a married woman blessed with three sons.  She is from Dhupguri.  Two of her sons are receiving an education in grade 10 and college. Unfortunately, she and her husband both are illiterate and can sign only their names.  They live in the small village of Baroghoria at Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Lakshmi is a housewife and her husband is a land cultivator who has a plot of agricultural land where he grows various vegetables and sells them in the local markets. His wife Lakshmi is a big help in this work, especially at the time of harvesting. But the income from this business hardly covers the household expenses for the family.  They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland for additional income.

Lakshmi is a tenacious woman who is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family. She has taken economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers etc.  Her long-term goal is to go ahead with paddy cultivation, as it is profitable, being the staple food for the people of their region. She and her husband want to harvest the crop in abundance.

In the future, she dreams of purchasing more farmland to cultivate more variety of items to improve their livelihood.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for this economic support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Agalvilakku Self Help Group - Arasalar

texts.en:
Agalvilakku Self Help Group consists of 15 members and has been operating for more than eight years. The group is managed by a local NGO called “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) in the Arasalar village in Tamil Nadu, India. 

Muthulakshmi, the leader of the group, is married and has four children. Her husband is a daily wage worker and Muthulakshmi runs a petty shop.
                                                                              
The members of the group have received small loans from PAT previously and have repaid them on time. These loans have helped them improve their life. Muthulakshmi and her group are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove produced by Grameen Infra. The stove can reduce indoor air pollution and provide a safer environment for their families. This is important as most of their children spend substantial time in and around the kitchen.

This loan will not only help these women buy this stove but also help them provide a healthier life for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali, a 25-year-old young lady, is from Dhupguri.  She is married and a mother of two children (one daughter and one son). Her family consists of her children and her husband Swapan, who is a farmer. They live in their own kachha house (straw, mud and bamboo made) in BoardSchoolpara in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. Both Dipali and her husband have attended schools up to grades six and seven due to their parental poor financial condition. Now one of her children is in grade one and the other is below school-going age.

Dipali's husband is an agronomist.  He loves to work with soil.  He has a small farmland where he works tirelessly from dawn to dusk and grows different kinds of vegetables and paddy rice.  The demand for paddy rice is very good in the region, as it is the staple food of the local people.  He has many customers who want to buy vegetables and rice from him, as he supplies good quality products at reasonable rates.  But it is a competitive market, so his income is not sufficient to provide financial sustenance to the family.  He wants to grow more paddy rice, but his main obstacle is funding.

So Dipali has decided to help her husband by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She wants to use the loan to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessary things to grow better quality products to satisfy her customers. She hopes the loan will provide her with additional income to reach her goals, which are to raise her children smoothly and construct a better and decent house for them to live in.

She is thankful to BJS as well as Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a rural woman, 31 years ago, from Dhupguri, who lives with her husband Santosh, 46 years old, and their two children. She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer by profession. She has received a primary education due to the poor financial resources of her family. Her children read in grades five and nine. They live in Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district in their own house.

Her husband is involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where he grows potatoes, beans and eggplants.  He is very hard working and does his best to insure a good harvest. He sells his agricultural products to the local markets.  He is a very polite and well-behaved person, which is why his customers like him. But he can't grow a variety of vegetables and satisfy his customers due to the lack of capital.

Kabita is involved in animal breeding to help her husband.  For the last few years, she has been supplying milk to her neighbors to earn an income for her family.  Yet they are unable to fulfill the family's needs.  She has only one dairy cow in her herd but she has decided to purchase one more to expand her milk supply business and that's why she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase one more dairy cow.  Once the cow is purchased, she will be able to expand her business of selling milk. This will increase the family income and Kabita hopes to be able to improve the livelihood of her family.

She aspires to build her cattle herd in the future with her business profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her milk supply business.

loans.name: Mahamuda

texts.en:
Mahamuda, 21 years old, is married and the young mother of one son.  She is from Dhupguri.  She lives there with her husband, Jhilu, age 24, and her only son, who is in grade 1 now. In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity to advance her education level due to the poor financial resources of her parents.  So she is earnestly trying to provide education for her son. 

Mahamuda and her husband do farm labor, such as weeding, caring for the crop, and other tasks, before harvesting the crops.  They cultivate different vegetables in different seasons.  With several years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way, including the rising cost of inputs and the instability of prices for buying and selling vegetables. Now that her son is growing up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, they feel the need to further improve their agricultural activities.  They have decided to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop and, being the staple food of the regional people, is in much demand throughout the year. So they think it will be a profitable business, which will earn more income.

Currently, Mahamuda is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy agricultural supplies, such as paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc., to start cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hope in getting ahead because her household expenses depend on this work. Her dream as a mother is to raise her son so he will be a generous and noble citizen.  With her profits she plans to build a concrete house for them.

Mahamuda conveys her thanks to her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Productos deportivos, camisetas, gorras afiches, entre otros articulos fue lo que compró Luis con su anterior crédito y logró aumentar el sutido su capital de trabajo, sus ventas y sus utilidades. Sus ingresos familiares han mejorado y su nivel de vida tambien . Luis dice a sus finaciadores : "Muy agradecido por el apoyo, mi negocio ha crecido en capital mercancias, liquidéz , ventas y utilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, pues requiere una vez mas comprar nuevos articulos deportivos que se encuentran a la moda, debido a que su negocio se encuenta cerca al estadio Metropolitando de Barranquilla, escenario donde juegan los equipos profesionales de futbol, es la caasa de la Selección  y lugar  en el que el Junior, equipo local es su anfitrion. Allí hay gran afluencia de aficionados y fanaticos que hacen sus compras constantemete y con ellos Luis logra que sus ventas se incrmenten, convirtiendo sus inversiones en exitosas.
texts.en:
Sporting goods, T-shirts, caps, and posters were among the things Luis bought with his previous loan.  He succeeded in increasing his stock, working capital, sales and profits.   Family income has increased and the family standard of living has also improved.  

Luis says to the lenders, "Thanks very much for your support.  My business has grown in capital goods, liquidity, sales and profits."  Now he is applying for a loan because he again wants to buy new sporting goods that are in style, since his business is located near the Metropolitan Stadium of Barranquilla.  Professional soccer teams play there daily.  The stadium is the home of the Seleccion (World Cup team) and Atletico Junior, local team, is its host. A wealth of fans and enthusiasts are constantly buying and Luis is succeeding in increasing sales to them, making his investments successful.

loans.use: to buy new sporting goods to stock his store

loans.name: Veronica Altagracia

texts.es:
Verónica, es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes que está instalado en su vivienda, la atiende de siete de la mañana a ocho de la noche, su negocio ya tiene un año de estar funcionando, lo heredó de sus padres; Verónica es soltera, vive con sus padres y un hermano.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar harina, granos básicos, bebidas azúcar, etc., así surtirá el inventario de la tienda con nueva mercadería para tener un negocio más competitivo que le dé más ganancias, las cuales utilizara para ahorrar e iniciar a estudiar bachillerato en Enero del próximo año.
Sus objetivos son resarcir su deuda con mucha rapidez, crecer con su negocio y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Veronica is the proprietor of a grocery store that is set up in her home. She tends it from seven in the morning to eight at night. Her business has already been functioning for a year. She inherited it from her parents. Veronica is single. She lives with her parents and a brother.

She will use the loan to buy flour, basic grains, beverages, sugar, etc. Thus she will stock the inventory of her store with new merchandise to have a more competitive business that will give her more earnings, which she will save in order to begin studying for her high school degree in January of the next year.

Her goals are to repay her debt very rapidly, to grow her business, and to have a better style of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, basic grains, beverages, sugar, etc., to thus stock the inventory of her store with new merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan tiene 22 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, está soltero y vive con su madre y hermanos y son los únicos que dependen de él. 

Joven emprendedor son las palabras que definen a Juan, él trabaja en la agricultura y lo aprendió de su madre, además se dedica a cuidar ganado y tiene más de 5 años realizando estas actividades, ya que es su fuente más fuerte de ingresos, él camina 20 minutos para llegar al lugar de trabajo, su madre y su hermana lo apoyan  en las diferentes actividades y trabajan todos los días.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y pesticidas los cuales aplicará a su milpa y cultivo de frijol para obtener buena cosecha, además pagará la mano de obra.

Su sueño a futuro es formar su propio hogar y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a los que en un futuro dependan de él.
texts.en:
Luis is 22 years old, and could only stay in school till ninth grade.  He is single and lives with his mother and brothers, who are the only people depending on him.

"Young entrepreneur" is the way to describe Juan.  He works at farming, and learned this from his mother.  He also takes care of cattle, and has done both types of work for more than five years, this being his most important source of income.  He walks 20 minutes to get to his work place.  His mother and her sister assist him daily with all the work.

Juan needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to apply to his cornfield and bean plants to get a good harvest, and also to pay for hand labor.  His dream for the future is to have his own home and offer a better quality of life to those who may depend on him in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to apply to his cornfield and his bean plants to get a good harvest, and also to pay for hand labor

loans.name: G.s San Jose Oropoli Group

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación.
Doña Martha atiende personalmente a sus clientes todos los días de la semana, sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su mismo barrio, su negocio le ayuda de gran manera.
Doña Martha esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de refrescos, embutidos, pollo, lácteos, pan huevos, churos, jugos, manteca, arroz, sopas instantáneas, pañales, pastas, jabón, gerber, leche en polvo aceites y papel higiénico. Para su negocio, espera que esta inversión le permita obtener más ganancias para cubrir sus gastos personales y poder seguir apoyando a su familia. 
Doña Santos Felipa su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio de venta de abarrotería en general y un molino que tiene desde hace 12 años.
Doña María Isabel su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de zapatos de hule, ropa en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años.

Danlí, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is an enterprising and dedicated woman who has a business of selling groceries. She has been doing this for 15 years. Her business is located in her home.

Doña Martha personally attends to her customers every day of the week. Her main customers are people who live in her neighborhood. Her business has helped in a great way.

Doña Martha is requesting a loan in order to buy soft drinks, cured meats, chicken, dairy products, bread, eggs, snack foods, juices, lard, rice, instant soups, diapers, pastas, soap, baby food, powdered milk, and toilet paper. She hopes that this investment for her business will allow her to generate more income so that she can cover her personal expenses and continue to support her family.

Doña Santos Felipa also sells groceries as her main source of income. She also has a grain mill and has been in business for 12 years.

Doña María Isabel sells clothes and rubber shoes as her main source of income. She has been in business for three years.

Danlí, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Judlyne

texts.fr: Judlyne se sent très heureuse de son premier prêt en vendant des produits Enèji Pwòp une compagnie qui vend des produits solaires et des réchauds efficace elle a été créer par Earthspark. Judlyne vit à Port-au-Prince et elle est célibataire. Judlyne travaille actuellement en tant que médecin mais aussi propriétaire d’un magasin. Elle est maintenant intéressé a lancer une entreprise comme un entrepreneur de l’Enèji Pwòp à intégrer ces produits dans son magasin.
texts.en: With her first loan, Judlyne feels very happy selling products from Enèji Pwòp, a company that sells solar products and efficient stoves. It was created by Earthspark. Judlyne lives in Port-au-Prince, and she is unmarried. She currently works as a doctor but also as the owner of a store. She is now interested in launching an enterprise as an Enèji Pwòp entrepreneur in order to integrate these products into her store.

loans.use: to purchase renewable energy products

loans.name: Farah

texts.fr: Farah représente d’une organisation communautaire (SOHADERK) qui se spécialise dans la vente des produits agricole. Farah a déjà prix un prêt a lancer son entreprise de vente au détail d’Enèji Pwòp. Elle vend des produits Enèji Pwòp sur une base de location propre dans sa communauté. Elle vient prendre un deuxième prêt a la demande de sa communauté pour une source d’énergie renouvelable qui permettra aux clients d'économiser de l’argent tout en aidant l'environnement.
texts.en: Farah represents a community organization (SOHADERK) which is specialized in selling farm products. Farah has already take out a loan to launch her Enèji Pwòp retail enterprise. She sells Enèji Pwòp products on a proper rental basis in her community. She just took out her second loan upon request from her community for a source of renewable energy that will enable customers to save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: to purchase renewable energy products

loans.name: Mangaiyar Shg - Cholapuram Group

texts.en:
Cholapuram is a small village in Trichy district. 17 women from the village are members of “Mangaiyar” SHG.  Bhavani is the leader of the group. She is living with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer. The family is living in their own house. 

Bhavani (who is sitting with her hand raised in the picture) and the other 16 members are seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove. Currently, all members are using conventional firewood stoves that produce more smoke, which is affecting the health of their family members. All members have planned to buy a Greenway smart (smokeless) stove. It is a single burner, high-efficiency cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel, produces 70% less smoke and uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Saibaba Self-Help Group - Patteeshwaram

texts.en:
The Saibaba Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group consists of eight industrious women.
Patteeshwaram is a village in Tanjore District of Tamil Nadu, India. Rani (standing with her hand raised), the leader of the Saibaba Self-Help Group, lives with her husband and two children. Her spouse is a farmer by profession.
  
All the group members are seeking a loan to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra. This stove would result in long-term savings as it will reduce the amount spent on fuel and would be less hazardous to their health due to reduced smoke emissions.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Ankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe ANKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à  SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  FANTA  débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes ANKADI, fait la vente des pagnes wax réal .
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 15 pièces de pagne wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail  au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group ANKADI are married women, who average 34 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in SANOUBOUGOU II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their ninth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. FANTA, who is standing in the middle in the photo of this women’s group ANKADI, sells Réal Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to use her loan to purchase 15 lengths of Réal Wax pagne cloth at the big market, where she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products, which she sells retail at the market to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. Part of it is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase Réal Wax pagne cloth

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 71 años de edad, no fue a la escuela debido a que sus padres no la apoyaron pues para ellos era mejor trabajar, se casó y tuvo 6 hijos, su esposo murió y fue ella quien tuvo que seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia.


Francisca se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde muy joven, sus padres también se dedicaban a la venta de frutas en el mercado de la ciudad y la llevaban para que fuera aprendiendo.
