Francisca inició su propio negocio de venta de frutas, verduras, quesadillas, tamales y pan variado, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las cinco de la mañana. Además sus padres le enseñaron a elaborar jabón, petates y lazos los cuales tenían que tejer con sus hermanos y salir  a venderlos a las comunidades. 

El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar una vaca y aumentar su número de ganado, el resto lo necesita para comprar mas frutas y verduras y con ello tener mas variedad para sus clientes.

Ella sueña con tener una pequeña granja de cerdos en su hogar, pues tiene espacio donde construirla.
texts.en:
Francisca is 71 years old and was not able to attend school. Her parents did not support her and thought it would be better for her to work. She is married and has six children. Her husband is deceased, so she continues to work in order to help her family get ahead.

Francisca has been selling fruits and vegetables from a very young age. Her parents also sold fruit at the city market, which is where she learned the trade. She started her own business of selling fruits, vegetables, cakes, tamales, and various types of bread. In addition, her parents taught her how to produce soap, bed mats, and woven rope that she had to make with her siblings before going out to sell them in the community.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a cow so that she can increase her herd. The rest of the loan will be used to buy more fruits and vegetables, which will allow her to have more variety that she can offer to her customers.

Francisca dreams of having a small pig pen at home since she has enough space to build one.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell and to acquire a cow in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, skirts and blouses for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's clothes.

loans.name: Eva Juana

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 30 años de edad soltera, sin hijos y se dedica al acopio de retazos de tela para reutilizarlos en el relleno de colchones, su segunda actividad es la apicultura.
Eva es una persona de carácter humilde, sencilla, amable, alegre, responsable, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona ’16 de julio’ de la ciudad de El Alto, situado al oeste de Bolivia a una altura de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar, este lugar se mueve al ritmo del mercado de alimentos, ropa confeccionada artesanalmente, ropa usada, etc. El clima del lugar es frío durante todo el año y no llega a superar lo diecisiete grados centígrados en verano, la temperatura bajo cero son comunes en días de invierno y también los fuertes vientos que provienen del altiplano.
Eva es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su segunda actividad es la apicultura, ella lleva tres años de experiencia en el criado de abejas con el objetivo de obtener miel y recolectar polen, propoleo, jalea real, etc. Ella desea expandir su negocio; para llevar a cabo esa meta necesita realizar la compra de un terreno en el pueblo de Caranavi (distante a 150 km de la ciudad de La Paz, En el sector conocido como faja de Yungas - Cordillera Oriental de los Andes, Su clima es cálido húmedo, con una temperatura que oscila entre los 20 y los 32 grados centígrados), donde pueda instalar sus colmenas y enjambres de abejas.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para desarrollar su actividad de apicultura y cumplir con sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Eva is a 30-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She collects fabrics scraps that can be reused for stuffing mattresses. Her second business involves beekeeping.

Eva is a humble unassuming individual who is also friendly, cheerful, responsible, enterprising, and hardworking. She carries out her work in the July 16th District of the city of El Alto, which is located in western Bolivia and situated 4,000 meters above sea level. This place moves according to the rhythm of the food markets, the handmade clothing artisans, the used clothing sellers, and other establishments. The local climate is cold throughout the year since it does not get any higher than 16 degrees centigrade during the summer. Temperatures below freezing are common during the winter since strong winds blow from the highlands.

Eva has tan skin, long black hair, and is of medium height. Her second business involves beekeeping and she has three years of experience with raising bees with the intention of collecting honey, pollen, propolis, royal jelly, and other products. Eva wants to expand her business so that she can accomplish her goal of purchasing a plot of land in the town of Caranavi, which is 150 kilometers from the city of La Paz in the sector known as Faja De Yungas – Corillera Oriental de Los Andes. The weather in that area is humid and has a temperature that fluctuates between 20 and 32 degrees centigrade. This is where she hopes to set up hives with swarms of bees.

For this reason, Eva is requesting a loan so that she can develop her beekeeping business and accomplish the goals she has planned.

loans.use: to develop her beekeeping business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ana Flora

texts.es:
Ana tiene 46 años de edad,  logró estudiar profesorado en educación básica gracias al apoyo que le dieron sus padres, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, Ana y sus hijos viven junto a sus padres que también dependen de ella.
 

Ana tiene 18 años de estar ejerciendo su profesión, ella se siente muy satisfecha de estar compartiendo sus  conocimientos con sus alumnos, cuando ella estaba estudiando se dedicaba a trabajar de oficios domésticos, para poder pagar los gastos de la carrera, además ahora de vez en cuando trabaja en la agricultura y lo hace con mano de obra pagada, pero también se involucran sus hijos en los tiempos libres. 

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para la parcela de maíz, comprará 6 sacos de fertilizantes, 2 bolsas de semillas de maíz certificada, pagará el alquiler del terreno y la mano de obra. 

En un futuro ella desea tener un buen rendimiento de su cosecha,  para poder darle buena alimentación a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and studied to become a teacher, thanks to the support she received from her parents. She is a single mother with two children who attend the school in her community. Ana and her children live with her parents, who are also dependent on her.

Ana was 18 years old when she started her profession. She gets a great deal of satisfaction from sharing her knowledge with her students. While she was studying, Ana performed housekeeping jobs in order to pay for her degree expenses. Now she is also working in agriculture, which means that she has to pay for labor. Her children are also involved in this business whenever they have free time.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies for her parcel of corn. She will buy six sacks of fertilizer and two bags of certified corn seeds. Ana will also pay the rent on her land and for labor. In the future, she hopes to achieve good output from her harvest so that she can feed her family well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, certified seeds, and also pay the rent on her land and for labor.

loans.name: Yohana Andrea

texts.es:
Yohana es una campesina humilde y trabajadora de 26 años de edad, que desde pequeña aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.

Actualmente se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Támesis. Con este oficio sostiene a sus hijos y le da educación.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de cerdos de engorde y adicionalmente para la construcción de un corral para albergarlos.

Esto le permitirá seguir con su actividad y tener su negocio a flote.

Con este préstamo estarás apoyando a una mujer emprendedora que nunca se rinde ante las adversidades.
texts.en:
Yohana is a 26-year-old rural resident who is humble and hardworking. At a young age, she learned everything about farm work thanks to the lessons from her parents.

Yohana currently raises and sells pigs from her home in the town of Támesis. Through this trade, she is able to support her children and provide for their education. She was motivated to request a loan so that she could invest in the purchase of pigs for fattening. In addition, she plans to build a pen for housing them. This will enable her to continue her business and keep it afloat.

This loan will support an enterprising woman who never gives up because of adversity.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pay for the construction of an animal pen.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Albert, a very hardworking, honest and easy-to-get-along-with farmer. He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is known all over the world because it's home to the best marathon runners. Albert is a father of three lovely children who he really adores, and they always make Albert work extra hard so that they can have a secure future. Albert's upbringing was very challenging and he never got all the basic needs that he desired, but he promised himself that he will work extra hard to improve his living conditions and also improve the living conditions for his parents. This is why he started farming and he has been doing it for the last eight years. Albert's primary source of income is crop and dairy farming and through this, he has been able to earn an honest income.

Albert passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows ”Gomargong." Albert has a large amount of space on his farm so he wants to increase the number of his dairy cows. However, one challenge he is facing is accessing funds because he is a small-scale farmer. Knowing that organizations such as Kiva support small-scale farmers, Albert feels relieved and knows his dream of improving his living conditions will be realized.

Albert plans to accumulate the profits gathered and open a feed shop, and a milk retail shop. Through this he will be able to comfortably take care of his family and siblings and assure them of a bright future. Albert believes that through your loan you will be delivering the promise of transforming lives.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kurinji” Self-Help Group - Mounasamimadam

texts.en:
Rukkumanidevi is a 42-year-old lady residing in Mounasamimadam, a small village in the Tanjore district in Tamil Nadu, India. She has two children. The couple sells betel leaves to earn an income.  Rukkumanidevi is the leader of “Kurinji” Self-Help Group (SHG) with other 10 members. The group has been managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last six years.

Rukkumanidevi and her group members are requesting a loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. Each group member is requesting a small loan of INR 1400, which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.
 
Rukkumanidevi and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense all the while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil to sell.

loans.name: Delmy Isabel

texts.es:
Delmy tiene 27 años de edad, estudió hasta 5°grdo de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ella no pudo continuar con sus estudios,  está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al trabajo de transporte colectivo de pasajeros, tiene 2 hijos y son los que dependen de ella.
 
Delmy se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, ella tiene 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo y lo aprendió ya que cuando se acompañó le ayudaba a vender a su suegra. Ella viaja 15 minutos en carro para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo.


Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar materia prima para surtir mas su negocio, comprará 4 mesas, 10 sillas y materia prima para elaborar la comida.

Su sueño a futuro es tener un negocio establecido que le permita darle una mejor atención a sus clientes, y obtener rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Delmy is 27 years old and studied through the fifth grade. Due to limited financial resources, she was not able to continue her studies. Delmy is in a relationship and her partner works for a passenger transportation collective. She has two children who are dependent on her.

Delmy sells food from a stand at the city market. She has five years of experience in this type of work and learned the trade when she got married by helping her mother-in-law. Delmy travels 15 minutes by car in order to get to her workplace.

This loan will be used to buy supplies for restocking her business. She will also buy four tables, ten chairs, and ingredients for preparing food. Her dream for the future is to have an established business where she can provide better service to her customers and achieve profitability.

loans.use: to buy four tables, ten chairs, ingredients, and supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal, pepper, batteries, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dora Lidia

texts.es:
Dora tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus hijos de 15, 18 y 23 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Ella se dedicaba a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos y para el arriendo del terreno. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a ser labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Dora is 46 years old and single. She lives with her children (ages 15, 18, and 23) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Dora works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides so that she can improve her crop production. Dora will also pay the lease on her land. Her purchases are conducted in Ventanas. Her goal is to improve crop production, while her challenge is being able to transport her crops.

In her free time, Dora focuses on performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, fungicides, and pay the lease on her land.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old male Ugandan married to Eva. They have two children aged 22 and 19. All of the children are in school.

John is a cattle keeper and also grows crops like maize and beans. He has been doing these activities since 2000.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy cows for fattening. He later sells them for a profit.

His plan for the future is to acquire more land for grazing his cattle and also have a better breed of cows on his farm.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening

loans.name: Tomasi

texts.en:
Tomasi is a 32-year-old Ugandan married to Juliet. They have two children aged three and six years old.

Tomasi is a businessman who operates a retail shop selling general merchandise. He also has other economic activities like Boda Boda riding and rentals.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to expand his business and to buy more land when he has accumulated enough profits. 

He faces the challenge of competition from people who deal in similar businesses.

Tomasi describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items like sugar, corn flour, rice, and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as batteries, soap, mosquito coils, and razor blades to sell.

loans.name: Blakalama   A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BLAKALAMA  A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 56 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KABOILA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame DJENEBA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BLAKALAMA  A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Blakalama A group are married women who on average are 56 years old with four children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kaboila, a commune in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution  to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is mil featuring Mrs. Djénèba, who is standing in the second position from left to right in the photo of this Blakalama A group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 2 drums of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Blakalama   B Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe BLAKALAMA  B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KABOILA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame NASSARAN débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BLAKALAMA  B. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Blakalama B group are married women who on average are 52 years old with three children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kaboila, a commune in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is mil featuring Mrs. Nassaran, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Blakalama B group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 2 drums of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Kpanmanga Bimbilla - Gumbihini Group

texts.en:
Awabu is a 46-year-old active woman from Bimbilla in the Northern part of Ghana. She is married and has seven children. She is the person squatting with both hands placed on the basin of shea nuts in their group picture. 

Awabu is a member of this shea butter processing group which has been doing business over the last two years. Their group is called ‘Kpanmanga Bimbilla - Gumbihini’ Women Association. She makes good profits from the business since she has been trained by Grameen Ghana on improving ways of processing high quality shea butter and selling to customers around Ghana.

Awabu and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 14,750. Her share of the loan will help her to buy and process five bags of shea nuts into shea butter. By so doing, she will earn more income and hence repay this loan and support her children’s educational and health needs.

loans.use: to buy and process five bags of shea nuts into shea butter.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos es una persona responsable y trabajadora, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja en su pequeña parcela que se compró hace tiempo con mucho esfuerzo, trabajando todos los días como jornalero, ahora ya no tiene que estar trabajando para otras personas, porque tiene un terreno propio donde dedicarse a su actividad económica, actualmente solicita un credito para ampliar su plantación de plátano de freír, para generar un poco más de ingresos y así mejorar su nivel de vida, para que cuando tenga una familia, no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is a responsible and hardworking individual.  He is 25 years old, single, and has no children.  Santos works on a small parcel of land that he purchased after a great deal of effort as a result of working constantly as a day laborer.  

Today Santos no longer has to work for other people because he has his own land where he can dedicate his time to his business.  He is requesting a loan in order to expand his plantain farm.  This will enable him to generate a little more revenue in order to improve his standard of living for when he has a family, so that they will not want for anything.

loans.use: to expand his plantain farm, after years of work as a day laborer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Agabito

texts.en:
Agabito is a 32-year-old male Ugandan married to Scovia. They have three children aged 3, 7, and 10 years old. Two children attend school.

Agabito is a carpenter, and he sells items like chairs, tables, and stools. He has been doing this since 2010. He is also a farmer and grows crops like maize.

He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to invest in his business. He wants to buy timber to make furniture.

His plan for the future is to expand his business, but the challenge he faces is the low turnover of his sales since most of his products are durable.

Agabito describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture

loans.name: Mujeres Prudentes Group

texts.en:
As a young, single woman, 25-year-old Angélica works hard every day to raise the standard of living for herself and her family.  She is an indigenous “Maya-Kiche” and belongs to the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Prudentes” meaning “Wise Women”. 

Angélica was unable to access a formal education past nine years due to the poor economic condition of her family. She helps to support her family now and she realized some time ago, that by joining a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, she could obtain some capital and start her own business.

Angélica has a small shoe business at a local market stall to sell women and children's shoes. She buys her inventory from a shoe factory owned by her sister. They enjoy a successful business relationship. Angélica requests a new loan  to purchase the latest shoe styles and meet her customers' demand.

The eight ladies in the “Mujeres Prudentes” Trust Bank benefit greatly from their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer offers Angélica and her friends interesting and timely information on a variety of subjects like effective business management practices, personal health and hygiene, good nutritional habits and the use of medicinal plants. The ladies also are empowered with information about self-esteem, women’s rights, leadership as well as violence against women. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it really does work!

KIVA investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge in the lives of these women who are determined to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. They envision a brighter and more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, KIVA investors for your generous participation!

loans.use: to purchase the latest shoe styles and meet  her customers' demands.

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai resides in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. She has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

In addition, Rumbidzai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells hand bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has  run this business for the past year and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the Kiva loan, Rumbidzai will purchase stock to increase her inventory. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase stock items to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Moisés Leonardo

texts.es: Moisés de 20 años de edad, es soltero y se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Psicología en la Universidad. La duración total de la carrera es de 5 años y el lleva estudiando 3 años desde que inició. Actualmente se encuentra prestando servicios de apoyo en un centro juvenil, generando ingresos el cual lo destina para pagar sus estudios. El está muy entusiasmado y motivado en terminar su carrera, ya que son sus padres quienes le dan la fuerza para poder salir adelante. Uno de sus mayores retos es el poder estudiar y trabajar a la misma vez, es por eso que le pone mucho entusiasmo y dedicación a sus estudios. Su objetivo para el futuro es convertirse en un Psicólogo forense y contribuir en programas de investigación sobre la salud mental. Moisés usara el crédito para financiar sus estudios en el extranjero. A la vez nos da su aporte de gratitud ya que se siente agradecido por el préstamo que se le brindó ya que le están  ayudando a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Moisés is 20 years old, single, and studying for a degree in Psychology at the university. His degree program lasts five years and he is in his third year.

Moisés is currently providing support services at a juvenile center as a way of earning income to pay for his studies. He is very enthusiastic and excited about finishing his degree since his parents gave him the strength to press forward. One of his biggest challenges is being able to study and work at the same time. For this reason, he invests a great deal of his enthusiasm and dedication into his studies. His goal for the future is to become a forensic psychologist so that he can contribute to research programs that focus on mental health.

Moisés will use this loan to finance his studies abroad. He expresses his gratitude for the support since he feels grateful for the loan that has been given to him. This will help him to accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his studies abroad.

loans.name: Nueva Vision Tacajalve Group

texts.en:
San Francisco El Alto is a municipality in the department of Totonicapan in Southwestern Guatemala.  The local economy is based on hundreds of small family-owned and operated clothing fabricators, with the result that clothing exports now exceed the traditional ones of coffee, sugar, and bananas. In a neighborhood of the town, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nueva Vision Tacajalve” meaning “New Vision of Tacajalve” was formed by 13 women,  the  average age is 42 years. 

Sebastiana is a member of the Trust Bank and applying for her very first loan. She is a single, 26-year-old woman who completed school through the 5th grade because her family was poor and she had to work. Several years ago, Sebastiana began her textile business and sells clothing for men, women and children. She sells each day during the week at the local market. She needs to infuse more capital into the business and will use the funds to purchase  pants, t-shirts, and blouses of various sizes, colors and designs. Sebastiana wants to keep her current customers happy and at the same time, attract new customers. She uses the profits from her business to meet the expenses of her large family. Sebastiana has seven siblings and her parents’ income is not enough to cover all the expenses.

In addition to the loans, Sebastiana and the ladies in the Trust Bank benefit from the non-formal education program of Friendship Bridge. Each month, a Loan Officer from the organization shares practical information with the women. Among the topics covered are women’s leadership, women’s identity, empowerment and self-esteem as well as health, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. The ladies learn how to more successfully manage their small businesses with knowledge about marketing, pricing, customer service as well as budgeting and accounting. 

The 13 women of the “Nueva Vision Tacajalve” Trust Bank thank KIVA investors for believing in them and their goals. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, combining small loans and education, is a vital lifeline for the women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase more product including pants, t-shirts, and blouses of various sizes, colors and designs

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.en:
A year ago, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank "Las Cruces" from Chuanoj, a community in the Department of Totonicapán in Southwest Guatemala, received a loan funded by KIVA investors. This loan was paid off completely and successfully. Now the group is applying for a new loan which they hope the KIVA investors will fund. For this new loan cycle, the group is composed of thirteen women, one of which is new to the group.

As with all the Friendship Bridge Trust Banks, "Las Cruces" has its own Board of Directors. Anastasia is 25 years old and Treasurer of the group. She married at a very young age and has four children. Anastasia has a textile business that she started four years ago and creates beautiful high quality traditional clothing. Specifically, she weaves “cortes” that are tubular skirts generally woven on a foot-powered, treadle loom.  The business is progressing quite well and Anastasia now has two employees. She requests a loan to purchase two more foot looms and to buy supplies including thread for her business.

The women of the Trust Bank are very aware of the importance of education. Anastasia is pleased that three of her children are in elementary school, an opportunity that she was not afforded. Anastasia has a chance to gain new knowledge at the monthly meetings of her Trust Bank when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer conducts educational seminars on relevant subjects like effective business management practices, nutrition, health and hygiene as well as self-esteem and women’s empowerment. Friendship Bridge has called the effective combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Friendship Bridge and KIVA form a useful and successful alliance in the lives of the women of the “Las Cruces” Trust Bank. The ladies are very happy and grateful to be able to empower themselves and create better lives for themselves, their families and their community of Chuanoj, Guatemala.

loans.use: to purchase two additional foot looms and to buy thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Alaisa

texts.en:
Alaisa is a 44-year-old widow with 8 children. She runs a small canteen business and  sells chips to the members of her community, especially to school children. She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than 3 years to gain access to financial assistance. 

She plans to use this money to purchase a new cooking stove, a large frying pan, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, cooking oil, sugar, and sausages for her canteen and chips business. 

Alaisa hopes to continue to expand and continue the successful management of her business to provide a better living for her large family.

loans.use: to purchase a new cooking stove, a  large frying pan, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, cooking oil, sugar, and sausages.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 26-year-old unmarried woman with 1 child. She makes and sells samoan taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Telesia needs a loan to buy bags of taro, a barrel of cooking oil, a large deep pot, a new oven and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Telesia has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of taro, a barrel of cooking oil, a large deep pot, a new oven and plastic bags.

loans.name: Blakalama   C Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe BLAKALAMA  C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KABOILA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame SALI débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BLAKALAMA  C. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Blakalama C group are married women who on average are 29 years old with two children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kaboila, a commune in the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is mil featuring Mrs. Sali, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Blakalama C group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 74,000 CFA francs per growing season. This will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Lilian Sarai

texts.es:
Lilian, por los efectos positivos que tiene al invertir créditos en su sastrería se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar hilos, botones, telas, encajes, etc., para elaborar prendas de vestir.
Lilian utilizo el préstamo anterior para tener a su disposición los materiales de costura que necesitaba para cumplir con el contrato de uniformes, está acción le ha generado mejores ganancias con las cuales ha cumplido con sus compromisos. Su grupo familiar se mantiene y viven en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
Lilian has experienced positive effects as a result of investing loans into her tailoring business. For this reason, she decided to request a new loan so that she could buy thread, buttons, fabric, lace, and other supplies for making clothes.

Lilian used her previous loan to acquire sewing materials that she needed to complete an order for uniforms. This resulted in more earnings, which allowed her to fulfill her commitments. She has been able to sustain her family and help them live under better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, fabric, lace, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Chuimekena Group

texts.en:
The eight ladies of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuimekena”, meaning “Over the Hot Water” in the Mayan Kiche language, are happy to report that they successfully repaid their previous loan. They are now applying for a new loan cycle with KIVA. The ladies want KIVA investors to know that with the previous loan, they were able to sustain or expand their small businesses, that benefitted themselves and their families. 

The Secretary of the group for this new loan cycle is Juana who is 45 years old and has 3 children. Juana is starting her second loan cycle and she reports that with her first loan, she felt very blessed because she increased her income. Juana has two businesses which are textile production and animal husbandry. She is applying for a new loan and will use it to purchase 100 chickens, chicken feed,  thread and supplies for her textile business. She is very excited about the possibilities for expansion of both businesses.

The Trust Bank “Chuimekena” looks forward to their monthly meetings when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer meets with them. Besides conducting business transactions, the Loan Officer presents educational trainings and the ladies can immediately put the newly acquired information to work in their lives. They are eager to learn about effective business practices, budgeting and accounting. The women also learn about hygiene, health and medicinal plants. Other relevant subjects include nutrition, self esteem and women’s rights. 

The women are grateful for the opportunity to secure loans and education. They are hopeful to gain support from investors throughout the world. Empowered by their new tools and their determination to empower themselves and eliminate poverty, they face a brighter tomorrow filled with hope and new dreams. KIVA investors are valuable partners in this effort!

loans.use: to purchase 100 chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati is a 40-year-old married woman with 6 children. She rents and runs a small shop at one of the markets in the industrial zone area of Vaitele and also has a cattle farm. 

She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than 4 years to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this loan to purchase posts and fencing wire for her cattle farm. Vasati has managed to do well in her businesses and also had the ability to make a lot of improvements in her family's livelihoods. She hopes to continue to do well in her businesses through saving a lot of her profits from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase posts and fencing wire.

loans.name: Fiaavae

texts.en:
Fiaavae is a 39-year-old married woman with 5 children. She  plans to start a small elei printing business to sell to the members of her community and the public. She has  joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase fabric and design boards to start her elei printing business. 

Fiaavae hopes to improve her family's living standards from the profits she would be earning from her business and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and design boards.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara is a 30-year-old single woman with 4 children. She has run a small tailoring business in her community for 2 years. 

Mara has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Celestial Group

texts.en:
Kiva partners with Friendship Bridge in Guatemala to offer microloans and non-formal, participatory education to impoverished women so that they can create their own solution to fight against poverty for themselves, their families, and communities. The loans are of great value to the 11 members of the Friendship Bridge “Celestial” Trust Bank. The ultimate goal for the women is to break the cycle of poverty for themselves and for future generations.

Florencia is a 58-year-old woman from Cantel, Quetzaltenango, Guatemala and a member of the Trust Bank “Celestial” meaning “Heavenly”. She is starting her second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, funded by Kiva investors. Florencia has a convenience store and will use her new loan to buy inventory including rice, pasta, chorizo, cheese, sausage, sugar, juices and coffee.  She reports that her business is progressing well and that she wants to invest additional funds to generate more income for her family. 

The ladies of the Trust Bank have been participating in the educational training program of Friendship Bridge at their monthly meetings. A loan officer facilitates this part of the meetings and the ladies enhance their leadership skills, participate in group discussions and practice teamwork techniques. They discuss topics such as women’s health, self-esteem and leadership. They learn about women’s rights and violence against women. To help them with their loans and small businesses, they learn about business management and administration, budgeting, accounting and marketing. Finally, the ladies learn about the use of medicinal plants and nutrition. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the small loans and educational trainings “Microcredit Plus”.

Kiva investors are greatly appreciated by the women of the “Celestial” Trust Bank for their kindness and generosity in providing capital for their loans. We shall report on their progress in an upcoming report. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy inventory including rice, pasta, chorizo, cheese, sausage, sugar, juices and coffee

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame BINTOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala 1 group are married women who on average are 46 years old with three children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a populous area in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Bintou, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Kotognogontala 1 group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy three 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, three drums of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Kotognogontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ALIMA assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Kotognogontala 2 group are married women who on average are 50 years old with five children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a populous area in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Alima, who is sitting in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Kotognogontala 2 group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy three 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, three drums of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Malae

texts.en:
Malae is a 67-year-old widow with 10 children. She runs a small elei business assisted by her children and sells  to the members of her community and to  the public. She has been with the SPBD program for more than 3 years to gain access to financial assistance. 

She plans to use this money to purchase plywood, rolls and brushes, fabric materials, and fabric paints to further improve her elei business. Malae has managed to provide a better living for her large family without relying on others for their welfare.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, rolls and brushes, fabric materials, and fabric paints.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is 34 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small vegetable garden to grow cabbages and tomatoes to sell in her community and market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Aliitasi needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Aliitasi will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She has owned and operated a small store to sell a variety of items for 5 years. 

Mele needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sacks of onions, and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to  renovate her house and pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sacks of onions, and potatoes.

loans.name: Lisi

texts.en: Lisi is a 63-year-old married woman with seven children. Though she is old, Lisi is still strong enough to help with her family's finances without feeling helpless. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. They have had their plantation for many years but she wants to improve it in order to make money out of the crops by selling them to the members of her community and to the traveling public. Lisi plans to use this money to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, and vegetable seeds to better improve her plantation. She hopes to make a lot of profit from her business so she is able to contribute to the improvement of her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, bushknives, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.en:
The second largest city in Guatemala is called Quetzaltenango and it has grown tremendously in recent times. Just outside of the populated area, there is a small community where a group of women have organized themselves into the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Mariposas” which means “Butterflies”. Actually, the ladies look like butterflies with their intricately decorated and colorful lightweight blouses, often embellished with lace and sequins. The traditional attire is also quite colorful and beautiful. The women of the Trust Bank have an average age of 36.

Gloria, a member of the group, is 36 years old and married to an agricultural worker. The couple has four children ranging in age from five to seventeen. Gloria has an animal husbandry business and raises chickens and pigs. She is applying for a loan to purchase additional animals and feed. Gloria is very aware of the value of education, in spite of the fact that she only had two years of formal education. She works hard to provide her children with uniforms, school supplies and other necessities. Gloria feels that her efforts are paying off as her oldest child will graduate from high school next year!

Gloria enjoys the monthly educational training given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer at the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank. The ladies acquire business and personal tools that serve them well. They learn about women’s rights and domestic violence, health, hygiene and nutrition as well as children’s education. The women learn to manage their loans with information about budgeting, accounting, marketing, pricing and customer service. They learn how to have confidence in themselves and in their decision-making abilities. The combination of loans and education, that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus” is very empowering for the ladies. They begin to understand that they have the ability to make a difference in their lives and in their families and leave poverty behind. KIVA investors are valuable partners in this effort by providing capital for the loans. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase additional animals and feed.

loans.name: Vaiolupe

texts.en: Vaiolupe is a 24-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a successful elei printing business selling not only to the members of her community, but also to the public. With this money, she plans to purchase fabric materials and fabric paint supplies for the better continuation of her elei printing business. Vaiolupe hopes to continue to expand her elei business so that she can not only save a lot of profit, but also continue to provide the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials and fabric paint

loans.name: Toluiva

texts.en: Toluiva is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. She has just joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. Therefore, she would like to start a small elei business. She will sell her products to the members of her community and the public. She plans to use this loan to purchase fabric materials, fabric paints, design prints, brushes, and rubber for her elei business. Toluiva hopes to make a lot of profit from her business so that she can provide the essential needs of her family and assist with their weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials, fabric paints, design prints, and brushes

loans.name: Ma. Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Ma. Guillermina tiene 75 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos  y vive con la nuera y su nieto en una aldea rural del Departamento de Yoro, Yoro
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, dedicada específicamente a la producción de granos básicos frijoles y maíz. Ella inicio sus labores en la agricultura desde muy joven. Dispone de un terreno que le fue heredado de sus padres. El cual ha logrado hacer producir con mucho trabajo, empeño y dedicación. En la actualidad produce maíz y frijoles que le sirven para consumo y venta. Con las  ganancias obtenidas las invirtió para ampliar las áreas de producción. 
Actualmente solicita otro préstamo de 12,000 para invertir en la compra de semillas, fertilizante e insumos para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. De una parte va completar la compra de un molino de moler maíz para tortillas el que le generara otros ingresos. Su plan es sacar una mejor cosecha y venderla a buen precio para obtener mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Ma Guillermina is 75 years old and a single mother to three children. She lives with her daughter-in-law and one grandson in a rural village in the Yoro department of Honduras.

Ma Guillermina works in farming, specifically growing beans and corn. Ma Guillermina started working in farming at a very young age. She has land that she inherited from her parents. The land produces good crops with a lot of work, determination and dedication. Ma Guillermina currently grows corn and beans for her own consumption and to sell. Ma Guillermina invests her profits in order to expand her production.

Ma Guillermina is currently applying for another loan of 12,000 Lempira in order to buy seeds, fertiliser and supplies for growing corn and beans. Ma Guillermina is also going to finish payments for a corn grinder for making tortillas; this will provide her with an extra income. Ma Guillermina's future plan is to have a better harvest and to sell it at a good price in order to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies to boost her crops.

loans.name: Rosa Mabel

texts.es:
Rosa, es el pilar fundamental de su familia, es madre soltera, vive junto a tres hijos, uno de sus hijos tiene un puesto de venta de ropa nueva en el mercado y le ayuda con los gastos de su hogar, la Sra.: Rosa se dedica a vender tortillas, en sus inicios solo molía una pequeña cantidad de maíz, actualmente su negocio ha crecido un poco ya diariamente muele 60 libras de maíz generándole ventas alrededor de $30.00, el negocio lo emprendió por su propia cuenta y lo hace por la mañana y en la tarde. Tiene 20 años de poseerlo.
El crédito le servirá para comprar leña, gas propano, maíz, cal, bolsas y papel para elaborar la venta de tortillas, teniendo la materia prima podrá trabajar, aumentar su productividad, atraer a nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ganancias.
Su visión es ahorrar para mejorar el local, incluir la venta de otros productos que le generen ingresos extras, brindar a su familia mejores circunstancias y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Rosa is the glue that holds her family together. She is a single mother to three children. One of her children has a market stall selling new clothes and helps with household costs. Rosa herself makes a living selling tortillas. She started her business just grinding small amounts of corn. Her business has now grown and every day she grinds 60 pounds of corn, providing her with sales of around $30. Rosa started this business on her own and works in the morning and afternoon. Rosa has had the business for 20 years.

This loan will help Rosa to buy firewood, propane gas, corn, lime, bags and paper for making and selling tortillas. The loan will give her the basic supplies that she needs to work, to increase production, to attract new customers, and to increase her income.

Rosa's plan for the future is to save money in order to make improvements to her premises. She wants to start selling other products in order to earn an extra income, give her family better living conditions, and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy firewood, propane gas, corn, lime, bags and paper for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

Since she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 for access to financial assistance. Lizel appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 This loan is intended to purchase different ingredients for food vending.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre ha tenido una actividad de generación de ingresos. Hace 4 años decidió establecer su propio negocio de Repostería. Elabora pasteles, postres fríos y panes, esta producción la vende en su casa. Lleva tres ciclos de prestamos para invertir en su negocio, con el actual que es por 8,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como harina, azúcar, huevos, manteca, levadura, soda, sal, leches y otros ingredientes para elaborar repostería y tener siempre variedad de pasteles. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y ampliar su mercado a otras zonas.
texts.en:
Victor is 46 years old, married and has a son. He lives in the Choloma municipality in Cortes. Victor has always had some sort of work in order to earn an income. Four years ago he decided to start a business making desserts. He makes cakes, cold desserts and breads. He sells the products in his house.

Victor has gone through three loan cycles investing in his business. This loan - for 8000 Lempira - is to be used to buy basic supplies such as flour, sugar, eggs, butter, yeast, bicarbonate of soda, salt, milk, and other ingredients for making cakes and to have variety of products all of the time. Victor wants to expand his business, and expand his market to other areas.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as flour, sugar, eggs, butter, yeast, bicarbonate of soda, salt, milk, and other ingredients for making cakes.

loans.name: Jamaica

texts.en:
Jamaica is 18 years old, single, and a resident of Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She earns a living by selling barbeque, foods and snacks. She is brave and helps to earn for the family as her parents are already ageing.

She is a member of PMPC and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients for her existing business.

Jamaica deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make barbeque, food and snacks to sell

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sang works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 53 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Sang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sang has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Sang faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and a bathroom.

With her business profit, Sang hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Thực

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 46 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thực joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thực has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water tank.

With her business profit, Thực hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and water tank

loans.name: Hiệp

texts.en:
Hiệp works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Hiệp is 30 years old and is married with two children.  She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Hiệp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Hiệp faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 47 years old and married with two children. Dung lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Dung faces in her life is not having money to repair her latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her toilet and clean the water system.

In the future, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her toilet and clean the water system

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Thanh is 52 years old and is married with two children.  Thanh lives with two dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2005, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Thanh has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Thanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to a build toilet.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, 47, has 4 children and lives in Ozamiz City, Philippines. She has a lot of energy for her farming activities. With these activities, she generates income to support her family. However, to have good harvest, she needs capital to buy additional fertilizers for her farm plants. 
 
Lina has been a member of Paglaum MPC  for 10 years and has availed herself of financial support from the cooperative. She borrowed an amount of PHP 10,000. With this funding, she was able to fulfill her need need to buy additional fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Thu is 34 years old and is married with one child.  She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Thu has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thu has been involved in this business for seven years.  The main hardship that Thu faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is a 28 year old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small banana plantation not only selling to the members of her community, but also to the public in town. She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than 3 years, gaining access to financial assistance. She plans to use this loan to purchase fertilizer, chemicals, bush-knives and fencing wire to further improve her plantation business. Pepe hopes to set aside a lot of savings out of her profits so that she not only continues to maintain the operation of her plantation business, but also meets their family's weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives and fencing wire

loans.name: Kotognogontala 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ANCHITA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Kotognogontala 3 group are married women who on average are 50 years old with four children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a populous area in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Anchita, who is sitting in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Kotognogontala 3 group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy three 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, three drums of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta has a sari-sari store business in Ozamiz where she generates income. She is 45 years old and happily married with 4 children. Due to the demand of her customers, she needs more stock for her shop. She has been a member of PMPC since 2012. She sees PMPC as a constant help for her capital needs. She is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her sari-sari store business.  Julieta is very thankful at how PMPC has supported her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Matapa

texts.en: Matapa is a 26 year old married woman. She runs a small plantation business selling to the members of her community and also to the public in town. This is the second year she has been with the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this loan to purchase a mist blower, chainsaw, wheelbarrow and chemicals to further improve her plantation business. Matapa hopes to earn a lot of profit out of the sales she will be able to make from her business so that she can continue to provide for the weekly essential needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chainsaw, wheelbarrow and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old, is married and is a resident of Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. She earns a living through buying and selling fruits and vegetables. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 which she will use to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

Marilyn deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 48 and married with five children. They live in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari store business. Through it, she sends her children to college. However, her business needs financial assistance to sustain its operations. She is requesting PHP 7,000 from PMPC. She is grateful for the extended help of the institution.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her variety store (Sari-sari shop)

loans.name: Tiesseri  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe TIESSERI  1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOUORO un village dans la commune de KOUORO BARRAGE dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SEYDOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme TIESSERI  1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Tiesseri 1 group are married men who on average are 43 years old with eight children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kouoro, a village in the Kouoro Dam commune, which is part of the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third maize crop loan with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is maize featuring Mr. Seydou, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Tiesseri 1 group of men. He intends to use his loan to buy eight 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, ten drums of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

He expects to achieve an average profit of 160,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will enable him to pay off his loan and its interest, and also to contribute towards daily family expenditures.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Evite

texts.en: Evite is a 34 year old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small farm selling produce to the members of her community and also to the members of the traveling public. She joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. Evite will use her loaned money to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, blade sharpener, chainsaw and a wheelbarrow for the improvement of her farm. She hopes to set aside a lot of savings from her profit so that she will be able to improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, blade sharpener, chainsaw and a wheelbarrow for her farm

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 20 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una fileteadora con puntada de seguridad e insumos al por mayor como tela, hilos, agujas, entre otros.

Esto le permitirá aumentar su volumen de producción y tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar sus clientes actuales.

Diana manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is an energetic, service-oriented, hard-working, married mother of two children who she has raised with effort and dedication.  For 20 years she has worked as a seamstress selling to direct customers and third parties.  She learned her trade on her own and works alone every day, earning enough income to help her husband cover the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy an overlock sewing machine and sewing materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.  This will enable her to increase production and have the material on hand to fill pending orders on time, fostering customer loyalty.

Diana says she wants to continue working hard and expand her business to generate employment opportunities and guarantee a stable economy to improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and sewing materials such as fabric, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MEDINE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ALIMA assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes BENKADI, fait la vente des   pagnes wax réal.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 pièces de pagne wax réal au grand marché. Madame ALIMA est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
La vente se fait en détail dans le marché à une clientèle composée des hommes et des femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are married women, who average 38 years of age with an average of three children each. The majority of them live in traditional families in Medine, one of the working-class districts of Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region. They are on their 11th group loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of satisfying customer demand. 

Within the Benkadi group, Alima, who is sitting second from the left in the photo sells "real-wax pagnes" (highly decorative and colorful pieces of fabric used for clothing).
