loans.name: Amina Yakubu

texts.en: Amina Yakubu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Amina Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Bulha and Salama. Amina Yakubu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Amina Yakubu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Amina Yakubu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Amina Yakubu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Amina Yakubu is not thinking about just this year; she said in 5 years, she wants to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Tiesseri  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe TIESSERI  2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et ont en moyenne 9 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOUORO un village dans la commune de KOUORO BARRAGE dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur DRAMANE débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme TIESSERI  2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Tiesseri 2 group are married men who on average are 48 years old with nine children, and live mostly in traditional families in Kouoro, a village in the Kouoro Dam commune, which is part of the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third maize crop loan with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is maize featuring Mr. Dramane, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Tiesseri 2 group of men. He intends to use his loan to buy eight 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, ten drums of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

He expects to achieve an average profit of 160,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will enable him to pay off his loan and its interest, and also to contribute towards daily family expenditures.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Habila, Yushau, and  Isah. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he  would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said , “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Ibrahim is not thinking about this year alone, he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Hannatu Yakubu

texts.en: Hannatu Yakubu is a 30-year-old farmer from Ang/Kunda. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hannatu Yakubu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hannatu Yakubu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Hannatu Yakubu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Benjamin, Sadik,and Nehemiah,, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Batmakan

texts.ru: Батмакан 61 год, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Батмакан среднее образование, она на пенсии, также на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Батмакан есть 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 15 овец, 3  теленка. Также 5,57 ГА земельной доли, из них 0,77 ГА - поливная земля, на которой Батмакан с мужем выращивают овощи, фрукты и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры, применяя только натуральные удобрения и ручной труд. Полученный урожай она реализует оптовым и розничным покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития экологичной полеводческой деятельности, Батмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и лекарства для растений. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Batmakan is 61 years old and she is married with one grown son.  She has a high school education and she is a pensioner, but she has also been engaged in raising livestock and growing crops for 35 years.  At the moment, Batmakan has three dairy cows, two horses, 15 sheep and three calves.  She also has a 5.57 hectare plot of land, of which .77 hectare is irrigated land where Batmakan and her husband grow cucumbers, fruits and other crops which are harvested using only natural fertilizers and manual labor.  She sells each harvest on to both wholesale and retail customers.  With the goal of developing her eco-friendly farming business further, Batmakan has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy mineral fertilizer and medicines for her plants.  She plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to grow eco-friendly fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame SIRA assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  KOTOGNOGONTALA, fait la vente des  bois de chauffages .
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffage dans les villages environnants dans la ville de SIKASSO. Madame SIRA est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
La vente se fait en détail dans le marché à une clientèle composée des hommes et des femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Kotognogontala group are married women who on average are 31 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the populous areas in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their seventeenth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet their customers' needs.

Mrs. Sira, who is sitting in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Kotognogontala group of women, sells firewood. She intends to use this loan to buy two truckloads of firewood from villages surrounding the town of Sikasso.

Mrs. Sira is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her products. Retail sales are conducted at the market to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest, and the rest will be put into savings.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is a 32-year-old woman with four children. She runs a small vegetable garden business, and her partner of 10 years helps out. She has been with the SPBD program for more than four years, gaining access to financial assistance. 

She plans to use this money to purchase fertilizer, vegetable seeds, fencing wire, pitch fork, rakes, long plastic pipe lines and mouth for water tap for a vegetable garden business. Matauaina hopes to save a lot of profit so that she would be able to continue not only to improve her family's living standards, but also to maintain the continuation of her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, vegetable seeds, fencing wire, pitch fork, rakes, long plastic pipe lines and mouth for water tap

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio tiene 64 años de edad, está casado, es agricultor desde hace mucho tiempo y también le gusta la crianza de animales domésticos como gallinas, patos, cerdos y vacas. 


Virgilio tiene varios años de dedicarse a la crianza de estos animales y es bastante rentable siempre y cuando se tenga un buen cuidado de estos, para que al momento de vender al cliente obtenga un producto de buena calidad, y es así como él es muy reconocido por muchas personas por vender animales saludables. Además él se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva para consumo familiar y para vender.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar abono y herbicidas para su milpa ya que la planta requiere de un sustento para desarrollar el fruto y también necesita eliminar los tipos de plaga que atacan su cultivo.
 

En un futuro, Virgilio desea seguir cultivando y cuidar de sus animales y que Dios lo mantenga saludable a él  y a su familia.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 64 years old, married, and has been a farmer for many years. He also likes to raise animals such as chickens, turkeys, pigs, and cows. Virgilio has spent years raising fowl and livestock, which has been profitable as he's always cared for the animals diligently. Virgilio has a wide reputation for selling healthy animals and can thus offer a high quality product when he's ready to sell them. 

Virgilio also grows crops, both for his family and to sell. He needs a loan to purchase manure and herbicides for his cornfield, which requires support so that the plants will produce ears of corn and to eliminate pests that attack the crop. 

Virgilio hopes to keep farming and raising animals, and that God will keep him and his family in good health.

loans.use: to purchase manure and herbicides for his cornfield, which requires support for corn to grow and to eliminate pests that attack the crop.

loans.name: Zhamalbubu

texts.ru: Жамалбубу 55 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Жамалбубу - высшее образование, работает учителем в местной школе в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жамалбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая зерновые культуры и овощи на 1,60 ГА собственной земли. Также в хозяйстве Жамалбубу  есть 10 овец и 1 дойная корова с теленком, полученное домашнее, вкусное, экологически чистое молоко она реализует местным жителям. Продукция пользуется большим спросом и количество покупателей растет с каждым днем, поэтому Жамалбубу решила обратиться в  Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров с телятами. Доходы от кредита Жамалбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en: Zhamalbubu is 55 years old and she is married with two children.  She has a higher education and she works as a teacher at a local school.  To earn extra income for her family. Zhamalbubu also raises livestock and grows crops.  She grows cereals and vegetables on her own 1.60 hectare plot of land.  She also has 10 sheep and one dairy cow with a calf, which gives real, delicious and ecologically pure milk to the local residents.  There is a lot of demand for the milk and Zhamalbubu's number of customers increases every day, which is why she has decided to turn to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy two dairy cows with calves.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock, and she also plans to save up money to buy some appliances for her home.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows with calves in order to increase her milk sales and overall profits

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and lives in Barangay 5,Tangub City Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Norma has a shop that sells retail products. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan  to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Archie

texts.en:
Archie joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing, and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to purchase fish for selling.

Archie dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for selling

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 42 years old, is happily married with four children, and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has a furniture making business that uses coco, bamboo and various lumber. Through her business, she sends her four children to college and successfully graduated. 

However, she needed additional capital to buy additional lumber. She availed a loan, and hopes to save enough so she can open a showroom for her furniture.

loans.use: To buy additional lumber for furniture making

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 40-year-old farmer from Ung/Daura.  As a Babban Gona member, Amina, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Amina can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. With access to high quality inputs, Amina can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. Amina is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Bala and Ezra. Amina’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Suomo Group

texts.en:
They are part of the group called Soumo, made up of three members. They are responsible individuals with family care in their heart. They are from Teshie-Nungua, Accra. These people are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement. They work in different fields, and that is how they make enough money to support their families. Selling jeans, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish, phone card credits, and cloth. 

Philomina is the featured borrower; she is married, with two children, and she is 27 years old. She has cloth and phone credits and sells to customers. She works some twelve hours daily, and her business is done through hawking to customers. Thanks to her attention to quality, Philomina was able to retain her customer base and even attract new customers, both regular and occasional. The goal of the loan is to buy more cloth and phone credits to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and phone credits

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur SEYDOU est né vers 1975 à M'PEDOUGOU est marié et père de 4 enfants.Il réside chez son père avec ses épouses et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à M'PEDOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès monsieur SEYDOU s’est initié des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales (maïs, mil), il s’approvisionne à M'PEDOUGOU et les villages environnants de M'PEDOUGOU.
Il est à son septième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 15 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, 15 sacs de 100 kg de mil pour la revendre en détail dans son magasin à M'PEDOUGOU à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou was born around 1975 in M'Pedougou. He is married and the father of four children. He resides with his wives and children in his father's traditional family home in M'Pedougou, a village in the municipality of Lobougoula, which is part of the Sikasso Circle, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

After leading many unsuccessful activities, Mr. SEYDOU began trading grain cereals (maize, millet). He resupplies in M'Pedougou and the surrounding villages.

This is his seventh individual loan with the Soro Yiriwaso institution, seeking to better satisfy an increasing number of customers. Previous loans have been fully repaid. 

This loan will enable him to buy fifteen 100-kilo bags of maize, fifteen 100-kilo bags of millet, to be sold retail in his M'Pedougou shop, to a clientele of men and women, for cash and on credit. 

He expects average monthly profits of 100,000 CFA francs, which will enable him to pay off the loan and its interest, and reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: buy grain cereals

loans.name: Daniel Magaji

texts.en: Daniel Magaji remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Daniel Magaji, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Daniel Magaji is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” expressed Daniel Magaji. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yahaya Wada

texts.en: Yahaya Wada is a Babban Gona farmer from Ang/Bazai. Yahaya Wada expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Yahaya Wada to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya Wada can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya Wada is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Yahaya Wada will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Yahaya Wada will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Abba

texts.en: Abba is a  farmer from Barangwaje.  As a Babban Gona member, Abba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Abba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Ignatius, Elkana, and  Numfa. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Peter joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Rudah, Titus, and  Manasseh. Peter is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Peter will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Peter can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Peter is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yahaya, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Yahaya.   With this loan, Yahaya is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, tiene tres hijos los cuales viven junto a ella y todos están estudiando ya que ella quiere que puedan tener la oportunidad que ella no tuvo.


Ella se dedica a trabajar con una pequeña granja de pollos, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó con un pequeño proyecto que fue impulsado a la comunidad, luego ella decidió continuar por medio de créditos, la pequeña granja la tiene en su casa y trabajan en ella todos los miembros del hogar ya que este tipo de trabajo requiere de mucho cuido, antes solo se dedicaban a la agricultura pero hoy mientras el esposo cultiva la tierra ella cuida de la granja.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar mas pollos ya que se acercan las graduaciones de las instituciones educativas y tiene que prepararse para esa época las cuales tiene mucha demanda de este producto, también comprará concentrado para el alimento de los mismos, con esto ella tendrá un pequeño ahorro si los compra todo de una vez pues se los venden a un costo mas bajo.

En un futuro ella quiere hacer más grande su granja y trabajar más duro para que su familia pueda obtener muchas ganancias, quiere ver a sus hijos que se gradúen como profesionales y que sean personas de mucho éxito y respetuosos en la comunidad, también quiere que ellos aprendan a trabajar para que cuando crezcan puedan desempeñar trabajos en la comunidad que les generen una excelente vida.
texts.en:
Silveria, 38, attended school up to sixth grade.  She's married and her husband has worked in agriculture since he was a boy.  She has three children, who live with her and all attend school because she wants them to have the opportunity she did not.

She earns a living with a small chicken farm, a business she has had this business for 10 years.  She started with a small project inspired by the community, then decided to keep going with loans.  Her small farm is at her house and everyone in her household works on it because this type of work requires a lot of care.  Previously they only worked in farming, but now, while her husband works the land, she takes care of the farm.

She needs the loan to buy more chickens because she has to prepare for the upcoming school graduation season when there's a lot of demand for this product.  She's also going to buy concentrated chicken feed.  If she buys everything at once, they'll sell at a lower price, so she'll get a bit of savings.

In the future she wants to expand her farm and work harder so her family can earn more profit.  She wants to see her children graduate as professionals and be successful and respected people in the community.  She also wants them to learn to work so they can work in the community and have an excellent life when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed

loans.name: Ado Wakili

texts.en: Ado Wakili is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ado Wakili joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Gaddafi, Maryam, and  Ibrahim. Ado Wakili is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ado Wakili will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ado Wakili can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Ado Wakili is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Maryamu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and urea, Maryamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14.
“In the coming years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have access to professional jobs,” expressed Maryamu. With this loan, Maryamu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Baltyrkan

texts.ru: Балтыркан 53 года, замужем, многодетная мать 7 детей. Старшие дети самостоятельные и живут отдельно, младшие учатся в школе. В свободное время дети помогают матери по хозяйству. По характеру Балтыркан очень добрая, веселая, трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Балтыркан занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 15 овец и 4 коровы, а также земельный надел мерою 2,06 ГА, где она выращивает дыни, арбузы и кукурузу. Балтыркан получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока, молочной продукции, овощей и фруктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Балтыркан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, селитры для увеличения плодородности почвы. Доходы от кредита Балтыркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Baltyrkan is 53 years old, married and a mother many times over; she has seven children.  Her elder children are independent and they live on their own, and the younger ones are still in school.  In their spare time, the children help their mother around the house.  Baltyrkan is a very kind, joyful, hard-working and goal-oriented woman.  As the main source of income for her family, she grows crops and raises livestock.  She has a well-developed farm with 15 sheep and four cows, as well as a 2.06 hectare plot of land, on which she grows honeydew, watermelons and corn.  Baltyrkan's monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, dairy products, fruits and vegetables.  With the goal of developing her business further, she has turned to Bai-Tushum for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy mineral fertilizer to increase the size of her harvest.  She plans to use the income from this increased business to further improve her household, as well as to build a barn for the animals.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and nitrate to grow eco-friendly melons, watermelons and corn in order to invest in the further growth of her business

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en: Basiru remembers not being able to pay his children's school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Basiru, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Basiru  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Basiru   With this loan, Basiru is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna is a 30-year-old farmer from Dogon Fako.  As a Babban Gona member, Memuna, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Memuna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Memuna is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Memuna is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children: Teyopolos and Basira. Memuna’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Sa'ade

texts.en: Sa'ade is a 53-year-old farmer from Dogon Fako. As a Babban Gona member, Sa'ade, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sa'ade can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Sa'ade is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Sa'ade said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Shaibu, Inusa  and  Kabo, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina tiene 59 años de edad, solo estudió hasta segundo grado, tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales 2 están fuera del país, 3 viven y trabajan en otra ciudad y actualmente solo una hija vive con ella. 


Florentina se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, pero siempre desde que vivía con sus padres ha cultivado maíz, ella posee un terreno donde cultiva y está cerca de su vivienda aproximadamente a 20 minutos.           

Ella solicita el crédito para pagar a las personas que le ayudarán a limpiar la tierra donde sembrará, también comprará los herbicidas y fertilizantes para lograr un buen crecimiento de la planta y sulfato para que dé una buena cosecha.

Su sueño principal es que Dios le siga brindando salud y a pesar de que debe pagar quien le cultiva ella encuentra  más viable sembrar el maíz para el consumo necesario en vez de comprarlo y así garantizar la seguridad alimentaria para su familia.
texts.en:
Florentina is 59 years old. She only went to school up to the second grade. She had 6 children. Two of them live outside of the country, 3 live and work in another city, and now only one daughter lives with her.  

Florentina does housework, but since she lived with her parents, she has grown corn. She has some land that she cultivates and it is close to her house, about 20 minutes away.             

She is asking for the loan to pay the people who will clear the land where she will plant. She will also buy herbicide and fertilizer to achieve good growth and sulphate so she can have a good harvest. 

Her main dream is for God to keep givin her good health. Despite having to pay someone to grow for her, she finds it more viable to plant the corn for consumption instead of buying it, so she guarantees food security for her family.

loans.use: to help pay to clear the land where she will plant. She will also buy herbicides and fertilizer to achieve good plant growth, as well as sulphate so she can have a good harvest.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Nura joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Kamala, Marwa, and  Jamilu. Nura is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Nura will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Nura can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Nura is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Glenda Melisa

texts.es:
Glenda tiene 21 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, está acompañada y su esposo  es agricultor, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad.

Glenda tiene 3 años de trabajar para una empresa atunera que se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad donde ella vive. Ella trabaja en el área de limpieza, debido a la necesidad de ayudar con los ingresos para la familia decidió aprovechar esta oportunidad de trabajo, su horario es de 5:00 de la tarde hasta 2:00 de la mañana del siguiente día, y descansa sábado y domingo.            

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para mejorar el techo de la vivienda ya que en las últimas lluvias ha tenido problemas y comprará madera, clavos y láminas para brindarle más seguridad a su hija.


Su principal sueño es bridarle estabilidad a su hija, educación y salud para que pueda salir adelante, desea mantener siempre su empleo pero para eso está muy consciente que cada día tiene que dar lo mejor de ella en desempeño de sus funciones que demanda su puesto de trabajo.
texts.en:
Glenda is 21 years old. She went to school up to the sixth grade at the community school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has one 2 year old daughter.

Glenda has worked for a tuna business for 3 years. It is located in the community where she lives. She does cleaning. She decided to take advantage of this work opportunity due to the necessity of helping with the family income. Her schedule is from 5:00 in the afternoon until 2:00 in the morning of the next day, and she rests on Saturday and Sunday.              

She needs the loan she has asked for to improve the roof on her house, since in the last rains she had problems. She will buy wood, nails, and sheeting so that she can bring more security for her daughter. 

Her main dream is to offer stability to her daughter, as well as education and good health so that she can get ahead. She wants to always have her job so she is very aware that every day she has to give her best when performing the duties her job demands.

loans.use: to improve the roof on her home, since during the last rains she had problems. She will buy wood, nails, and sheeting to bring more security to her daughter.

loans.name: Heidy Aracely

texts.es:
Heidy tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente está acompañada y tiene una hija de dos años de edad.

Ella se dedica al destazo de cerdos, este es un negocio nuevo para ella que emprendió hace un mes, anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio de frutas y verduras. Heidy destaza 1 vez por semana la cual sale a vender a los caseríos durante 4 horas, ella trabaja de 6:30 a 10:30 am, su esposo se involucra en estas actividades y además es comerciante de pescado fresco actividad que tiene 1 año de realizar y vende 300 libras semanales.



Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos y para comprar pescado fresco para luego venderlos, el préstamo les permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicos para seguir adelante y darle los cuidados necesarios a su hija.


Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda ya que actualmente viven en una casa de bahareque y desean vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Heidy is 23 years old. She went to high school and now she is married and has a two year old daughter. 

She works butchering pigs. This is a new business for her that she started a month ago. Preciously, she worked selling fruit and vegetables. Heidy butchers once a week and goes out to sell in the communities for 4 hours. She works from 6:30 to 10:30 am. Her husband is involved in these activities and he is also a fresh fish merchant. He has done this activity for 1 year and sells 300 pounds a week.  

She needs the loan to buy pigs and to buy fresh fish to later sell. The loan will allow her to obtain more income to keep get ahead and give her daughter the care she needs. 

Her dream is to improve her home since she lives in a house made of wattle and daub and they want to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and fresh fish to later sell.

texts.en:
Evelyn  is 37 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with four children.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables to sell/retail

Each month, she earns approximately PHP3,000. Ruth has been a member of PMPC for two years. She wants a loan to buy more textiles, needles and zippers.

In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more textiles, needles and zippers.

loans.name: Anasetasia

texts.en:
Anasetasia is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small shop in her village. This is the second year she has been a member of the SPBD program, gaining access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase a freezer, beer, soft drinks, an alcohol permit, sacks of rice to restock her shop and to school fees for her kid's education. 

Anasetasia has managed to make improvements to her family's living standards with the profit from her business. She hopes to save some of it so that she can reinvest it back to the business and also continue to provide for their essential weekly needs.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, beer, soft drinks, an alcohol permit, sacks of rice and pay for her kid's school fees.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small plantation business, selling the products to the members of her community and also to the public at the market. 

She has been with the SPBD program for four years now to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase chemicals, and a mist blower for her plantation business, and iron roofing, cement and nails for her home renovation. 

Mema hopes to continue to operate her business to its best potential, as it is providing her with a good income, especially assisting in meeting their weekly essential needs.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a mist blower, iron roofing, cement and nails

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is married with three children. Bernadeth is 61 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Bernadeth has a tailoring business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 pesos. Bernadeth has been a member of PMPC for five years.

In the future, Bernadeth wants to have a conditioned tailoring machine.

loans.use: to pay for machinery maintenance

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has had a hog-fattening business for five years. She is 46 years old and married. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. The number of her hogs has grown, and she needs more capital for the feeds. She has reached PMPC for the loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional bags of feeds. 

In the future, Lydia hopes to build concrete pig pens for good piggery sanitation.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds for hog fattening

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is married with five children. Dioscora is 61 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Dioscora has a tailoring business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 pesos. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.name: Hanne Isiyaku

texts.en: Hanne Isiyaku remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Hanne Isiyaku, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hanne Isiyaku is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,”  expressed Hanne Isiyaku . With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small plantation and an ice block business, selling them to the members of her community and to the public. 

This is her third year with the SPBD program, gaining access to financial assistance. She plans to use this loan to purchase a mist blower, chemicals and fertilizers for her plantation business, and sugar, buckets and a freezer for her ice block business. 

Kalameli has managed to make improvements to her family's livelihood and hopes to continue to do so from the profits she is earning from her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizers, sugar, buckets and a freezer

loans.name: Aso

texts.en:
Aso is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small plantation business, selling to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. 

She has been a member of the program since 2013 in order to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, mist blowers, bush knives, spades, gloves and fertilizers for the better improvement of her business. 

Aso hopes to save some of the profits she is earning from her business so that she could reinvest it back to the business and continue to provide for the essential needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, mist blowers, bush knives, spades, gloves and fertilizers

loans.name: Fine

texts.en:
Fine is a 62-year-old woman with no children. She runs a small plantation and doughnut business selling not only to the members of her community, but also to the school kids. This is the second year she has been with the SPBD program gaining access to financial assistance. 

She will use this money to purchase flour, sugar, icing sugar, yeast, butter, cooking oil, a large frying pan, a wok, tongs, a cooking stove, a wheel barrow for her doughnut business. Fine sustains her family's living standards with the income she has been earning from her businesses and hopes to continue the operation of these businesses so that they will be ongoing ventures.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, icing sugar, yeast, butter, cooking oil, a large frying pan, a wok, tongs, a cooking stove, a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Virgielita

texts.en:
Virgielita, 48 years old, is married and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her source of income is snack-vending. She vends her snacks in a school. 

Because of the demand of her customers, she needs extra capital to buy ingredients. She asked PMPC to help with her financial needs. She was lent an amount of PHP 10,000. She hopes to sustain her business to continually provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for snack-vending.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old and lives in Barangay Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Janet has a sari-sari store. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional stock for her business.

Janet has been a member of PMPC for 9 months. In the future, Janet hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 42 years old and married. Alejandra works very hard to provide for the family.

Alejandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, beers, detergent soap, noodles, soft drinks, candies, snack foods, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beers, detergent soap, noodles, soft drinks, candies, snack foods, sanitary pads, etc. 

Alejandra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, beers, detergent soap, noodles, soft drinks, candies, snack foods, sanitary pads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel works hard to support her family. Anabel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Anabel requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Anabel has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Anabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en: Jibrin remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Jibrin, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Jibrin is ambitious and is aiming to reap up to 35 bags per hectare this season.  Jibrin “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed  Jummai . With this loan, Jibrin is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Yusuf, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yusuf is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Yusuf. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn busies herself with her sari-sari store business. It is the primary source of income for the family. She has been in this business for almost five years and earns well for the family. 

Recently, she was in need of capital and she approached PMPC to buy additional stocks.
 
Jenelyn hopes to abundantly support her children and smiles at the hope they will earn degrees.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Erlinse

texts.en:
Erlinse is married with 4 children. Erlinse is 36 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Erlinse cares for pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested additional working capital to buy 2 piglets.

Erlinse has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Erlinse hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to buy 2 piglets.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita helps her husband manage their farm and at the same time operates a retail store in their village. She earns well from their farm and her business and was able to repay successfully her previous loans used for her farm and business. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. Carmelita is thankful to GDMPC for helping their clients to improve their ability to engage in business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the farm and expand her business to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling school supplies in the Philippines. Alma has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more school supplies to sell to her customers.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru remembers not being able to repair his house during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Kabiru, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. With access to high quality inputs, kabiru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Kabiru. With this loan, Kabiru is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a 45-year-old farmer from Dogon Fako. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Samaila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Samaila said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Sule and Shehu, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Ishaku, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ishaku is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Ishaku. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Aukusitina

texts.en:
Aukusitina is a 23-year-old woman with no children. 

She runs a small canteen business, selling to the members of her community and especially school children. She has been a member of the SPBD program for two years now, gaining access to financial services. 

Aukusitina plans to use this money to purchase sacks of flour, chicken leg quarters, noodles, sugar, and cordial for her canteen business. Aukusitina hopes to continue to make a profit from her business and has managed to contribute in providing for her family's weekly essential needs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, chicken leg quarters, noodles, sugar, cordial.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is married and has one child. Welma is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Welma sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP from her work. 

She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more clothes to sell.

Welma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Welma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Genelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Genelita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, beans, noodles, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Genelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, beans, noodles, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en:
Launiu is a 40 year old woman with five children. 

They run a piggery farm business, selling small-sized piglets to the members of the public and her community. Her partner of eight years helps her out in feeding the pigs and looking after their piggery farm. 

She plans to use this money to purchase fencing wire, cement and timber for the improvement of her pigsty, and to pay school fees for her children's education. Launiu hopes to continue to raise a lot of piglets so that she can continue to assist in her family's financial obligations, especially their essential weekly needs.

loans.use: To purchase fencing wire, cement and timber, and pay school fees.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido, 52 years old, is married and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

He has a welding shop business. Through his business, he sent his children to school and they graduated with college degrees.

Because he needs additional funds to buy plain sheets, iron bars and welding rods for his shop business, he applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC.
 
Bienvinido hopes to sustain his business so he can continue to provide sufficiently for his family.

loans.use: To buy plain sheets, iron bars and welding rods for his shop business.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is married with 6 children. Nestor is 52 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte.

Nestor is a farmer and and has a garden planted with different kinds of vegetables to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years. He has requested additional working capital to buy fertilizers for his garden.

Nestor has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Nestor hopes to expand his garden to plant other vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with six children. Elvie is 41 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tapilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Elvie operates her own sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 16 years. Each month, she earns 14,000 pesos doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 14,000 pesos for additional capital to buy more grocery items to sell/retail.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell/retail

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, 42, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. 

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

Nora requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elesia works hard to support her family.

She has a banana-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elesia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her banana-vending business.

Elesia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 39 years old and has five children. Letecia is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Letecia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase an additional goat, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Letecia has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional goat, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en:
Jeanalyn is 37 years old and married with six children.

Jeanalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like biscuits, candies, soft drinks, sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, etc., to sell.

Jeanalyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jeanalyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like biscuits, candies, soft drinks, sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres es un joven emprendedor, sensible y talentoso, vive en el municipio de Rionegro se desempeña en varias actividades.

Se dedica a la venta de mercancía a través de catalogo, presta el servicio de vigilancia de automóviles en el barrio y por ultimo ofrece el servicio de canto y toque de instrumentos en eventos musicales desde hace 5 años.

Siempre ha tenido un talento muy bueno para la música, y afino sus habilidades a través de cursos y clases.

El desea comprar un teclado musical nuevo que le permita interpretar ritmos variados ya que el que actualmente tiene es muy básico y limitado en muchos estilos musicales.
Con el préstamo podrá impulsar su actividad y tendrá la oportunidad de aumentar sus ingresos a través de su talento.

Apoyar a este joven es contribuir con el talento y folclor Colombianos!
texts.en:
Andres is a young entrepreneur; he is both sensitive and talented. He lives in the municipality of Rionegro and earns his living in a variety of ways. He sells merchandise from a catalog; he is a guard, keeping watch over cars in the neighbourhood; and he has also sung and played instruments at musical events for the past five years. Andres has always been a talented musician and has become even more skilled through classes and courses.

Now he wishes to buy a new keyboard so he can play a greater range of music. The keyboard he has currently is very basic and limits what he can do. Buying a new one with the loan money will inspire him and give him the the opportunity to increase his income.

By helping this young man you will be contributing to Colombian talent and folk music!

loans.use: buy a new keyboard so he can play a greater range of music

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Juliana works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Juliana is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Maria Nubia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 51 años de edad que a raíz del difícil divorcio con su esposo busco maneras para sostener su familia conformada por dos hijos realizando pulpas de frutas 100% naturales y vendiendo catálogos de revista.

Sus principales clientes son amigos y familiares pero presenta un gran problema y es que no tiene donde exhibir sus productos razón por la cual solicita un crédito para la compra de vitrina y productos de catálogo que ubicara en su hogar con la humilde ilusión de montar un almacén para ofrecer empleos a tantas madres que como ellas les toco empezar de 0 y luchar por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old woman, who, due to a difficult divorce from her husband, was looking for ways to support her family, which includes two children.  She makes 100% natural fruit juices and sells products from catalogs.  

Her main clients are her friends and relatives, but there is one big problem--she doesn't have anywhere to display her products.  She is seeking a loan to buy a display case and catalog products that she'll put in her house with the modest hope of launching a store where she can offer jobs to so many  mothers whose job it is to start from zero and fight on behalf of their children.

loans.use: to buy catalog products like lotions, hand creams, fragrances, hair products, and sweets.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace más de 8 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y por medio de la practica aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 36 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 2 empleos directos; trabaja todos los días y de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina plana y comprar insumos de confección como hilos, agujas, tela, entre otros; así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna.

María sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
María is a dedicated and hardworking microentrepreneur. She makes clothing, providing her services to third parties. 
It all started about 8 years ago while working as an employee in a clothing factory, and through practice she learned the trade. Today, at 36 years old,  she has her own workshop and 2 employees. She works every day and in this way makes enough income to help her husband support the household financially. 
The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a flat knitting machine and dressmaking supplies such as thread, needles, fabric, etc,, so she can meet the requirements of her customers and deliver orders in a timely manner. 
María dreams of further improving her workshop and having higher and higher production to generate new employment opportunities and improve the quality of life not only for her family, but also for those who help her every day in her work.

loans.use: to purchase a flat knitting machine and dressmaking supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc., to supply her workshop.

loans.name: Ibrahim Bako

texts.en: Ibrahim Bako is a Babban Gona farmer from Ang/Kunda. Ibrahim Bako expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Ibrahim Bako to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim Bako can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim Bako is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Ibrahim Bako will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Ibrahim Bako will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a 27-year-old farmer from Auta Makeri.  As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salamatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Salamatu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average.

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Ruben, Alhamdu and Ladi. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have access to professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and married with three children.  

Josephine is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Esther Yarbawa

texts.en: Esther Yarbawa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Esther Yarbawa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Timothy, Rifkatu and  Zainab. Esther Yarbawa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Esther Yarbawa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Esther Yarbawa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. When asked, Esther Yarbawa said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland, in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Elizabeth Samaila

texts.en: Elizabeth Samaila is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Elizabeth Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children; Inusa, Isiya and Monicah. Elizabeth Samaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Elizabeth Samaila will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Elizabeth Samaila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Elizabeth Samaila said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Elizabeth Samaila is not thinking about just this year; she said in 5 years, she wants to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Umaru Bitrus

texts.en: Umaru Bitrus is a 52-year- old farmer from Baran Gwaje. As a Babban Gona member, Umaru Bitrus, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Umaru Bitrus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Umaru Bitrus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season due to the high-quality inputs he will access with this loan. When asked how he plans to spend the money he will make from selling his maize, Umaru Bitrus said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Ibrahim, Zakaria, and  Yusuf. Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Istiphanus

texts.en: Istiphanus is a farmer from Kunda.  As a Babban Gona member, Istiphanus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Istiphanus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Istiphanus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Istiphanus said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Vincent and Friday, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Pastor De Jesus

texts.es:
46 años lleva el señor el Pastor persiguiendo el sueño de tener su casa propia y a sus 69 años de edad trabaja diariamente en su carpintería buscando la manera de ahorrar para lograr su sueño y poder dormir en su propio hogar. 

Padre de 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y con una fuerza y ganas de trabajar admirables a pesar de su edad solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que usara para atender pedidos que tiene retrasados. 

El crédito será muy importante pues le dará fluido a sus pedidos y ahorrara capital para seguir alimentando ese sueño pues no descansara en paz hasta levantarse un día y ver su casa
texts.en:
For 46 years the Pastor has been following his dream of owning his own house. At 69 years of age he works daily in his carpentry shop looking for a way to save money in order to make his dream come true and be able to sleep in his own home. 

As a father of 2 children who are already grown up and with an admirable strength and drive to work despite his age, he is requesting a loan to buy wood which he will use to attend to backlogged orders. 

The loan is very important because it will allow for the smooth running of orders and he will save the capital needed to help keep his dream alive. He will not rest in peace until he gets up one day to the sight of his house.

loans.use: to buy wood to attend to orders.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una confeccionista de 28 años de edad muy emprendedora y luchadora de la vida que a partir de una pequeña idea de negocio logro montar una confección donde brinda dos empleos a madres cabeza de hogar del barrio. 

En el momento se encuentra con un gran inconveniente y es que necesita dos máquinas fundamentales para seguir operando las cuales son maquina plana y filete adora muy necesarias para agilizar la producción y poder atender mayores pedidos.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de las dos máquinas anteriormente mencionadas pues las empresas que la contratan ya le piden que las adquieran para mejorar la calidad de sus confecciones y con ellas tendrá un gran aporte a su sector residencial pues se le presentara la oportunidad de generar otro empleo a una madre cabeza de familia
texts.en:
Sandra is a 28-year-old clothing manufacturer with a very entrepreneurial, fighting spirit.   From a small idea, she was able to start a clothing factory where she employs two mothers who are the heads of their households in the neighborhood.  

For the moment she is facing a big problem, as she needs two machines that are fundamental to the continued operation of her business, a flat sewing machine and a threading machine, both of which are very necessary to speed up production and be able to fill more orders.
