She is asking for a loan to buy the two aforementioned machines since the companies that she has contracts with are asking her to buy them to improve the quality of her clothes.  She will also be able to make a big contribution to her neighborhood since she will have the opportunity to employ yet another mother who is the head of her household.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine and threading machine

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma lives in Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel. She is 57 years old and married. Poverty drove her to earn as well to support the family. 

She is a new member of Paglaum Coop who joined to meet her capital needs. She borrowed PHP 5,000 as additional capitalization in order to purchase raw ingredients for snacks. Elma wishes to save for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snacks.

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 39 years old and has nine children. Mercedita is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercedita has been in pig-fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una joven muy emprendedora muy luchadora y a pesar de sus 20 años de edad ningún reto le queda grande por eso hace hasta lo imposible para buscar la manera de pagar sus estudios.

Hace poco tiempo inicio con la venta de productos de la marca Amway que distribuye principalmente productos de uso personal, como crema de manos, crema dental, detergentes, entre otros muchos. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar los productos directamente y tener mayor margen de ganancia y así poder pagar sus estudios, su transporte y alimentación.

A pesar de ser joven sueña como grande con tener un gran almacén con muchos empleados y una casa propia para ella y sus padres.
texts.en:
Diana is a very enterprising, hardworking young woman. Despite her only 20 years, no challenge is too big that it makes it impossible for her to find a way to pay for school.

She recently began selling Amway brand products. She mainly distributes personal care products such as hand cream, toothpaste, detergents, among many other products.

She is requesting a loan to buy the products directly so she can have a higher profit margin so that she can pay for tuition, transport, and food.

Despite being young she has big dreams to have a large warehouse with many employees and a home for herself and her parents.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her machines (mice, keyboards, monitors, printer).

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Emmanuel can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average.
When asked, Emmanuel said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Emmanuel is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sila

texts.en: Sila is a 20-year-old farmer from Barangwaje.  As a Babban Gona member, Sila is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Sila is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Sila is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate himself, and support his community.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en: Lawan remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Lawan, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lawan is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Lawan. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemy tiene 34 años de edad, no pudo estudiar por la situación económica de sus padres, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela, de ella depende sus hijos y nadie más vive con ellos. 

Desde hace 13 años, Noemy se dedica a la venta de tortillas y aprendió ya que su abuela le enseñó, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y el horario de trabajo es de 9:00 am a 1:00 pm.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar granos básicos (maíz) para seguir con el negocio de venta de tortillas y el resto para comprar ropa de mujer para vender, comprará camisa y faldas. 

Noemy desea seguir trabajando para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar; espera fortalecer su negocio de tortillas y que su negocio de ropa vaya aumentado poco a poco.
texts.en:
Noemy is 34 years old. She could not attend school due to her parents' economic situation. She is a widow and has three children who attend school. Her three children depend on her alone and no one else lives with them.

For 13 years, Noemy has sold tortillas. She learned from her grandmother who taught her this business. It is located in her home and her hours are from 9 am to 1 pm. 

She needs a loan to buy basic ingredients (corn) to continue the business of selling tortillas. The rest will be used to buy women's clothing to sell. She will buy shirts and skirts.

Noemy wants to continue working to meet the basic needs of her home. She hopes to strengthen and increase her tortilla business and her clothing business gradually.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to produce tortillas

loans.name: Alasan

texts.en:
Alasan remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Alasan, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality-inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Alasan can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. “In the near future, I want to ensure my children are educated and have access to professional jobs”, expressed Alasan.  With this loan, Alasan is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Marlon Alejandro

texts.es:
Marlon es un joven de 20 años de edad el cual se desempeñaba como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza con mucha dedicación y que asiste todos los días, esta actividad es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Como persona responsable está a cargo de algunos los gastos en su hogar, por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la adecuación y mejoras en el corral donde tiene albergados sus cerdos.

Con este apoyo económico podrá mejorar las en su negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá un espacio mucho mas cómodo para trabajar y para sus cerdos.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon is a 20-year-old young man who works as a farmer.  Seeing that his family income wasn't enough to cover household expenses, he started raising a selling pigs for fattening to try to improve the quality of life of his family.  He is very dedicated to his job and he does it every day.

As a responsible person, he is in charge of some of the household expenses, which doesn't leave him much leftover capital to invest in his business.  Therefore, he needs a loan to modify and improve the pen where he keeps his pigs.  

With this economic support, he will be able to improve his business and make it more appealing to his clients, since he will have a workspace that is more comfortable for himself and his pigs.  

His main dream is to be able to make good profits so that his family is not lacking anything that they need.  As this is something that he has lived through, it has has a great effect on him, and therefore he works tirelessly for his family.

loans.use: to remodel and make improvements to the site of his pig pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out maintenance on some of her washing machines which ware in bad condition.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa lives in Calaca-an, Plaridel. She is a widow and says that being a single parent is not easy. She works hard simply to survive and to meet the needs of her family. Her primary source of income comes from snack vending. 

In order to expand her business and acquire more capital, Felisa joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is grateful to Paglaum because her most pressing financial needs have been met. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase bundles of bananas for snack vending. She believes she can look forward to a comfortable life in the future if she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of bananas for snack vending

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a 38-year-old farmer from Auta Makeri.  As a Babban Gona member, Leatu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Leatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. Leatu is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of up to 30 bags per hectare.  Leatu is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children- Emuran  and Safullashi. Leatu’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are well-educated”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero cesar es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con obligaciones laborales. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la cría y venta de ganado que obtiene a través de la compra directa en las ferias de ganado, adicional a esto tiene unos pequeños cultivos de plátano que también vende en la plaza de mercado.

El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y de su familia, es esta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de un lote de terneros y alimentos para los mismos.

Con el préstamo, este humilde campesino podrá continuar con su actividad y podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Working on the land is one of the hardest jobs there is because of the great effort you have to make every day to make progress. However, Cesar is the type of a man who doesn't get defeated by thoughts of the weather or bad things that might happen; he always manages to look after his family.

Cesar gets up at daybreak so he can travel to the various farms where he works. He alternates between raising and selling cattle directly through cattle markets, and looking after small banana plantations. He sells the bananas at the local market. Now he wishes to obtain more working capital so he can guarantee continuing his businesses and support for his family. Cesar is seeking a loan to buy land and feed for his cattle.

With the loan this humble countryman will be able to continue his work and support his family.

loans.use: Buy land and feed for his cattle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard-working mom who makes a living with her own farm.  She raises pigs where she earns well while her husband works as a construction worker.

Lolita started raising pigs a number of years ago. She works alone from early in the morning when her husband is busy with his work. But, they often work together on weekends. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional piglets. She is determined to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yakubu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Yakubu   With this loan, Yakubu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
La señora Lucelly es un cliente recurrente de los créditos pues ha realizado 9 con un excelente hábito de pago y gracias a estos ha logrado mantener su empresa. 

Recurre otra vez a un nuevo préstamo pues por la época de violencia que atravesó en su barrio muchos de sus productos se echaron a perder y no tiene capital para seguir sacando su puesto de comidas rápidas. 

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carnes, panes, vegetales, platos, cucharas, tenedores, servilletas, empaques y gaseosas para activar su negocio pues es su única fuente de ingreso por eso pide ayuda a los prestadores que le permitan seguir ejerciendo esta labor y no dejar ganar a la violencia pues sueña con seguir emprendiendo y montar sucursales y contar su historia que a pesar del conflicto armado siempre estuvo en pie con su carro de comida.
texts.en:
Señora Lucelly is an experienced borrower, having received nine loans and established an excellent record of repayment. Those loans allowed her to sustain her business, a fast food stall. 

Señora Lucelly is applying for a new loan because she lost a lot of goods during violent disturbances in her neighborhood and lacks the capital to continue operating her business. 

Señora Lucelly will invest the funds from this loan to purchase meat, bread, vegetables, plates, spoons, forks, napkins, plastic wrap, and soft drinks for her business. The fast food stall is her only source of income, so Señora Lucelly is seeking the help of lenders to keep it going and not allow violence to drive her out of business. She hopes to open additional locations and tell others how she continued to work and sell her food amid an armed conflict.

loans.use: to purchase meat, bread, vegetables, plates, spoons, forks, napkins, plastic wrap, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a barbeque business selling to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. This is the second year she has been a member of the SPBD program gaining access to financial assistance. 

Margret plans to use this money to purchase a barbeque grill, tarpaulin tent, boxes of chicken leg quarters, sausages, a large cooler, soya, and tongs to further improve her barbeque stall. Margret hopes to save some of her profits so that she will not only assist in their family's weekly essential needs, but also to continue the operation of her business because it is providing a good income for her.

loans.use: To purchase a barbeque grill, tarpaulin tent, boxes of chicken leg quarters, sausages, a large cooler, soya, and tongs

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a 37-year-old farmer from Kuradawa. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaku, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ishaku can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Ishaku can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average. When asked, Ishaku said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Yohana, Elcana and  Blessing, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru:
Савринисо живет в городе Куляб с мужем, 10-летним и 7-летним сыновьями. Дети учатся в школе, а муж уже несколько месяцев как уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечивать семью. 
Савринисо сейчас 36 лет. У нее есть образование медицинского колледжа, однако по профессии она не работала. Два года назад она начала предоставлять услуги швеи у себя на дому. Ее научила этому делу соседка. За короткий срок Савринисо приобрела своих постоянных клиенток, так как она обращается с ними уважительно и всегда старается выполнить их заказы в указанный срок. Теперь Савринисо решила расширить свою деятельность. Она помимо шитья платьев хочет еще по заказу делать на них оригинальные вышивки. Однако для этого у нее нет подходящей швейной машинки. Поэтому Савринисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить такую машинку.
texts.en:
Savriniso lives in the city of Kulob with her husband and 10-year-old and 7-year-old children. Her children attend school. Her husband has already been in Russia for a few months, where he earns a living and provides for their family.

Savriniso is 36 years old. She received an education at a medical college, but she does not work in that profession. Two years ago, she started offering sewing services out of her home. She learned this trade from her neighbor. In a short period of time, Savriniso has been able to attract her own loyal customers, as she treats them with respect and always does her best to fulfill their orders by the deadline. Now Savriniso has decided to expand her business. In addition to sewing dresses, she also wants to do custom, original embroidery on them. However, she does not have the appropriate sewing machine for this. This is why Savriniso took out a loan to buy a new machine of this type.

loans.use: to buy a modernized embroidery machine.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 61 años de edad, soltera, madre de un hijo y se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
Ella es una persona amable, sencilla, luchadora, constante y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza de lunes a domingo en la calle número 53 de la zona de chasquipampa ubicada en el extremo este de la ciudad.
Rosa es de tez morena, cabello largo trenzado canoso, estatura baja, su rostro dá a conocer el paso de los años y su vestimenta es tradicional (manta y pollera). Cada día ella se despierta con la salida del sol, acomoda sus cajas y se dirige a su puesto de venta, una vez en el lugar abre sus cajas, y acomoda sus golosinas para que estén a la vista de los clientes. Los clientes habituales son transeúntes de la zona que se dirigen a sus fuentes laborales, jóvenes que van al colegio o universidad, etc. La necesidades que tiene Rosa la sitúan en el lugar de trabajo hasta que baja el sol, cuando guarda sus golosinas y retorna a su domicilio. Esta rutina la viene realizando hace 17 años. Su negocio tiene necesidades como la  compra de golosinas por mayor para abaratar costos. Ella piensa ahorrar dinero para arreglar su vivienda y desea en un futuro vender juguetes y material escolar.
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas por mayor y con los beneficios ahorrar para la refacción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 61-year-old single mother of one son who makes her living selling sweets.  She is a simple, kind, perseverant, and hard-working woman who never gives up.   She does business from Monday to Sunday on 53rd Street in the area of Chasquipampa at the edge of the city.  

Rosa is short and dark-skinned with long, grey braids.  Her face shows the passing of the years and she wears traditional clothing (a poncho and skirt).  Every day she gets up with the sun, arranges her boxes and travels to the place where she sells her sweets.  When she arrives there, she opens her boxes and places her sweets where her clients can see them.  Her regular clients are passers-by on their way to work and young people on their way to high school or university, among others.  Her economic situation requires her to be at work until sundown, when she puts away her sweets and returns home.  She has been following this routine for 17 years.  

Her business needs include buying sweets wholesale to cut costs.  She intends to save money to fix her home and she wants to sell toys and school supplies in the future.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy sweets wholesale and use the profits to save money to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy sweets wholesale and use the profits to save money to repair her home

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is married and a resident of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Determination and hard work are what she believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access financial support. It urges her to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. 

Eufemia requested a credit loan from Paglaum MPC, after having been a member, in order to have additional capital to restock her store with basic commodities. 

Eufemia aspires to provide a good quality life for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is 56 years old and widowed with eight children.

Eustaquia earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Eustaquia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eustaquia has been in pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from a general store.

Eustaquia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 52 años  de edad es decoradora de fiestas y trabaja las manualidades, además de vender mercancía general. Su negocio inició desde el año 1988, cuando por la necesidad de generar ingresos familiares se dedicó al comercio y a desarrollar técnicas para ofrecer artículos elaborados con sus propias manos. Sus ventas las realiza directamente al consumidor final diariamente sobre pedidos de su clientela. Su meta es fortalecer su capital de trabajo y las utilidades, además de lograr una educación de calidad de sus hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 14 a 22 años. Su mayor desafío es lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente para responder a pedidos de su clientela; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará suelas plásticas, una vitrina y artículos constructivos, pues hará adecuaciones a sus instalaciones físicas, fortaleciendo su negocio en activo fijo, capital de trabajo e imagen empresarial, lo que se constituye en el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, works making handicrafts and decorations for parties.  She also sells general merchandise.  She started her business in 1988 when, due to the need to generate income for the family, she started out in trade and started to develop skills so that she could make items decorated with her own hands. She makes her sales directly to the end consumers daily on the basis of advance orders.  Her goal is to fortify her working capital and her profits, and to provide her children, aged 14 to 22, with a quality education.  

Rosa's main challenge is to obtain sufficient working capital so that she can respond to her customers' orders.  This is why she applied for this Kiva loan, the first financing she has done with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, she will buy plastic soles, a glass display case, and construction supplies so that she can make some improvements to her store.  This will strengthen the fixed assets of her business, provide working capital and improve the appearance of her business, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy plastic soles, a glass display case, and construction materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a native of Lopez Jaena. She is 54 years old now. She has a fish-selling business that she is hoping will eventually grow and develop so that she can save more money for her retirement.

She is requesting a loan to buy more kilos of fish to sell. She says that if she has a good catch, she can easily get back her investment. She is so thankful to Paglaum because of the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 45-year-old woman who is married to Yos, a 52-year-old man, who works as a civil servant. They were blessed with five children: Orsel, 27, a non-permanent employee at a government institution; Marini, 24, a tenth-semester university student; Triano, 22, an eighth-semester university student; Novendrow, 17, a second grade student of senior high school; and Elin, 5, a first-grade student of elementary school. 

Mariana has a business selling fruits, ice and meat curry at a small stall near her house. Currently, she wants to expand the business by selling various kinds of foods such as pork, rice, fried bananas, fried soybeans and fried tofu. 

She also wants to install electricity in her food stall as this will enable her to run the business until midnight. Due to a lack of money, she has requested an individual loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be used to purchase a food cart and food ingredients, and to install electricity in the food stall.

loans.use: to buy a food cart and food ingredients, and to install electricity in the food stall.

loans.name: Yrsalatkan

texts.ru: Ырсалаткан 53 года, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Дети Ырсалаткан все взрослые и живут независимо. Ырсалаткан  на протяжении 22 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Ырсалаткан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 15 овец и земельный участок, на котором она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры с дальнейшей их реализацией на местном рынке. Экологичные, вкусные овощи и фрукты пользуются большим спросом. Ырсалаткан уже наработала постоянную клиентуру и в целях развития своего бизнеса, а также сбора урожая, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, а также сбор и транспортировку урожая. На полученные доходы от кредита Ырсалаткан планирует провести свадьбу младшему сыну.
texts.en: Yrsalatkan is 53 years old, married and has four children. Yrsalatkan's children are all grown up and live separately. For the past 22 years, Yrsalatkan was been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business with 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Yrsalatkan's hard work, she currently has 4 cows and 15 sheep on her farm, as well as a plot of land on which she grows crop for future sale at the local market. Eco-friendly, tasty fruits and vegetables are in high demand. Yrsalatkan has already developed local customers. For the further development of her business, as well as harvesting her crops, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer as well as to gather and transport her harvest, Yrsalatkan plans to use the earnings from the loan to throw her youngest son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer as well as to gather and transport her eco-friendly produce.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 37 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 1° grado, no pudo continuar porque la situación económica de sus padres eran escazas; es viuda y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, el hijo mayor trabaja y los otros 2 estudian en la escuela y dependen de ella.

Ana toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, actualmente realiza los oficios en una casa de la ciudad, su horario es de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm, además de esto con su hijo siembran maíz.
 
El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, específicamente fertilizantes y veneno ya que sembrarán 1 hectárea de maíz en un terreno que está a 15 minutos de su hogar. 

El sueño de Ana es que todo salga bien con el cultivo; ya que es una fuente de ingresos con la que cubre la alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old, and she could only study until the 1st grade.  She wasn't able to continue because of the poor economic situation of her parents.  She is a widow and she has 3 children in her care.  The oldest child works and the other two go to school and are dependent on her.  

Ana has worked as a housekeeper for her entire life.  Currently, she works in a house in the city from 6:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.  She also grows corn with her son.  

She needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs, especially fertilizer and pesticides since they will plant 1 hectare of corn on a plot of land located 15 minutes from her home.  

Ana's dream is that everything turns out well with the crops since they are a source of income that provides food for her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, especially fertilizer and pesticides since she will plant 1 hectare of corn on a plot of land located 15 minutes from her home

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margie is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Margie has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Margie has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Margie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ana Mélida

texts.es:
Ana tiene 60 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado en la escuela, no pudo continuar por la situación económica de familia por lo cual se dedicó a trabajar, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos que estudian en la escuela del cantón. 

Ana vende en el cafetín de la escuela y vende en el mercado de la ciudad, trabajo que por años han sido el sustento de su familia. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar productos para su tienda, como churros, dulces, sodas, etc. 

Ella sueña hacer más grande el negocio para que al faltar ella sus hijos la puedan administrar y que sea su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Ana is 60 years old and studied up to the 6th grade in school. She was unable to continue due to her family's financial situation and had to begin working. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has four children who go to their local school. Ana sells in the school's snack bar and in the city's market, and her work has sustained her family for years.

Ana will use the loan to buy items for her store such as fried dough, sweets, sodas, etc. She dreams of expanding her business so that if she is unable to run it, her children can do so and have a source of income.

loans.use: to buy items for her store such as fried dough, sweets, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc., for her business.  Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc.,  for her business

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Hajara, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hajara  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Hajara   With this loan, Hajara is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with ten children.  She is 62 years old and lives in New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte.

She operates her rubber farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 35 years. She has requested additional working capital for  rubber farm maintenance.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm.

loans.use: maintain her rubber farm

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Orosta

texts.ru:
Ороста 59-летняя жительница города Куляб. Она замужем за таксиста и ее муж работает в столице. Ороста является матерью четверых взрослых сыновей. Ее сыновьям по 37, 27, 26 и 20 лет. Ее старший сын работает в России, средние сыновья занимаются ремонтом домов, а младший сын студент.
Ороста продолжает ремесло своих предков. Она занимается шитьем курпа и курпача (ватных одеял), которые по сей день используются в быту у таджиков. Ороста начала зарабатывать на этой деятельности 5 лет назад и ей в деле помогает невестка. Как вы видите на фотографии, Ороста шьет на очень старой швейной машинке, которая ей осталось по наследству. Сейчас она хотела бы расширить деятельность и поэтому берет кредит для купли новой модернизированной швейной машинки. Ей действительно нужен данный кредит.
texts.en:
Orosta is a 59-year-old resident of the city of Kulob. She is married to a taxi driver and her husband works in the capital. Orosta is a mother to four grown-up sons. Her sons are 37, 27, 26, and 20 years old. Her eldest son works in Russia , her middle two sons are home repairmen, and her youngest son is a student.

Orosta continues the trade of her forefathers. She sews kurpas and kurpachas (traditional quilt mattresses), which Tajiks use to this very day in their everyday life. Orosta starting earning a living from this business five years ago. Her daughter-in-law helps her with this business. As you see in the photograph, Orosta is sewing with a very old sewing machine, which she inherited. Now she would like to expand her business, which is why she is taking out a loan to buy a modernized sewing machine. She truly needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy a modernized sewing machine.

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en:
Bernagen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a guitar-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her guitar-making business.

Bernagen has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her guitar-making business

loans.name: Daniel Nature

texts.en:
Daniel Nature is a 29-year-old farmer from Kuradawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Daniel Nature is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Daniel Nature can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Daniel Nature can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide the best possible education for my children." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is a 30-year-old farmer from Kuradawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Suleman is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Suleman can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Suleman can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide the best possible education for my children: Kezeya and Faith." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Lady Catalina

texts.es:
Lady es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía variada y asi poder aumentar sus inventarios y su oferta de productos.

Esto le ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y aumentara sus ventas de una manera significativa.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.

Con los recursos que obtiene por este trabajo puede costear su estudio y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lady is a young entrepreneur who wants very much to get ahead and make progress.

For 4 years, she has made a living selling products from catalogues such as clothing, accessories, beauty products and home goods.  She  mostly sells these products to her friends, neighbors, and family members.

Since she was a girl she has had a great affinity for business and sales, so now she has acquired great skills in this field thanks to her friendly nature and the excellent quality of her service.  

She is asking for a loan to buy various merchandise and therefore be able to increase her inventory and offer more products.  This will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and increase her sales significantly.

She hopes to be able to continue moving forward thanks to the kind-hearted people who support her in these kinds of projects.  She can pay for her studies and do her part to pay for household expenses with the profits that she gains from her work.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise such as clothing, accessories, beauty products and home goods to supply her business

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a 26-year-old farmer from Kuradawa. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Yahaya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide better living conditions, and clothing for my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Rosa Mabell

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está acompañada y su esposo es empleado, tiene 2 hijos que aún no estudian en la escuela. 

Rosa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y depende de su esposo en la mayoría de sus gastos. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para cubrir gastos médicos, necesita hacerle exámenes médicos a un hijo suyo. 

Su sueño más grande es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and studied up to the 8th grade.  She has a husband who is employed and they have two children who are not yet in school. Rosa is a homemaker and mostly depends on her husband to cover their expenses. 

She will use the loan to cover medical expenses for the examinations her son needs. Her greatest dream is that her children stay in school and become professionals.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses for her son.

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en:
Faasulu is a 47-year-old woman who is married with six children. 

She runs a large house painting business and has been in this business for more than nine years. 

Faasulu needs a loan to buy a second hand pick-up truck, barrels containing a variety of paint colors, brushes and rollers, a small ladder, and gloves. 

She will use her profits improve her family's living standards and help with the expansion of her business. Faasulu joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a second hand pick-up truck, barrels containing a variety of paint colors, brushes and rollers, a small ladder, and gloves

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Doña Simona es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque, desde hace más de quince años se ha dedicado a la crianza de pollos y gallinas criollas y a la venta de hortalizas, verduras y hierbas comestibles. Viaja al mercado de Chimaltenango para vender sus productos. En sus pagos ha sido bien responsable. Agradece a fape el apoyo brindado y cuenta que con sus ganancias ha logrado apoyar a su esposo en la economía del hogar, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de alimentos para pollos.
texts.en: Simona is a native of the San Martin Jilotepeque region.  For more than 15 years, she has been raising chickens and Creole hens and selling vegetables and edible herbs.  She travels to the Chimaltenango market to sell her products.  She has been very responsible with her payments.  She thanks FAPE for providing her with assistance, and she says that with her earnings she has been able to support her husband with the household finances.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхату 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями на юге Таджикистана. Саёхат очень умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Саёхат работает в средней школе своего района. Она имеет стаж работы более 2 лет. Саёхат преподает младшим классам. Она очень любит свою профессию и считает, что ее профессия самая благородная профессия. Она учится в Педагогическом университете, чтобы повышать свою квалификацию. Саёхат должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sayohat is 24 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents in the south of Tajikistan. Sayohat is a very smart and hardworking woman. Sayohat works in a secondary school in her district. She has been working there for more than two years. Sayohat teaches the younger classes. She really loves her job and considers it to be the most honorable profession. She studies at the Pedagogical University in order to improve her skills. Sayohat needs to pay for her tuition which is why she requesting a loan for 3000 somoni. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Ailen runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, and beverages. 

Ailen requested a loan from NWTY for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu remembers the depression he felt  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Saidu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Saidu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide better living conditions and clothing for my family." With this loan, Saidu is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Saira remembers the extreme poverty that her family faced during a particular year prior to becoming a Babban Gona member. As a Babban Gona member,Saira is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saira can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Saira is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 39 bags per hectare this season due to the soil enhancing inputs she will access with this loan.Saira is hopeful about what the future holds; she hopes that with the increased income as a result of a higher yield, she will be able to move her family to the city.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu remembers the depression he felt  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Hamisu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Hamisu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide a better education for my children." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is residing at Plaridel. She is a widow and has a fishing business. 

She joined PMPC on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing another loan to purchase fish net.  She hopes to sustain her business to sufficiently provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish net

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue is a 51-year-old married woman with nine children. 

She runs a small plantation business selling to the members of her community and also to the public in town. This is her second year with the SPBD program gaining access to financial assistance. 

Sue plans to use this money to  purchase chemicals, fertilizers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, shovels, bush-knives, cement, iron roofing, and paint for the better improvement of her plantation business. 

She hopes to continue maintaining her business as it helps tremendously with their family's weekly essential needs and the improvement of their family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, fertilizers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, shovels, bushknives, cement, iron roofing, and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two large industrial sewing machines, a variety of colorful threads, a box of needles, a measuring tape, ten new pairs of scissors, and rolls of fabric

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a house rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials like woods, nails, paints, etc., for the maintenance of her business.

Elda has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like woods, nails, paints, etc., for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona farmer from kadanya Biyar. Adamu is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is this ambition that led Adamu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Adamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Adamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide better living conditions for my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Ibrahim, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide a better education for my children." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Abdu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Abdu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to provide better living conditions and clothing for my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ayde Patricia

texts.es:
Ayde es una madre a cargo de tres hijos de 17, 18 y 20 años de edad los cuales mantuvo, educo,  cuido, con un negocio de venta de mazamorra, leche, y otros productos típicos de la ciudad de Medellín. 

A pesar de ser una profesión muy humilde es muy dura pro el desplazamiento pues debe cargar pesadas ollas con sus productos yendo de calle en calle en busca de una persona que se acerque a comprarla y gracias a esto a podido brindarle a sus hijos sostenimiento realizando el papel de madre y padre. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía, como maíz. Leche, ollas, bocadillo pues quiere tener mejores ingresos quiere comprar casa, quiere tener un restaurante y un día recordar que empezó desde 0 y logro grandes retos con humildad y sacrificio.
texts.en:
Ayde is a mother who is responsible for three children ages 17, 18 and 20 whom she raised, educated, and cared for with her business selling mazamorra [a drink made from hominy], milk, and other products that are typical in Medellin. Besides being a very humble profession, it is very difficult because it takes her away from home. She carries very heavy jugs of her products, walking from street to street in search of people to sell to. Thanks to her work, she has been able to support her children playing the roles of both mother and father.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as corn, milk, containers, and guava paste because she wants to increase her income.  She would like to buy a house and have a restaurant, and one day remember that she started with zero and overcame huge challenges through humility and sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy corn, milk and guava paste to make her products.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a 30-year-old farmer from Kuradawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Musa is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Musa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Musa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare this season, double the national average of 14. Musa is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Theophilus and Loise. Musa’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are well- educated and have access to professional jobs," he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Terfosa

texts.en:
Terfosa is a 58-year-old widow, who has three children. They are: Melkianus, a 31-year-old man, working; Maxianus, 29 years old and married; and Mardiana, a 17-year-old lady, who is studying in a college. 

Terfosa has a business selling cooking spices such as turmeric, galangal, coriander, candle nut, cinnamon, etc. She has been engaged in the business since early 1981. She initiated the business by offering a coconut rasping service. 

Since the business was improving, her son, Maxianus, then took over that business as Terfosa had the idea of selling cooking spices. Now she has five stalls for trade. She rents three stalls to other traders in the market.

 In order to improve the business, she planned to add more stock such as turmeric and galangal as demanded by clients. However, she does not have much money. This situation led her to request an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on more turmeric and galangal.

loans.use: to buy more turmeric and galangal

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Titus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Irimiya, Benedict,  and  Roda. Titus is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Titus will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Titus can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Titus said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Titus is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Muntari

texts.en: Muntari remembers not being able to pay his children's school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Muntari, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Muntari  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Muntari.   With this loan, Muntari is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Marice

texts.en:
Marice is a 49-year-old widow and blessed with two sons, one named Rio, a 26-year-old working as a  police officer, and the other, Ogan, a 21-year-old college student. 

Marice has a gasoline business which is located in front of her house. She has been engaged the business for years. Even though the income from the business helps her to meet their living expenses,  it is not easy way for her to get the gasoline stock as she has to queue every midnight at the gas station. 

She was thinking to commence a seasonal business selling roasted corn and a traditional beverage named cendol. This business depends on the availability of corn, particularly only in the summer. To start this business, she has requested an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on more gasoline, corn, and cendol ingredients.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline and corn for the businesses

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Hannatu, Phoelina, and  Safiya. Haruna is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Haruna will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Haruna can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Haruna is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Isah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Isah is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Isah will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Isah can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Isah is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Donedu Group

texts.en: Mr. Loun's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottles water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Loun is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Victoria, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Victoria  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Victoria   With this loan, Victoria is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
Paulo Cesar proviene de un hogar de padres separados, vive con su madre quien trabaja como empleada de limpieza en una casa por lo cual recibe un salario mínimo, siendo ella el único sustento del hogar ya que su padre apenas aporta eventualmente con algo de dinero.
Paulo Cesar es el menor de 4 hermanos, ninguno de ellos profesional, por esto es que hay gran expectativa y esperanza en que el logre culminar su carrera.
El es un gran estudiante con un muy buen desempeño académico, por lo que gracias a su esfuerzo sera acreedor de una beca de estudios financiada por una empresa privada, pero esto recién se dará a partir del cuarto ciclo y el esta cursando actualmente el segundo, por lo que de no contar con la ayuda de los beneficiarios de Kiva para continuar estudiando estos dos ciclos, deberá abandonar sus sueños de superación.
El necesita de dicho apoyo y es por esto que invoca y agradece cualquier apoyo que puedan brindarle los beneficiarios de Kiva señalando que estudiara muy duro como hasta ahora para seguir manteniendo el buen desempeño académico que lo llevara a gozar de la beca antes mencionada.
Paulo Cesar tiene el sueño de ser el primer profesional de su familia, abrir un taller de mantenimiento de maquinaria pesada y así ayudar a su madre y familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Paulo Cesar comes from a home where his parents are separated.  He lives with his mother who works as a cleaning woman in someone's home for which she receives a small salary. She is the only one who supports them as his father hardly contributes any money. Paulo Cesar is the youngest of 4 siblings, none of whom is a professional. This is why there are great hopes and expectations that he will be able to complete his studies. 

He is a great student with a very good academic performance, and thanks to his efforts he will be the recipient of a scholarship provided by a private company. But this will be just for the fourth cycle and he is now in the second. Without the help of Kiva lenders to cover these two cycles he will have to abandon his dreams of improving himself. He needs this help and this is why he is requesting and is grateful for Kiva's help, pointing out that he will continue to study very hard to keep up his grades so he will be able to enjoy the previously mentioned scholarship.

Paulo Cesar dreams of being the first professional in his family, opening a heavy machine repair shop, and helping his mother and his family get ahead.

loans.use: to finance the second cycle of his studies in heavy machinery maintenance.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a 45-year-old farmer from Ang/Tafki.  As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Samaila is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Samaila is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Habila,  and  Danladi. Samaila’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married with eight children. Felix is 64 years old and lives in Goin, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Felix operates his sari-sari store (convenience store) to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 for capital to buy more groceries items to sell/retail.

Felix has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Felix hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries items to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 47 years old and is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She generates income through her sari-sari (convenience) store business. Her store has the highest demand in terms of customers in their area. However, because of the demand she needs to buy additional stock for her business. She asks for financial support from PMPC in the amount of PHP 10,000. She is indeed thankful for the support given.

loans.use: To buy stock for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Houyaeck Group

texts.en: Mrs. Veo's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mrs. Veo is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mai-Anguwa

texts.en: Mai-Anguwa Sallaw remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Mai-Anguwa Sallaw, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mai-Anguwa Sallaw  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Mai-Anguwa Sallaw   With this loan, Mai-Anguwa Sallaw is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nonchick Group

texts.en: Mr. Kham's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Kham is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ma. Cora

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Cora works hard to support her family. She has a dry goods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Ma. Cora has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.

Ma. Cora is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items such as personal products, home products and jewelry for her dry goods business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy personal products, home products and jewelry

loans.name: Chanthan's Group

texts.en:
Chanthan was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members - Chanthan and Yun, and they live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Chanthan, age 52, is a widow with three sons and one daughter. One of her children is a garment factory worker, another one works for a car washing service and other two attend school. 

Chanthan is a garment factory worker. She hopes to apply for a loan to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for commuting to work because she always takes a bicycle. Taking a bicycle is tiring and takes time!

Chanthan is on the left, Yun is on the right and next to Yun is her husband.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is skillful at nipa (palm) thatching. She finds it interesting and she works weaving and selling nipa for herself. Jessie makes more profit when she produces and sells thatching on her own.

Jessie is requesting a loan from PMPC to purchase nipa palm to use for thatching. She is part of a cooperative and is very thankful for the help that has been extended to a small-time borrower like her.

loans.use: to purchase nipa palm for thatching

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old and married . To make a living, Jean owns and operates a sari-sari store business. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Jean joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC)  to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan and is requesting a new loan to restock store with basic commodities.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.

Josephine is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Huana Group

texts.en: Mr. Khamphone's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Khamphong is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en: Bulus is a 55-year-old farmer from Ang/Tafki.  As a Babban Gona member, Bulus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bulus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Bulus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Jummai, Dinatu, and  Gad. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is a 29-year-old young client. She is married and the mother of two kids.  She has been growing vegetables for four years, which is how she earns an income. Her business helps her family meet their financial obligations and provides for their weekly essential needs. Her husband helps her in this business. She learned when she was very young how to do this line of work. 

Arzu decided to ask for a loan of 1,200 azn to buy manure and fertilizer to help maintain her vegetable farm and to improve the harvest. 

Her plan is to keep working to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Kamsat

texts.en:
Kamsat, 51 years old and a married woman, has two dependent children and one married child. She lives in the Somrong Tong district of Kampong Speu province. For the last 30 years, she and her husband have been involving in a rice farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. It is the sole source of their income. Her family’s daily income is USD 4.

Kamsat wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Oeut

texts.en:
Oeut is 61 years old and a married woman with only one married child. She lives in a community of Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. In the last 30 years, she and her husband have been involved in a rice farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. Sometimes she sells directly to customers at the markets. It is the sole source of their income. Her family’s daily income is USD 6.

Oeut wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, who appears in this photo, is 31 years old. She has been married since 2006 and she lives with her young son and young daughter in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. Sokha and her husband are garment factory workers.
