Sokha is requesting a loan to buy rice from a farmer in her village for food. Buying rice from a villager is cheaper than buying it in the market, which means that Sokha can save some money.

loans.use: to buy rice for foo

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Celia works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Celia is borrowing PHP 55000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma Gyi Kone Village

texts.en:
Located in Ma Gyi Kone Village in Central Myanmar’s Na Htoe Gyi township, this community currently has 40 village customers, six of whom are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping lead the loan program in the area. Each villager will receive about $190.

A new loan would enable this community to buy crop inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for crops such as bean, betel and onion. This will improve their yields and therefore crop sales, leading to an increase in the farmers' incomes. Villagers hope to use this additional income to dig a well to increase the village's access to clean water. Currently, village members must spend $15 per month and substantial amounts of time to collect clean water to drink.

Pictured above are U Toe, U Han, U Maw, U Chit, U Than, and U Han. They all are CBO members from the Ma Gyi Kone Village. Included in the photo (fourth from the left) is 47-year-old U Han, the father of three children. His 20-year-old son helps U Han farm and the younger two sons (15 and 7 years old) are in school. Last year, U Han Aye took a loan to buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs for his crops. He plans to do the same this year with his new loan. His goal is to expand his farm so that he can pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to help 40 villagers buy high quality inputs to boost crop yields

loans.name: Wbeimar

texts.es:
Wbeimar es un hombre de 26 años de edad con un hijo de 4 años vive con su pareja y se dedica como independiente al negocio de fabricación de cauchos, al ser uno de los pocos proveedores de este servicio tiene la obligación de siempre tener un buen surtido para dar una respuesta oportuna a las demandas de sus clientes, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de los cauchos y realizarles un pequeño mantenimiento a las maquinaria. 

Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y enseñarle el negocio a varias personas para emplearlas y constituir una buena empresa sostenible con el tiempo. 

Es importante apoyar a personas que tiene negocios pocos comunes en el sector pues es un impulso para que con su labor beneficien a tantos clientes lleguen solicitando su servicio y no tengan que optar por realizar largos desplazamiento para adquirir dichos productos.
texts.en:
Wbeimar is a 26-year-old man who lives with his partner and has a four-year-old son. He is self-employed in the tire manufacturing business. He is one of the few service providers of this type, so he must always be well-stocked to fulfil his customers' requests promptly. 

This is why he is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for the production of tires and to make small repairs to his machinery. His dream is to be able to expand his business and teach the trade to various people so he can employ them and build a good company that will be sustained through time. 

It is important to support people who have businesses in less common sectors. It would be a boost that would benefit so many customers, that they would be asking for his service and they would not have to travel as far to get such products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production of tires and elastics.

loans.name: Benigno Jose

texts.es:
A sus 57 años de edad el señor Benigno trabaja diariamente junto con su esposa sin falta alguna en algún día en sus tierras donde cultiva plátano, café, papas y como es un campesino que no tiene muchos conocimientos en vender sus productos en varias ocasiones ha salido perdiendo capital.

Dueño de una gran sonrisa el señor Benigno solicita un crédito para la preparación de tierra por eso invertirá el crédito pedido en la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos y algunos pesticidas para mitigar las plagas que aquejan sus terrenos.

Para el señor Benigno el crédito es de gran importancia pues representara la continuidad del negocio que ha ejercido durante toda su vida y más aún en etapa de cosechar que es la más importante pues debe aprovechar las fechas para que sus terrenos den frutos rápidamente. 

Es padre de 4 hijos y solo sueña con seguir su estilo de vida y trabajar hasta que dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
Señor Benigno is 57 and raises bananas, coffee, and potatoes, working every single day alongside his wife. Señor Benigno is a small farmer who isn't very savvy about selling his produce and at times has found himself losing capital.  

Known for a beaming smile, Señor Benigno is applying for a loan so that he can prepare his land. He plans to invest the loan funds in the purchase of seeds, manure, irrigation, and some pesticides to control pests that infest his land. 

Señor Benigno considers this loan extremely important as it will allow him to continue working the farm he's run his entire life. The loan is especially critical for the harvest season, the most important time of year, and Señor Benigno needs to prepare the land to ensure a productive, early harvest.  

He is the father of four children, and hopes to continue working and living his lifestyle as long as God allows.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for soil preparation, such as seeds, manure, irrigation, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
$800 is offered to Angela to improve her business. She has a mini-shop where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as long pants, shorts, long and short sleeve shirts, shoes and slippers. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2003. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Angela independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy long pants, shorts, long and short sleeve shirts, shoes and slippers

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Samaila, like all Babban Gona members, he can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samaila  is ambitious, he believes that the improved seeds and fertilizer he gets with this loan will help him get a yield that is greater 30 bags/hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Samaila. With this loan, Samaila is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Chaung Son Village

texts.en:
This community is located in Chaung Son village in Central Myanmar’s Thaung Thar township. There are 51 village customers, 5 of whom are Community Based Organization (CBO) committee members who oversee the loan process.

Farmers in this village cultivate crops such as sesame, groundnuts and beans. Villagers also generate income by selling palm sugar to nearby townships. This new loan would help them buy high-quality groundnut, peanut, sesame and bean seeds and hire labor at $4 per day during the harvest. 

Pictured above are U Kyaw, Ma Than, U Khin, U Thet, and U Tun. They are the five committee members from the Chaung Son village CBO. Included in the photo (second from the right) is 42-year-old U Kyaw, the father of two children. He bought green gram, mung bean, and butter bean seeds with his past loan. With his next loan, he will buy fertilizer, which will dramatically increase his crop yields and, therefore, his income from crop sales.

loans.use: to provide 56 villagers with high-quality groundnut, peanut, sesame and bean seeds.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is 48 years old and a married man who has three married children and one dependent child. He lives in a rural area in Kompong Speu Province. To earn a living, Chheng and his wife manage a rice-farming business which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for almost 20 years with an average income of six USD a day. 

Chheng is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy latrine supplies. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in his house now. Chheng’s loan will help his family members improve their sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for his loan through HKL as it has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Aytan

texts.en:
Aytan is 36 years old and divorced with four children ages two, four, and five. She is trying to raise her children without feeling the absence of their father too much. For more than seven years, Aytan has run a local grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She is the only breadwinner in her family and her mother helps her to organize her business. 

Aytan is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to buy more fruit to sell in her store. She will use her loan to keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way. Her loan will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family. Aytan’s loan will help make her store more competitive. She relies on the goodwill of lenders and is thankful to them for supporting her to sustain and develop her small business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell in her store

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: Lidia de 46 años de edad es separada y  tiene 03 hijos dependientes. El grupo “El Rosario” está conformada por 07 socios emprendedores y visionarios. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Hace más de 05 años que Lidia realiza sus actividades y ha mejorado su negocio por la mayor acogida que tiene por sus clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de trusas, medias, bivirís, polos y pantalones. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarles  educación a sus hijos. El deseo de Lidia es de seguir implementando su negocio con prendas de vestir. El grupo “El Rosario” agradece  por hacer posible este crédito. Lidia se encuentra de pie  es la  primera del lado izquierdo y lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en:
Lidia is 46 years old, separated from her husband, and the mother of three children who live with her. She is a member of the "El Rosario" group, along with six other enterprising and visionary women. 

Lidia has run a business selling clothes for more than five years. The business has grown stronger over that time as Lidia has built up a loyal customer base. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of underwear, socks, men's briefs, t-shirts, and pants. 

Lidia's diligent efforts allow her to provide for her children's education. Her ambition is to continue running her clothing business. The "El Rosario" group is grateful to lenders for making this loan possible. Lidia is the woman standing at the left of the photo holding her baby in her arms.

loans.use: for the purchase of underwear, socks, men's briefs, t-shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Dairo Luis

texts.es:
Dairo es un hombre de 38 años de edad trabajador y emprendedor  dedicado a la venta de cerdos en el municipio de Montería.

Es una actividad que atiende todos los días y tiene un corral ubicado a lado de su casa.

Con esta actividad ha podido sostener a su familia, con esfuerzo pero con mucho corazón.

El desea un auxilio económico para realizar la compra de algunos cerdos y de esta forma aumentar su producción.

Con el préstamo, este hombre podrá soñar con un mejor futuro y su familia tendrá la oportunidad de gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dairo, 38, is a hardworking and enterprising man who makes a living selling pigs in the town of Montería.  It's a job he does every day.  He has a corral located next to his house.  He has been able to support his family with this work: with effort but with his whole heart.

He wants some financial help to buy some pigs so he can increase his production.

With the loan Dairo will be able to dream of a better future and his family will have the chance to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to increase production

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en: Bitrus remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Bitrus, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Bitrus  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Bitrus   With this loan, Bitrus is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a married man, 36 years old, with three children, all attending school in different areas. 

He deals in passion fruit-selling and he also does farming as a side business. Mathias started his business in 2004. He started his business to improve on the family’s standard of living and also to increase the family's income. 

Mathias acquired the loan to pay school fees for his children. His clients are people from nearby areas and residents and traders from Kampala. He hopes to build rentals, to expand his passion fruit business, and to start selling more fruits, like mangoes and pineapples.

His challenge are lacking enough capital and traveling long distances to the market. He describes himself as a trustworthy and hard-working man who appreciates the services lenders offer.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.name: María Elvia

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, tiene 2 hijos pero no viven con ella. Actualmente se encuentra acompañada y su pareja trabaja como motorista y nadie  más vive con ellos. 

María trabaja en la venta de productos lácteos, venta que realiza de casa en casa en la colonia, pero también realiza las ventas de estos productos y otros en su hogar, ya tiene un año de realizar esta labor, ella decidió dedicarse a estas ventas al ver la necesidad que existía en la zona donde ella vive, aprendió este negocio gracias a una institución que los capacitó.             

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más productos lácteos como cuajada, queso, crema y otros productos como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite y huevos ya que su negocio ha crecido y se ve en la necesidad de tener más oferta de productos del consumo básico para sus clientes.

Su sueño principal es seguir creciendo en el negocio para cubrir sus compromisos crediticios y seguir contando con el apoyo de las instituciones que los capacita.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, she has a sixth grade education and she has two children, but they do not live with her. She is currently living with her partner who works as a driver and nobody else lives with them.

María sells dairy products for a living, which she does by going door-to-door in the village. She also sells these and other products in her home, which she has been doing for a year. She decided to do this work after seeing that it was needed in the area where she lives. She learned the business thanks to training at an institution.

She needs the loan to buy more dairy products such as curds, cheese, cream and other products like beans, rice, sugar, oil and eggs. Since her business has grown she has seen the need to have more products to supply for her customers' basic needs.
            
Her main dream is to continue growing her business to pay for her credit commitments and to continue to have support from the institutions that train her.

loans.use: to buy more dairy products such as curds, cheese, cream and other products like beans, rice, sugar, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is 68 years old, married, and lives in Plaridel. Determination and hard work are what Dionesia believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, having faith in its mandate to provide true service and assistance to people in need. Abject poverty has been her family's unavoidable fate, and she is greatly motivated to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. After becoming a member of Paglaum MPC, she requested a loan from them in order to have additional capital to purchase basic commodities to sell. Together with her husband, she aspires to provide a good quality life for their family.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother with three children all attending school. Since 2004, she has been operating a retail shop and a green banana (matooke) business. Sarah also is a farmer as a side business. She works seven days in a week and 15 hours per day. Sarah started her shops to get school fees for her children and provide food for her family. Her business challenge is the poor infrastructure that increases her transportation costs to get her matooke to the market. Sarah describes herself as hardworking and honest. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to build rental properties to supplement her income. She has already put a deposit on the plot of land. Her anticipated clients will be residents. In the future, Sarah hopes to build some more rentals for her children and to educate her children. She appreciates the work of lenders and encourages them to increase the grace period they give their clients.

loans.use: to pay for a plot of land

loans.name: Alma Aholibana

texts.es: La señora Alama es propietaria de una panadería en la cual ella juntamente con su esposos se dedican a la elaboración de pan en toda variedad  y aparte de tener sucursales en varias tiendas tienen una panadería en una residencial de la colonia  ya no tiene hijos a su cargo y ha logrado cumplir cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto ya que ha formado parte de FAPE con sus creditos que a solicitado desde que ella  inicio  con su negocio aunque ha tenido momentos duros menciona doña alma con la ayuda de DIOS ha podido salir adelante y en esta ocasión esta solicitando este credito para poder comprar una maquina para pan tostado en varios estilos y es por ello que toca las puertas de FAPE para que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud agradeciendo su confianza y comprensión
texts.en:
Alma is the owner of a bakery where she, together with her husband, works to make all kinds of bread. They also have branches in several stores, and they have a bakery a home in their community. She no longer has children living at home, and she has been able to fulfil each of the goals that she has set out for herself. 

She is a part of the FAPE, and she has been able to get ahead with the help of God and with the loans that she has requested since the beginning of her business. She has had her hard times as well.

Now, she is requesting this loan to be able to purchase a machine for toasted bread of various styles, which is why she is knocking at the doors of FAPE so that they may take into consideration her request. She is grateful for their confidence and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to make toasted bread to sell.

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Hernando es un agricultor independiente hace más de 15 años pues toda su vida se ha dedicado al campo, actividad que la ha servido para proteger y alimentar su familia conformada por su pareja y sus dos hijos de 12 y 9 años que depende en absoluto de él. 

Sueña con salir de deudas que han sido necesarias para mantener su negocio en pie pues el conflicto armado y el fuerte invierno le han ocasionado pérdidas.

Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos para preparar sus tierras como semillas, abonos y riegos muy importantes parta tener una buena cosecha y de excelente calidad. 

Para el es de vital importancia el crédito pues con el podrá cultivar algo esta temporada y tener rentabilidad y más aún que pasa por un proceso de legalizar sus parcelas lo que le genera más gastos y no tiene de donde sacarlos por eso pide de corazón una ayuda para trabajar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Hernando has been an independent farmer for more than 15 years, and he has worked in the fields all of his life. His work has helped him to protect and feed his family, which is composed of his partner and his two children who are 12 and 9 years old, who depend entirely on him.

He dreams of getting out of the debts that he has had to take on in order to keep his business going. The armed conflict and the strong winter have caused him losses. He is requesting a loan to purchase inputs to prepare his land, such as seeds, fertilizers and an irrigation system, which are all very important to have a high quality harvest.

This credit is vitally important to him because he will be able to grow something this season and earn a profit. He will also go through a process to legalize his small pieces of land, which are more expenses for him. He does not have anywhere to draw from for these expenses, which is why he is asking from the bottom of his heart for help to work his land.

loans.use: to purchase products to prepare his land, such as fertilizers, irrigation systems and seeds.

loans.name: Micah Dogo

texts.en: Micah Dogo remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Micah Dogo, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Micah Dogo  is ambitious and is aiming to reap more bags bags per hectare this season.  “My ultimate goal is to ensure my children are well educated and have professional jobs” expressed Micah Dogo. With this loan, Micah Dogo is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Houylangmue Group

texts.en: Mr. Khamkong's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Khamkong is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakomkao Group

texts.en: Mr.Seenakone's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Seenakone is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en: Savuth’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savuth makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family .

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en: Sochea’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sochea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 5 head of cattle to develop a sustainable farming ecosystem

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en: Neang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Neang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y solo aprendió a firmar, está soltero pero tiene 3 hijos que se dedican a trabajar como panaderos.

Pedro es agricultor, trabajo que aprendió de su padre, él cultiva 1 hectárea de maíz, de estas cosechas dependen los ingresos de su familia, también se dedica a la pesca, el lugar donde cultiva se encuentra a una distancia de 20 minutos caminando, sus hijos son panificadores de modo que todos aportan para salir adelante.

El crédito lo necesita para cancelar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultivará, para cancelar a las personas que le ayudarán a limpiar la tierra, y comprará los herbicidas y fertilizantes para lograr un buen crecimiento de la planta y sulfato para que dé una buena cosecha.

Su sueño principal es que Dios le permita obtener una buena cosecha para hacer frente a los compromisos adquiridos y así asegurar tanto la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old, he did not have the opportunity to study, and he only learned to sign his name. He is single but he has three children who work as bakers. 

Pedro is a farmer, which is a job that he learned from his father. He cultivates on 1 hectare of corn, and his family depends on the income from those harvests. He also works as a fisherman in a place that is about 20 minutes walking from his land. His children are bakers, so they all contribute to be able to get ahead.

He needs the loan so that he can pay the rent on the land where he will farm, to pay the people who will help him to clean the land, and he will purchase the insecticides and fertilizers so that his plants will grow well, and sulphate for a good harvest.

His dream is that God allows him to have a good harvest to confront the compromises he has acquired, and to ensure that he has enough food for his family.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he will harvest, to pay the people who will help him to clean the land, and to purchase the insecticides and fertilizers so that the plants will grow well, and sulphate for a good harvest.

loans.name: Parkxebangfai Group

The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Phoukhieng is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Mr. Phonexai is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan was selected to be the group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members--Phan and Sean, and they live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Phan, age 32, is a widow with two children--one son and one daughter. Both of her children are still young.

Phan is a garment factory worker. In addition, she also hires her fellow villagers to grow rice and pays them a fee. She wants to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm. That’s why she decided to apply for a loan!

Phan is on the left, Sean is on the right and next to Sean is her husband.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Nazpari

texts.en:
Nazpari is 55 years old, married and the mother of three kids. She is a housewife and farmer. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing corn and cabbage for 15 years. Growing seasonal fruits is very widespread in Azerbaijan because people have high demand for fresh fruits. They use fruits to make juice, jam, fruit pies and fruit cocktails. People attend her grocery because fruits there are always fresh and tasty.

Her income from this business is 150 AZN. She is applying for a loan of 1200 AZN to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Leona

texts.es:
Leona es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas como almuerzos y desayunos típicos de Colombia.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Leona y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Leona desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos insumos como el pescado para continuar realizando sus recetas.
Con este préstamo podrá capitalizar su negocio.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Leona's a modest and hardworking woman who has devoted a big part of her life to raising her children.

She lives in the town of Puerto Boyacá, where she performs spectacularly in the kitchen, because her business is preparing dishes such as traditional Colombian breakfasts and lunches.  Leona sells these dishes mainly to neighbors in the area who are familiar with her seasoning, and they know that they'll always get delicious, very well-prepared meals.

Leona wants to increase her food sales and to work more comfortably, so she's requesting a loan to buy some ingredients, such as fish, to keep on preparing her recipes.

She'll be able to capitalize on her business with this loan.  It will allow her to get ahead with her business and earn the income she needs to keep on supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fish

loans.name: Phadaeng Group

texts.en: Mr. Gi's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Gi is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
Magrate is a 48-year-old woman married to George, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with seven children. Magrate has been operating a cereal stall for ten years, earning an income of KES 18,600 at the end of every month.

Magrate is now servicing her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy rice, beans, wheat and peas to add to her cereal stock, which is running out.

Magrate plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future and maintain a stable family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, wheat and peas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ponhsavanh Group

texts.en: Mr. Somsuen's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Sohnsun is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fixtures such as chairs, tables, and an industrial oven to improve her business.

loans.name: Sung Group

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur is 30 years old. He is single and lives in his family home with his parents. He is asking for a loan of 1200 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops. Vegetable gardening is a big business for many rural farmers in their region. Seymur grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. His father helps him in this business. Last season he grew cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and watermelons. His monthly income is 180 AZN from this business. Seymur needs your financial support. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest  organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy  a water pump

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Hello! Dairy business is an important source of income to small scale farmers in Kenya. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to provide financial and technical solutions to farmers such as Duncan, the father of one child in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Duncan has been a mixed farmer for the past eight years and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and food crops. The Eldoret area has a cool climate but sometimes experiences long dry spells and this accounts for major crop failure leading to starvation. Duncan is seeking a loan to purchase a high quality dairy cow. Easy availability of feed and fodder all year round makes dairy farming an ideal choice of investment in this region.

Through the loan Duncan will be able to fully satisfy the demand of milk that is in his village and through increased income he will be able to improve his living conditions.

This loan will be very important because it will not only improve Duncan’s life but also he will be able to get manure which will be used on his farm and improve productivity.

Through Juhudi Kilimo Duncan has been trained on how to save money and he plans to use the extra income to increase his business and is planning to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a married man aged 42 years with seven children, five of whom are attending different schools. He lives with his family and mother who is very old and two of his nephews who lost their parents. He is in the produce business where he purchases coffee, beans, and maize, and he also carries out agriculture, which he considers as his side business. He started his business in 1999.

He works seven days in a week and 13 hours per day and started his business because a friend advised him to carry out such a business after he explained to him the good profits one can make out of such a business. He is requesting this loan to buy coffee seedlings for planting this season so that he can increase his productivity. His clients are traders from nearby villages.

His future hopes are to be the leading supplier of coffee in his home area and to educate his children. The main challenge he faces is too much drought, which affects the quality of coffee. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! The above picture presents to you Aggrey, a very hard-working, honest, and ever-smiling man who is only 42 years of age. He hails from a region referred to as a city of champions, Eldoret. This region has produced the best world record holders in athletics and has one of the most favorable weather patterns in the world. 

Aggrey is not your ordinary small-scale farmer, as evidenced by his carefully conceived business plan. He has been practicing farming for the past 15 years and, through those years, he has gained so much experience and is touted as one of the best farmers in his village. He loves dairy farming and has nicknamed his dairy cows 'Lelkina' and 'Barirmet.' 

Aggrey wants to implement his business idea of starting passion fruit farming and, hence, he is kindly requesting a loan, so that he can make his dream come true. Through the training program that Juhudi Kilimo offered Aggrey, he is comfortable that, given the loan, he will turn his life around and he will be able to secure the future of his children. Through the extension services offered by Juhudi Kilimo, he will be able to market his passion fruits to the nearby markets and make good profits. Aggrey plans to sell, not only in the domestic market, but also in international markets and he wants to use the advantage of his proximity to Eldoret International Airport to transport his products.

loans.use: to start passion fruit farming.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.100,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners for her beauty salon.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en:
Roeun was selected to be the group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are three members--Roeun, Sopheap and Chinda, and they live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Roeun, age 21, is single and lives with her parents and brother and sister. She is a garment factory worker.

Roeun wants to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. She commutes to work by taking a taxi, which often costs lots of money. Hence she decided to apply for a loan.

Roeun and her brother are on the right, next are Sopheap and her husband and last is Chinda.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Stephen, a 40-year-old husband, father and farmer from the Eldoret area of Kenya, home to world class Olympic runners. For 10 years Stephen has been practicing farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming.

Stephen was brought up in a challenging environment and he swore that that condition would not repeat itself for his four children. He started dairy farming and has been making profits through selling milk to the market that is already there in his village. By virtue of his background, he has the upper hand in running the livestock business and Stephen believes that “to become a successful dairy farmer one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information and keenness to learn from successful farmers.”

Stephen is kindly requesting a loan to buy a high quality dairy cow that will help him satisfy the increasing demand of milk in his village. Through the loan Stephen will assure his family of a bright future and also be able to support his parents back at home who depend on him. Stephen has been trained by Juhudi Kilimo and has learned the culture of saving and he hopes that through accumulated profits he will save more and comfortably pay back the loan. Stephen hopes that you will make his dream become a reality.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old woman, married to Erastus. who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with one child. Mary operates a retail business shop which has been in operation for eight years, earning her an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Mary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbour and is now servicing her first loan of KES 15,000 and intends to use the entire amount to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and rice to add to her stock, which is running out.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to educate her child and hopes to build a permanent family house as well as becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is 52 years old and lives in Panalsalan. She is married and has a market stall selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been doing this for 15 years. Matilde has requested a loan to buy more seafood to resell. Matilde hopes to save for so she can renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to resell

loans.name: Jessenia Jasbleidy

texts.es:
Al hablar de Jessenia no se puede negar que es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, desde siempre ha querido ser independiente y por motivos de su familia nunca había podido consolidar su idea.

Actualmente desea iniciar con una tienda de abarrotes en un espacio que tiene en su casa ubicada en el municipio de La Dorada, este oficio nunca lo ha practicado, pero siente la confianza para iniciar con él.

Necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de estanterías, una vitrina grande y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar.

Con este apoyo podrá iniciar con lo que será un nuevo comienzo en su vida y está segura que esta tienda le traerá grandes beneficios.
texts.en:
When talking about Jessenia, it can't be denied that she's a strong and hardworking woman.  She has always wanted to be independent but, for family reasons, had never been able to solidify her idea.

Currently she wants to open a grocery store in a space she has in her house, located in the town of La Dorada.  She has never practiced this trade, but she's confident about starting with it.

She needs some financial help to buy shelves, a large display case, and a supply of staple products.

With this support she'll be able to start what will be a new beginning in her life, and she's sure this store will bring her great benefits.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a display case, and staple items

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity appreciates for the previous loan that helped her boost her business. She operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 2 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Purity dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 100,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is married with six children. Anabelle is 42 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City.

Anabelle sells fish to earn a living and has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan to buy more fish to sell.

Anabelle has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Anabelle hopes to increase her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 25 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de un niño de dos años de edad, esta joven vive con su madre y sus hermanos.
 

Luego de terminar el bachillerato, Milagro trabajó 2 años para una librería pero debido a su embarazo tuvo que abandonar el empleo, actualmente sus ingresos provienen de cuidar a otro niño de unos amigos que trabajan en una empresa atunera.
     

EL crédito lo necesita para comprar láminas, clavos y madera para mejorar parte de la vivienda que ha presentado algunos daños en el techo y cuando llueve el agua se filtra.

Su sueño principal es encontrar un empleo formal que le permita obtener ingresos y las prestaciones básicas de ley. Trabajar fuertemente para sacar a su hijo adelante, brindarle una buena educación y que sea una persona productiva para la sociedad, ella es muy consiente que esto lo puede lograr solo a con la ayuda de Dios y con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo  de parte de ella.
texts.en:
Milagro, 25, finished her high school diploma.  This young woman, the single mother of a two-year-old child, lives with her mother and her siblings.

After getting her diploma, Milagro worked in a bookstore for two years but had to leave her job because of her pregnancy.  Now she earns income from taking care of the child of some friends who work for a tuna company.

She needs the loan to buy metal sheeting, nails, and wood to improve part of her house.  The roof is damaged, so it leaks when it rains.

Her main dream is to find a formal job so she can earn an income and have basic benefits under the law, to work hard to get her son ahead, and to give him a good education so he can be a productive person in society.  She's very aware that she can achieve this only with the help of God and with a lot of dedication and effort on her own part.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, nails, and wood

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with kids, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanakombo operated a poultry selling business. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwanakombo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 100,000 she wants to purchase chicks, poultry feed and a motorbike for transportation. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, poultry feed and a motrobike for transportation

loans.name: Inmar Isaías

texts.es:
Inmar es un joven de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en una empresa atunera, solo tiene una hija de 2 años de edad.


Inmar trabaja en el área de limpieza de pescado en la empresa atunera, tiene 2 años de trabajar con ese lugar, anteriormente trabajó en un taller automotriz como auxiliar. Cuando supo que había oportunidad de empleo decidió presentar su solicitud y afortunadamente ingresó en dicha institución, su horario de trabajo es por la noche de 5:00 pm hasta las 2:00 am del siguiente día y el transporte se los proporciona la empresa.  


El crédito lo necesita para comprar algunos muebles como mesas y sillas, además para repellar las paredes de su vivienda, comprará arena y cemento.

Su sueño es mantenerse en este empleo para seguir aportando ingresos a la familia y a si brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Inmar is a young man, 23-years of age. He studied only until the seventh grade. He is in a relationship with a partner who works in a tuna company. He only has one daughter, 2 years old. 

Inmar works cleaning fish in the tuna company, and has been working there for two years. He previously worked in an auto shop as an assistant. 

When he learned about the job opportunity he applied and fortunately he was admitted into the company. His evening work schedule runs from 5:00 pm until 2:00 am of the following day. His transportation in furnished by the employer. 

He needs the loan to buy some furniture like tables and chairs, and for plastering the walls of his home by buying sand and cement. 

His dream is to stay in this job to continue contributing to the family income and provide a better future for his daughter.

loans.use: buy some furniture like tables and chairs, and also to  plaster the walls of his home he will buy sand and cement.

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJAMADJIGUI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments de céréales et de l’habillement. 
Les femmes du groupe DJAMADJIGUI sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente KIATOU, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagne wax chez les grossistes à Dioïla. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djamadjigui Group is made up of married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Massigui, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They participate in the food industry, and in the sale of condiments/spices, cereals, and clothing.

The women of Djamadjigui Group are on their 13th group loan. With the goal of meeting enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The [featured] borrower, Kiato, the second person from left to right [in the photo], is illiterate and is currently selling clothing. She plans to purchase pieces of Wax Hollandais pagne [traditional cloth] from the wholesalers in Dioïla. Her sales are made for credit and cash from her home, to a mixed group of customers. Kiato expects to see a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est composé majoritairement de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à kalaban coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, poissons, viandes, condiments et savons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Alima (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des poissons de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 corbeilles de poissons  en gros au quartier du fleuve de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban Coura à une clientèle mixte. Madame Alima espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Siguidia Group is made up mostly of polygamous women who, on average, are 42 years old and have six children. They all live in Kalaban Coura, a neighborhood in Bamako, and know one another through neighborhood ties. The group members run small businesses selling fish, meat, spices/condiments, and soap. With the goal of expanding their business, the group members have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Mrs. Alima (the woman standing at far right in the photo) has a good reputation in the sale of all types of fish. She plans to use her loan to purchase two baskets of fish wholesale in the neighborhood by the river in Bamako. Her [wares] are sold at retail prices in Kalaban Coura to a mixed group of customers. Mrs. Alima hopes to see an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs from this loan, which will be used to reinvest in the business. Her goal for this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso is to purchase a residential plot [of land].

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 32 years old, married, and blessed with three school-going children. He has been running a photo studio for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES.30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He has applied for his third loan of 33,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to add more stock of shoes to his store and to help pay school fees for his children.                                                                                           

He will used his anticipated business profit to provide for the family basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to add more stock of shoes and to pay school fees

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en: Jerson operates his own piggery business to make a living. He's been in the business for more than nine years and provides for his family. His effort makes him able to send his children to school and helps him buy some home appliances. He always finds ways to improve the piggery and to gain more income in return. With his generated income, his previous loan used for his piggery was successfully repaid. He took a new loan recently to buy feeding supplies.  He wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for his pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilou is 40 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Marilou has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
WONDERFUL LENDERS! Meet Eliud one of the most hardworking man on earth who is 46 years of age and very dedicated and passionate about farming. He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area where out of ten people you meet two are athletes. Eliud never got a white collar job but he did not give up on his dream of succeeding in life. He began farming and has been doing it passionately for 24 years. Through all those years he has been able to support his family financially. Eliud loves dairy farming a lot because Eldoret region has one of the best conditions that support dairy farming because of plenty of dairy food and fodder for dairy cows. He has nicknamed his cows “Maua and salat” which means flower. That is what the cows are to him. They are his flowers.

Because of good weather patterns, plenty of animal food and a ready market for milk products, Eliud is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. He believes that through the loan he will be able to improve his living conditions and be able to secure the future of his children.
Having gone through training with Juhudi kilimo he is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and be able to pay back the loan. Eliud is confident that if you invest in his dream you will be impacting the life of  his family and also his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Melesete

texts.en: Melesete is a 25-year-old married woman with 2 children. She wants to start a pancake and ice-block business selling to the members of her community, especially the school kids. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase a cooking stove, a large frying pan, cooking oil, flour, sugar, baking powder, and containers for her pancake business as well as cordial and plastic bags for her ice-block business. Melesete hopes to make a good profit from her business so that she can provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cooking stove, a large frying pan, cooking oil, flour, sugar, baking powder, containers, cordial, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old single woman and has been blessed with three children who look up to her for their upkeep. She has been a farmer for five years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Mary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES.15,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm plantation.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future and maintain a stable family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Sovannara

texts.en:
Sovannara (in the photo), age 48, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. He has been married since 2000, and has four children - two sons and two daughters.  

Sovannara is a policeman, while his wife sells Khmer noodles. He wants to put addition on his house, which would then be larger for his family members to live. Hence he decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en:
Aygun is 27 years old, married and mother of one kid. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She has managed her small farm for almost four years. Aygun's husband works as  a driver. 

Due to lack of capital for use in her agricultural business, she  would like to access a loan amounting to 700 AZN. She will use her loan funds to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticides for her farm.

She hopes that her farm will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Arlene is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nyetaga Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nyetaga est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles de meilleures qualités, de bananes plantains, d’habits et de la restauration. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente d’ustensiles de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 seaux et 15 baignoires à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coura et en ambulant à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Nyetaga group is composed exclusively of women living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 41 years of age, with five children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, a neighborhood in the district of Bamako, and know each other as neighbors. The group members sell high-quality home accessories, plantains, clothing and cooked food. With the goal of paying in cash to restock their merchandise, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Oumou (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is well-known as a vendor selling  home accessories of the best quality. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 pails and 15 bathtubs in Bamako. She sells retail in Kalaban-Coura and as an itinerant vendor, to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Oumou hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business. Her ultimate goal in this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso is to purchase a land plot to build a house.

loans.use: to buy high-quality home accessories.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 29 years old. She is married to Paul, and together they have been blessed with 2 children, aged 8 and 1.

Priscah runs a food stall (hotel) where she sells different kinds of delicacies to her clients. She has run this business for the last year, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Priscah has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the money to buy dry foodstuffs and other ingredients for cooking food.

With the anticipated profits, Priscah will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy dry foodstuffs and other food ingredients

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram, 31, is a married father of five children between the ages of 1 and 12 years old. For more than six years, he has been earning a living through collecting iron and then reselling it for a profit. Because his wife stays home to care for the children and the house, they have not been able to save enough money to purchase a tractor. 

Now, for the first time, he is requesting a loan for a tractor. This loan will help him to work more efficiently and generate more income. He hopes in the future to be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He is very grateful for the lenders support in growing and maintaining his business.

loans.use: To buy a tractor to work more efficiently and generate more income

loans.name: Lendita

texts.en:
Lendita is a Roma housewife with four children. Her husband cuts wood to sell to others for heating. As with most people residing in Roma communities, they live under very poor conditions and have little hope of changing or improving their conditions. 

Lendita is requesting her first loan in order to renovate their house. This loan will help them achieve something that seems impossible, improving their living standards and quality of life. 

Lendita hopes in the future to be able to find a job and contribute to her family. She promises to pay on time and appreciates  the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business

loans.name: Bechan

texts.en:
Bechan thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him finance his agricultural inputs.

He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders a week later than planned because his buyers didn’t give him his money on time. He is extremely sorry for this.  With the profits, Bechan was able to save some money for the building of his own house. 

He approaches Seva MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of SRD 6.500 to purchase agricultural inputs so he can continue rice production and save more for his future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to continue rice production

loans.name: Blema Tesaa Group

texts.en:
The Blema Tesaa group is composed of four women who have been active for several years. They have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. They sell panties, bowls, plastic products, and jewelry. 

Narh is the group’s representative. She is active in selling underwear. She has over five years of experience and is a married mother of a family with two children. She is here for the first time to request a loan to be able to purchase more panties to be sold.

Narh supports herself and helps her children by covering their particular courses. She also helps in covering day-to-day expenses. For the future, Narh wants to diversify her business by doing business in grocery items and opening a store.

loans.use: to purchase more panties to be resold

loans.name: Ajshe

texts.en:
Ajshe is 58 years old and comes from a Roma community. Based on family tradition passed down from her mother and grandmother, she has a handicraft business in order to generate income. She sells products that people order, and also sells in the market. She loves her job very much and is satisfied with her business and the fact that she is able to work from home. 

Ajshe is in need of a loan to purchase materials for her enterprise. She hopes in the future to be able to open her own shop and expand her business. She wants to thank all of the lenders, and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: María Enma De Jesús

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas de las edades de 18 y 14 años, su esposo la abandonó es por esta razón que tuvo que tomar el papel de padre y a la vez de madre, ella estudió hasta tercer grado ya que sus padres tuvieron que emigrar por el conflicto armado a una isla y allí no había escuela para estudiar es por esta razón que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir, en su vivienda solo vive su padre y sus hijas.
 

María es cocinera en un restaurante, tiene 4 años de trabajar allí ya que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, el trabajo lo obtuvo gracias a una amiga que la recomendó, también tiene una tienda  en su casa y sus hijas están a cargo del negocio cuando ella se encuentra trabajando, su jornada de trabajo empieza a las 7 de la mañana pero ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana a realizar otras actividades en la tienda, luego toma dos buses para el trabajo a una distancia de 4 km.


Este crédito lo necesita para invertirlo en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda, pues hasta el momento no cuenta con este servicio que es de tan ayuda para ella. 

Su plan a futuro es ampliar más la  tienda pues no lo había hecho porque no contaba con la energía eléctrica 	en su vivienda, también desea seguir remodelando su vivienda, que sus hijas sigan estudiando y que sean personar de bien.
texts.en:
María 35 is a single mother of two daughters aged 18 and 14. Her husband left her and for this reason she has had to take on the role of both father and mother. 

She studied up to the third grade because her parents had to emigrate to an island due to an armed conflict. There was no school there so she did not have the opportunity to keep going to school. 

She lives in her home with only her dad and her daughters. 

María is a cook in a restaurant. She has worked there for 4 years. This job generates a good income for her and her family. She got the job through a friend who recommended her. 

She also has a store in her house and her daughters take care of the business when she is at work. 

She starts work at 7am therefore she gets up at 4am to take care of the store. Then she takes two buses to work which is 4 km. away. 

She is requesting this loan to install electricity in her home. Up until now she has not had this service which would be very helpful to her. 

Her future plan is to grow the store which she has not done since she has not had electricity. 

She also wants to keep remodeling the home and hopes her daughters can keep studying and become prosperous people.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home. Up until now she has not had this service which would be very helpful to her.

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 20 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección fabricando lencería, adornos navideños en tela, entre otros, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros) esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar sus clientes actuales.

Claudia manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia is a strong, service minded, hard worker. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children who she has pushed ahead with effort and dedication. 

She has worked in the sewing field for 20 years. She provides sewing services such as making lingerie, Christmas decorations from fabric etc. 

She learned this trade over time and works by herself every day. This is how she helps her husband with the economic needs of their home. 

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, thread, elastic etc.) This will allow her to have enough material available to meet timely deliveries that she has pending and allow her to satisfy her current customers. 

Claudia states that she wants to keep working hard. She wants to expand her business and generate employment opportunities as well as create economic stability in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies for her workshop such as fabric, thread, needles,  lace, buttons etc.

loans.name: José Adán

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato ya que sus padres no podían apoyarlo, y ahora solo su pareja e hija dependen de él.
  

José tiene experiencia en la agricultura ya que siempre ha cultivado la tierra con sus padres, hoy en día él ha sembrado maíz lo cual es el sustento diario para su familia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes ya que su cultivo necesita de la nutrición necesaria para su buen desarrollo.

Su plan a futuro es tener un empleo mejor del que ahora tiene.
texts.en:
José is 22, has a partner and a 2 year old daughter. He studied up to high school and then his parents could no longer support him.  Now his partner and daughter depend on him. 

José has agricultural experience since he has always cultivated land with his parents. Today he has planted corn which sustains his family on a daily basis. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer now that his crop needs the necessary nutrition to grow. 

His future plan is to have a better job than what he currently has.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer now that his crop needs the necessary nutrition to grow.

loans.name: Abrahan Enrique

texts.es:
La actividad de la agricultura es una actividad que se realiza en familia, Abraham sale  junto con su esposa todos los días a realizar su labor cuidando y mirando que cosecha esta lista para venderse o distribuirse. 

Cultiva plátano básicamente pero como todo agricultor se enfrenta con un gran problema y es el alto costo de insumos para preparar la tierra por eso recurre a un crédito que le permita trabajar su tierra y ejercer su humilde labor que beneficia a tantas personas que consumen plátano diariamente.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abonos, riegos y una canoa.

Sueña con poder legalizar su parcela y disfrutar tranquilamente de sus hermosos cultivos.
texts.en:
Agriculture is a business activity that they do as a family.  Abraham leaves together with his wife every day to do the work.  He cares for and watches out for his harvest so that it is ready to sell or be distributed.

He basically grows bananas.  Like all farmers, he faces a big problem, which is the cost of supplies to prepare the land.  That is why he turns to a loan.  The loan will allow him to work his land and to practice his humble work that benefits so many people who eat bananas daily.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, irrigation, and a canoe.  He dreams of being able to get the papers for his land and to peacefully enjoy his beautiful crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, irrigation, and a canoe.
